Title: Junior Data Analyst (Intern)
Description:
Your mission

As Data Analyst, you will support the Data Team in providing data insights to the broader organization. Specifically you will:


Leverage your technical skills to process and analyse data using SQL, Python and Google Sheets
Develop high-performing and insightful dashboards by providing necessary data infrastructure
Assist in defining the vision and objectives for data products by working closely with data and software engineers
Implement automated monitoring tools to ensure data accuracy and reliability
Engage proactively with cross-functional teams to identify and implement pragmatic solutions to business problems
Contribute to the continuous improvement of data analytics processes and best practices


Your profile


Strong skills in SQL, Python, BigQuery and Google Sheets
First experience with Looker, Tableau or other data visualization tools
Ability to process and analyse data effectively to drive insights and action
Exceptional attention to detail, ensuring high standards are maintained across all tasks
Recent graduate (ideally available for a full-time role after the internship)
University degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or a related area
Entrepreneurial drive, genuine curiosity and hands-on mentality
A self-starter with a track record of achievements
Solid organizational and time management skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proficiency in English


Why us?

Join our VC-backed company during this exciting phase of growth. The overarching goal for the Data Analyst role (3 month internship) is to generate insights from data that allows us to track team, process and product performance.

This position is based full-time in our vibrant Berlin office. We believe that working together in a dynamic office setting fosters collaboration and accelerates the growth of our ambitious startup. The internship will convert to a full time Data Engineering role for the right candidate.

Benefits Of Joining Our Team


Ownership of projects with a focus on outcomes rather than time-tracking
Fast-paced yet collaborative culture fostering individual performance and teamwork
Competitive compensation based on experience
Urban Sports Club membership or BVG Ticket subsidized
Hybrid work format
Beautiful office located in the heart of Prenzlauer Berg, Berlin
Regular team building events, company breakfasts and Friday drinks


About Us

We are a Berlin-based start-up that has successfully established a leading B2B marketplace for industrial metals across Europe.

The multi-billion-euro metal trading industry is operated on Excel, PDF and Email. We are on a mission to transform buying and selling in one of the oldest industries of the modern world with seamless and intuitive digital solutions. Our technologies increase liquidity, accelerate transactions, reduce scrapping rates and enhance buying convenience for hundreds of steel and metal distributors across Europe.

As a lean team of young, international, and passionate talents, we've recently reached breakeven and are gearing up for the next phase of growth. We are looking for an outstanding individual who wants to join an exciting early stage start-up.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Contentpass offers website publishers a GDPR-compliant solution to increase digital revenues while enabling users to visit their favorite sites ad- and tracking-free with our cross-publisher subscription. Our network includes over 500 publishers in Europe, such as Axel Springer, Burda, Hearst and Prisa. We are a fast growing startup now expanding into other countries.




With privacy at heart, we always make sure to only collect the absolute minimum of data. Everything happening on our partner’s websites is anonymized, rigorously sampled, and free of any user-identifiable information. Still, as our technology powers a few billion page impressions every month, there’s vast amounts of data to identify e.g. room for performance improvements under certain circumstances.




Join us as a Senior Data Analyst to work right along with the founders to shape our business strategy and product development.




Responsibilities:

Analyze: Deep dive into business, traffic and behavioral data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
Strategize: Collaborate with the founders to develop and implement data-driven strategies that not only optimize core metrics like signup rates and subscriber retention but processes, like e.g. publisher onboarding.
Develop: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of our growth initiatives and product development efforts.
Monitor: Set up and manage monitoring systems to ensure accuracy, reliability, and privacy compliance of all datasets as well as a smooth user experience.
Communicate: Clearly and effectively communicate data insights, recommendations and best-practices to your fellow contentpals.




Qualifications:

Seniority: At least 5 years of experience in similar roles is a must.
Analytical mindset: Strong analytical skills with the ability to extract meaningful insights from large-scale, anonymized datasets.
Technical proficiency: Deep knowledge of data analysis and manipulation languages (e.g. SQL, R or Python), data visualization tools (e.g. Looker Studio or Grafana), as well as data platforms (e.g. BigQuery, ClickHouse, or Snowflake)
Predictive Analytics: Hands-on experience with statistical modeling and advanced analytics techniques.
Growth hacking mentality: A passion for user acquisition, engagement, and retention, with a proactive approach to identifying growth opportunities. 
Communication skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English) with the ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner.
Startup spirit: A self-starter with a strong work ethic, a can-do attitude, and a willingness to roll up your sleeves and get things done. Always eager to learn.




Bonus points:

Entrepreneurial or Web-Developer experience 
Familiarity with subscription business models and digital content monetization strategies.
Background in online publishing or media.




Benefits:

Impact: Make a real difference in a fast-growing startup and shape the future of digital publishing.
Growth: Accelerate your career by working directly with experienced founders and taking on significant responsibilities in a fast growing company.
Learning: Continuously expand your knowledge and skills in a dynamic and innovative environment.
Flexibility: Enjoy a flexible work environment in a full remote setup (CET +/-2 preferred).
Culture: Be part of a passionate and supportive team that values collaboration and open communication.
Ownership: Besides a competitive salary we also offer equity




Interested in becoming a contentpal? Please send your current CV to jobs@contentpass.de. Plus, ideally, a possible start date as well as your salary expectations. Let's go for it! We are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Data Analyst m/w/d (Berlin)
Description:
WILLKOMMEN BEI JUNIQE

Wir sind JUNIQE: Seit 2014 bringen wir Design, Kreativität und Inspiration in das Leben unserer Kund:innen. Jetzt haben wir eine neue Mission: Wir wollen der weltweit führende Online-Marktplatz werden, auf dem Creator ihre Designs selbst veröffentlichen und erfolgreich vertreiben können.

Du willst unsere Mission zum weltweit führenden Online-Marktplatz Vollgas vorantreiben?

Daten sind Deine Leidenschaft und Du hast richtig Bock, große Datenmengen in automatisierte Prozesse zu überführen?

Dann bist DU bei uns genau richtig!

Für unser Büro im Herzen Berlins suchen wir DICH als Data Analyst (m/w/d) in Voll- oder Teilzeit.

DEINE CHALLENGE

Als unser:e Data Analyst:in bist Du verantwortlich für die strategische Analyse und Automatisierung von 1st- und 3rd-Party Daten, um nachhaltiges Wachstum zu ermöglichen. Du glaubst an die Anwendung von LLMs, Machine Learning und Automatisierung, um datengetrieben unsere Kernprozesse im Marketing und Sales zu optimieren.

Dein Verantwortungsbereich Umfasst


Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung & Automatisierung: Entwicklung, Steuerung und Skalierung von Kernprozessen durch effiziente Analyse und Automatisierung
Datenintegration & Verknüpfung: Zusammenführung relevanter Datenquellen zur Steigerung der Effizienz
Reporting & Insights: Erstellung von Dashboards und Reports zur datenbasierten Entscheidungsfindung
Interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit & KI-Innovation: Entwicklung und Implementierung moderner Technologien in enger Abstimmung mit anderen Teams, vor allem Marketing, Produkt und Softwareentwicklung
Technologie- und Trendanalyse: Evaluierung neuer Trends zur kontinuierlichen Optimierung von Datenanalyseprozessen


DEIN PROFIL


Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL mit analytischem Schwerpunkt, Data Science oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung
Du hast Interesse, unternehmerisch zu arbeiten und Einfluss auf die Business-Performance zu nehmen
Du hast Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit großen Datenmengen und deren Verknüpfung aus verschiedenen Quellen
Du hast verschiedene LLM ausprobiert und Machine Learning operativ eingebunden
Du bringst fundierte Kenntnisse in SQL und Erfahrung mit Data Warehousing mit
Du besitzt grundlegende Python-Kenntnisse zur Automatisierung von Analysen und Datenflüssen
Du denkst analytisch und kannst komplexe Daten in strategische Handlungsempfehlungen übersetzen
Du hast Interesse an neuen Technologien und bist motiviert, Dich stetig weiterzuentwickeln
Du hast idealerweise Erfahrung mit Performance-Marketing und SEA, dies ist jedoch nicht zwingend erforderlich
Du bist kommunikationsstark und hast Erfahrung in interdisziplinärer Zusammenarbeit


ARBEITE MIT JUNIQE

Von Tech-Support bis People-Power: Wir bei JUNIQE glauben, dass Kreativität und Mut der Motor echter Veränderung sind. Bei uns kannst Du Deine eigenen Ideen umsetzen und richtig was bewegen.

Unser mega nettes & internationales Team aus Experten verschiedener Fachbereiche gibt jeden Tag alles, um erstklassige Erlebnisse für unsere Kund:innen und Creator zu erzielen. Bei uns ist Teamwork gefragt: wir inspirieren, unterstützen und fordern uns gegenseitig. Wir bringen Erfahrung mit ein oder probieren auch einfach mal Neues aus - Hauptsache Vollgas und mit viel Herzblut!

Unser lichtdurchflutetes und kreativ gestaltetes Büro bietet viel Platz für eine inspirierende Arbeitsatmosphäre. Ob voller Fokus in einem unserer Meetingräume oder Entspannung bei der Pause in unserer bunten Küche.

WARUM DU MIT UNS ARBEITEN SOLLTEST?


Wir sind ein profitables Familienunternehmen und unabhängig von Investoren
Du bist Teil unseres erstklassigen Marketing-Teams, trägst Verantwortung und hast viel Handlungsspielraum
Unsere flachen Hierarchien ermöglichen es uns, agil zu bleiben und schnelle Entscheidungen zu treffen
Wir lieben es, live & in Farbe im Büro zusammenzuarbeiten und setzen auf ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell (mind. 3 Tage Büro) mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, um Dich bei Deinem fachlichen und persönlichen Wachstum zu fördern, einschließlich eines Weiterbildungsbudgets
Tolle Teamevents wie Sommer- oder Halloween-Partys, Get-Togethers im Büro und After-Work-Drinks
Bleibe aktiv: Profitiere vom JobRad und einer vergünstigten EGYM Wellpass Mitgliedschaft
Satte Freibeträge gibt’s auf unsere JUNIQE Produkte und attraktive Angebote bei unseren Partnern
Kaffee, Freigetränke, Snacks und Feierabendbier


Neugierig? Dann raus aus dem 0815 Alltag und werde Teil von JUNIQE!

Über uns

Wir sind JUNIQE. Erfahre mehr unter juniqe.de.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music company worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.




BMG’s Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. We’re transforming how music works, enabling operational stakeholders to make data-driven decisions as well as driving strategic growth, based on a modern data stack.




We are currently seeking a motivated Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin. This position is a maternity cover, initially expected to last until end of April 2026. As an experienced Data Analyst, you will collaborate with senior stakeholders of various departments to facilitate informed decision-making through novel data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!




What you’ll be doing

Process big data volumes, modelling and transforming data (using dbt) from centralized DWHs (Google BigQuery) and external/organizational databases to build strategic analyses and operational KPIs
Utilize data visualization to support decision-making, crafting compelling (Looker) dashboards for key business stakeholders (e.g. Investments, Artist & Repertoire, Marketing, Streaming Sales, Rights & Royalties, Operations)
Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business
Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products




What you bring

Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python
Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau
Broad understanding of data analysis methods and storytelling
Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
Capability to plan and implement projects independently
Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment




It’s also a plus if you have…

Prior music industry experience
Experience with GCP, dbt and Git/Bitbucket
Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
Understanding of statistical methods and ML




What we offer

A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work
Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, company bike leasing, discounts for Bertelsmann employees, among others
Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
Long-term career opportunities for all employees
A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters
Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team




This is us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, color, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
SLAY, founded in December 2022, has swiftly made its mark in the mobile world. The company developed 5 apps and games that reached the #1 spot in the App Store across 3 continents.




Backed by some of the world's most esteemed investors, including Accel, Kevin Weil, Riccardo Zacconi, Scott Belsky, and Ilkka Paananen, SLAY is rapidly growing and reaching millions of users.




Our mission is to create digital life through AI and become the leading company for virtual friends that live, grow and evolve like humans—starting with Pengu. Pengu has become the biggest AI character app with its own IP in the US and Europe.


Tasks


• Data Analysis and Insights: Enable tactical and strategic decision-making by providing insightful analyses, developing predictive models, and creating dashboards.




• Predictive Analytics: Build and interpret predictive models to forecast Lifetime Value (LTV) and user behavior, optimizing marketing spend and strategies.




• Attribution Modeling: Implement and refine attribution models—including probabilistic and multi-touch models—working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data and other privacy-centric attribution methods.




• A/B Testing: Design, analyze, and interpret the results of A/B tests to inform marketing strategies and improve campaign performance.




• Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, user acquisition, and data engineering teams to understand data needs and deliver solutions that drive business objectives.


Requirements


Experience:





3+ years in a role such as Data Analyst or Data Scientist with a strong emphasis on marketing analytics.


Currently employed in a gaming company, actively addressing similar challenges is a plus.





Technical Proficiency:





Strong expertise in SQL and experience with data analysis tools.


Proficiency in a programming language (e.g., Python or R).


Experience with cloud data warehouses is a plus.





Predictive Analytics:





Experience with predictive modeling techniques and forecasting LTV.


Familiarity with machine learning concepts and algorithms relevant to marketing analytics.





Attribution Modeling:





Strong knowledge of attribution models, including probabilistic and multi-touch models.


Familiarity with mobile attribution challenges like SKAdNetwork (SKAN).





Data Visualization:





Proficiency with visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, or Power BI.





Marketing Knowledge:





Deep understanding of performance marketing, user acquisition strategies, and performance metrics (e.g., CPI, CPA, ROAS, K-factor).





Analytical Mindset:





Strong problem-solving skills and a data-driven approach.


Ability to handle complex datasets and extract actionable insights.





Communication Skills:





Excellent verbal and written communication skills.


Ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.





Adaptability:





Proven ability to deliver high-quality results in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment.
Show more

Backed by some of the world's most esteemed investors, including Accel, Kevin Weil, Riccardo Zacconi, Scott Belsky, and Ilkka Paananen, SLAY is rapidly growing and reaching millions of users.


Our mission is to create digital life through AI and become the leading company for virtual friends that live, grow and evolve like humans—starting with Pengu. Pengu has become the biggest AI character app with its own IP in the US and Europe.


Tasks

• Data Analysis and Insights: Enable tactical and strategic decision-making by providing insightful analyses, developing predictive models, and creating dashboards.


• Predictive Analytics: Build and interpret predictive models to forecast Lifetime Value (LTV) and user behavior, optimizing marketing spend and strategies.


• Attribution Modeling: Implement and refine attribution models—including probabilistic and multi-touch models—working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data and other privacy-centric attribution methods.


• A/B Testing: Design, analyze, and interpret the results of A/B tests to inform marketing strategies and improve campaign performance.


• Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, user acquisition, and data engineering teams to understand data needs and deliver solutions that drive business objectives.

Experience:

  • Currently employed in a gaming company, actively addressing similar challenges is a plus.

  • Strong expertise in SQL and experience with data analysis tools.

  • Proficiency in a programming language (e.g., Python or R).

  • Experience with predictive modeling techniques and forecasting LTV.

  • Familiarity with machine learning concepts and algorithms relevant to marketing analytics.

  • Proficiency with visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, or Power BI.


Marketing Knowledge:



  • Deep understanding of performance marketing, user acquisition strategies, and performance metrics (e.g., CPI, CPA, ROAS, K-factor).


Analytical Mindset:



  • Strong problem-solving skills and a data-driven approach.

  • Ability to handle complex datasets and extract actionable insights.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  • Ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.

  • Proven ability to deliver high-quality results in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment.

Title: Market Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Founded in 1999 and listed on NASDAQ in 2003 and HKEX in 2021, Trip.com Group is a leading global travel service provider comprising of Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar.




Across its platforms, Trip.com Group integrates travel resources from industry partners and helps travellers worldwide pursue the perfect trip with exceptional travel products and services.




We have four Customer Service Centres for Trip.com established in Japan, Korea, the UK, and the Philippines, providing 24/7 customer service in 19 different languages.




We have more than 30,000 employees scattered across 30 countries in Asia, Europe, the Americas, and Oceania, striving to expand our global markets and aiming to be the world’s leading and most trusted family of online travel brands that aspire to deliver the perfect trip at the best price for every traveller.




The EU Data Analytics team at Trip.com empowers data-driven decisions with accurate, timely, and actionable insights. As a Market Data Analyst, you’ll collaborate with EU Strategists and cross-functional teams to drive business growth.




Joining the analytics team, you’ll own the full lifecycle—from data extraction to generating insights that inform decisions. Your role will include designing tracking systems, creating visualisations, building dashboards, and conducting exploratory analyses.




In this Role, you’ll get to:

Conduct integrated analyses of market competition, trends, and business performance to generate actionable insights that fuel growth.
Identify key market trends and uncover new business opportunities through comprehensive data analysis.
Monitor and analyse critical business metrics, including demand, supply, traffic, funnel conversion rates, and market share.
Proactively identify and quantify key issues, communicating findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a timely manner.
Partner with strategy, product, growth, and campaign teams across the EU, HQ, and global locations to align efforts with market growth strategies and global business goals.
Own and deliver the weekly market report, providing insights on market developments and tracking the progress of key projects.




What you'll Need to Succeed:

5+ years of experience in data or business analysis, with a proven track record of delivering actionable insights.
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering).
Strong SQL skills are a must, with proficiency in Tableau, Excel, BigQuery, and Hive for data analysis and visualization.
Strong analytical and statistical skills, with the ability to solve problems, uncover insights, and communicate them effectively to stakeholders.
A self-starter with a curious mindset, comfortable working in ambiguity and fast-paced environments with minimal oversight.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills across teams and organizations.
Experience in the travel industry and a portfolio of past work are a plus.




Why Trip.com Group

We offer a stage to unleash your full potential and drive global impact. As an international team, we embrace an open and inclusive culture that supports and respect team members in and out of the workplace. Everyone is on a trip, whether it's a career trip or a life trip. At Trip.com Group, you can define your own trip by setting a goal and celebrate your success by recognizing the progress you have made.

What’s more?




Our rapid business growth in global offers abundant career opportunities at various levels and in multiple functions
Internal transfer is encouraged, and global job rotation program enable you to pursue a global career path and make global impact
We provide learning opportunities to further your career in areas of leadership capability, soft skill and professional expertise.
We encourage flexible work arrangement.
Have fun with company-sponsored greetings and activities at holidays, birthdays, and colorful team events.




Click the link to learn more about What makes Trip.com Group a leading global travel service provider?




Click the link to learn more about This is a Trip Where Both Your Career and Life Can Flourish!




Find out more job opportunities at https://careers.trip.com




Have a good trip, and see you soon!

Title: BI / Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
Distribusion is the world’s leading ground transportation marketplace and gives travelers seamless access to ground transportation online, from search to ticket purchase. We have built a cutting-edge B2B technology platform that connects bus, rail, and ferry operators in 70+ countries with the biggest online retailers, including Google Maps and Booking.com.

We are shaping the future of travel and building the largest global network of transport providers and retailers. We are one of the fastest growing startups in travel, backed by two leading VCs (TQ Ventures & Lightrock), and now, following our recent $80m Series C funding, we are ready to push beyond.

As a BI/Data Analyst for Content at Distribusion, you will play a key role in managing and optimizing strategies to ensure the accuracy, freshness and completeness of content data—such as schedules, prices, and offers—so that we can consistently deliver the best and most competitive offers to our partners. Your work will be crucial in enabling seamless content integration, enhancing data quality and supporting informed decision-making across the organization.

What you will do:


Lead Data Enhancement: Take ownership of continuously enhancing our business intelligence solutions and data models on Google Cloud Platform (GCP). You'll leverage advanced data analysis techniques to drive accurate insights, elevate data quality, and support impactful decision-making across the business
Ensure Data Integrity: Own the review and assessment process for the accuracy, freshness, and completeness of cached content data (schedules, prices, offers). Your work will directly impact the reliability of key business data used for strategic decisions
Optimize Data Integration Strategies: Drive the optimization of strategies for scraping, caching, and integrating content data from carrier systems into our platform. You'll ensure that our databases are consistently complete, accurate, and up-to-date, empowering teams to make data-driven decisions
Cross-Team Collaboration & Impact: Collaborate closely with engineering, data, and product teams to resolve content-related issues and proactively implement improvements that enhance system performance and business outcomes



Workplace:

We are mainly looking for this role to be based within Germany, preferably in our HQ in Berlin. We are a remote-first company, with teams located around the Globe and open for talent based elsewhere.

Who you are:


You bring at least 3 years of experience in Data (BI or Engineering) roles
You possess expertise in clustering techniques, regression analysis (linear, logistic), time-series forecasting, feature engineering, A/B testing, and spatial data analysis
Experienced in interconnecting datasets through join operations, data merging, dimensionality reduction, and network analysis to derive actionable insights
You are very comfortable with data manipulation tools such as SQL and Pandas
You have hands-on experience with data visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI, or Google Data Studio
You are familiar with OOP concepts. Additional experience working with Python is a nice-to-have. Ruby is a plus
Additional experience with Airflow is more than welcome
Experience with cloud platforms, preferably Google Cloud, is an advantage
You are a team player and enjoy working in interdisciplinary teams
You have an analytical mindset and a high degree of problem-solving skills



What you can expect:


You will join a fast-paced travel tech company and take on a rapidly growing industry.
You will take on ownership and responsibility from day one and have a direct impact on the success of the company.
We value agility! We’re constantly updating our tech stack and offer the best possible tools to ensure all of our in-house engineers, partners, and carriers benefit from cutting-edge, efficient solutions.
You will work with global companies. Our product attracts the biggest names in travel technology, such as Booking.com and Google Maps, and national carriers like Amtrak, Deutsche Bahn, Renfe, and SNCF.
You will join an international team of talented and driven people with a clear mission. Expect your colleagues to inspire, support and challenge you every day!
We offer flexible and remote working conditions, relocation opportunities and career growth in a small and developing company.



Our hiring team:

Your Talent Partner (TP) and point of contact is Maya, and the Hiring Manager (HM) is Renato.

For any queries, please reach out to your Talent Partner at (talent@distribusion.com).

Do you want to work on a product that is used by millions of people daily with a high load, availability and scalability, and the most advanced technology? Come join us!

Title: B2B Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
About

Was wir suchen ...

Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir einen B2B Data Analyst (all genders), der nicht nur Zahlen analysiert, sondern auch die richtigen Schlüsse zieht, Trends erkennt und neue Möglichkeiten aufzeigt. Wenn du Lust hast, mit deinem Daten-Know-how Prozesse zu optimieren, smarte Prognosen zu erstellen und unser B2B-Business aufs nächste Level zu bringen, dann freuen wir uns, von dir zu hören.

Wichtig: Für diese Position sind Deutschkenntnisse mindestens auf B2-Niveau ein Muss.

Deine Aufgaben

Du analysierst interne und externe Datenquellen und findest die relevanten Insights.

Du erstellst Forecasts, Demand Plannings und Co., damit alle wissen, wo die Reise hingeht.

Du beantwortest Fragen des B2B-Teams, testest Hypothesen und ziehst proaktiv Schlüsse aus den Daten – immer mit Blick auf konkrete Handlungsempfehlungen.

Du nutzt vorhandene Daten, um Vorhersagen zu möglichen Kampagnen-Ergebnissen zu treffen.

Du baust eine neue Datenstruktur auf, die alle notwendigen Standard-Reportings enthält – gemeinsam mit dem Team legst du fest, wie maximale Transparenz und Sichtbarkeit erreicht werden können.

Du identifizierst Geschäftsmöglichkeiten: Sei es durch das Erkennen von Marketing- und Kampagnentrends, die Verbesserung interner Prozesse oder durch den Einsatz datengetriebener Plattformen, die Vertriebsaktivitäten transparenter machen

Dein Profil

fundierte Erfahrung im Bereich Datenanalyse und Business Intelligence (BI)

umfangreiche Kenntnisse in mathematischen und statistischen Analysen sowie den entsprechenden Tools

schnelle Auffassungsgabe zur Übersetzung komplexer Anforderungen in konkrete Aufgaben

service- und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise mit einer Balance aus Perfektionismus und Pragmatismus

visionäre Denkweise, um Innovationen voranzutreiben und das B2B-Geschäft weiterzuentwickeln

Sicherstellung von Datenintegrität und -genauigkeit sowie Optimierung von Datenprozessen

Erfahrung mit Excel, SQL, Tableau, Power BI und Programmierung in Python oder R

Fähigkeit, komplexe Datenanalysen in umsetzbare Erkenntnisse für Entscheidungsträger zu übersetzen

akademischer Abschluss in einem betriebswirtschaftlichen Fachbereich oder vergleichbare Berufserfahrungen

Warum wir?

Wir sind ein motiviertes Team mit echtem Zusammenhalt – wir unterstützen einander.

Du wirst schnell ein fester Teil unseres Teams und kannst deine Ideen jederzeit einbringen.

Für alles, was deinen Job einfacher oder flexibler macht, bekommst du ein Budget.

Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Home-Office? Machen wir möglich – ganz unkompliziert in Absprache.

28 Urlaubstage warten auf dich – und jedes Jahr bei uns gibt’s einen extra Tag obendrauf (bis max. 30).

Stell dir jeden Monat Gutscheine im Wert von 50 Euro zusammen – bei vielen spannenden Partner*innen.

Dein Deutschland-Ticket? Das übernehmen wir für dich!

Nutze unseren Zugang zu OpenUp für anonyme, professionelle Unterstützung - für deine mentale Gesundheit.

Regelmäßige Team-Aktivitäten, ob im Office oder draußen, gehören bei uns dazu.

Teste Produktneuheiten und Trends, bevor sie auf den Markt kommen.

Sichere dir exklusive Rabatte auf unser Sortiment und viele weitere Vorteile mit Corporate Benefits.

Modernes Arbeiten mit Apple-Produkten und einem funktionalen Arbeitsplatz ist bei uns Standard.

Du willst dich bewerben? Dann los!

Schicke uns deinen Lebenslauf sowie ein kurzes Anschreiben unter der Angabe deiner Gründe, warum DU unser Perfect Match bist.

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Über uns

Als Beauty-Onlineshop bringen wir deine liebsten Produkte kuratierter Marken aus den USA, UK & Co. nach Deutschland und sehen uns dabei auch als Sprungbrett für kleine, noch wachsende Beauty-Brands.

Denn neben unserer Präsenz als Beauty-Onlineshop arbeiten wir hinter den Kulissen auch als Distributor für innovative Marken aus dem Ausland. Dazu gehören Geek & Gorgeous, RevitaLash und The Fox Tan, denen wir neue Zugänge zu bekannten Retailern in Europa eröffnen.

Dabei legen wir mit unserem diversen, jungen Team aus rund 50 Mitarbeitenden den Fokus auf ganzheitliche Marketingkonzepte, um Tag für Tag das Beauty-Game in der DACH-Region weiter zu revolutionieren. Das macht unsere Arbeit weltweit einzigartig und besonders abwechslungsreich.

Die PURISH GmbH fördert aktiv eine Kultur der Wertschätzung von Vielfalt. Daher begrüßen wir Bewerbungen von People of Color, Menschen aller Nationalitäten, Religionen und Weltanschauungen, sexueller Orientierungen und geschlechtlicher Identitäten sowie aller Altersgruppen und möglichen Einschränkungen.

Wir ermutigen alle, sich bei uns zu bewerben!

Nice-to-have skills


SQL
Tableau
Power BI
Python
R
Berlin, Berlin, Germany


Work experience


Data Analyst
Business Intelligence


Languages


German
Show more

Daher begrüßen wir Bewerbungen von People of Color, Menschen aller Nationalitäten, Religionen und Weltanschauungen, sexueller Orientierungen und geschlechtlicher Identitäten sowie aller Altersgruppen und möglichen Einschränkungen.

Wir ermutigen alle, sich bei uns zu bewerben!

Nice-to-have skills

  • SQL
  • Tableau
  • Power BI
  • Python
  • R
  • Berlin, Berlin, Germany

Work experience

  • Data Analyst
  • Business Intelligence

Languages

  • German

Title: Working Student Data Analyst (x/f/m)
Description:
As a Working Student Data Analyst (F/X/M), you have a unique opportunity to revolutionize the financial industry. With our platform Pulsproject we enable SMEs to get business loans without the hassle of a complicated bank check. In our highly dedicated and motivated team, you will analyze our customer data. Join our team in Berlin and start your career at a young and dynamic FinTech company.


Tasks



Data collection and cleansing: Collect, cleanse, and organize data from multiple sources to ensure data quality and completeness.


Data analysis: Analyze data using data analysis tools to identify trends, patterns, and outliers.


Data Interpretation: understandably interpret results and provide clear recommendations for action to team members and customers.


Quality Assurance: Perform data quality checks and validations to ensure data integrity.



Requirements



You are currently studying for a Bachelor's (last year) or Master's degree in the field of Computer science / Finance / Business Analytics in Berlin.


Proficiency with data analysis tools and software such as Excel.


Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to think critically and find creative solutions.


Fluent in written and spoken English, with German language skills rounding out the profile.


Attention to detail and commitment to high-quality work.


Ability to work as part of a team and adapt to changing priorities.



Benefits



Learn from a incredibly talented team of smart, international individuals who are always ready to learn, discover, and implement


An environment that offers room for personal and professional development


A centrally located office in Berlin City West


Being part of a fearless pioneering company that relentlessly strives for new technological breakthroughs


The opportunity to work with smart and passionate people to develop fantastic products


A pet-friendly environment


Salary progression based on length of service with the company


Challenging projects. Exceptional experiences.





At Puls Technologies GmbH, we're not just offering a job; we're inviting you to be part of an exhilarating expedition that is reshaping the very fabric of the SME landscape. If you're passionate about driving growth, igniting innovation, and leaving a lasting impact, your adventure begins here!




You will work with an enthusiastic team of smart, talented people in the heart of Berlin's City West.




Get in touch with us now!




Puls Technologies GmbH

Title: Data Analyst - EU Marketing
Description:
About the team:

We are on a mission to build the ultimate go-to-market engine. To help us to achieve our mission, we are seeking a Data Analyst to strengthen the Global Analytics Team and support SumUp's strategic Marketing initiatives. This role partners with Marketing leadership to identify business needs, then construct data models, generate reports and dashboards, offer advanced analysis and actionable insights to drive improvement in our online channels. You will make a significant contribution to the business by being a valued business partner, a member of an experienced data team and by actively participating in the development of the analytics chapter.

What you'll do:


Create efficient data models that track Online Marketing funnel performance and KPIs, from ad spend to product activation.
Use data to drive analysis and actionable recommendations to shape Marketing program design, operations, and strategy
Partner with Marketing leadership and Strategic Finance to set performance targets, define KPIs, create scalable reporting and forecasts, and provide insight to drivers of pacing against goals
Collaborate closely with Senior Leadership to develop and evaluate Marketing strategies based on data-aware insights and qualitative analysis
Develop advanced dashboards to facilitate self-service analytics for the Marketing teams as well as SumUp Leadership
Drive strategic data OKRs aligned with SumUp's business goals, such as ICP analysis and readout
Partner with Analytics Engineers to ensure that data is properly collected, stored, processed, and accessible for analytics


You’ll be great for this role if you have:


A good understanding of marketing data flows, processes and industry level analytical practices (attribution models, cohorts)
Experienced in an analytical role at a high-growth tech company, including at least 1 year of hands-on experience with data analytics, data model design, dbt, and collaborative development using Git
Hands-on experience in developing advanced dashboards following industry best practices, preferably using Tableau
The ability to analyze Online Marketing and GTM needs and turn them into KPIs, insights, data models, and dashboards
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with the ability to identify trends and key insights from unclear data.
Excellent communication skills and a strategic mindset to effectively collaborate with leadership
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to apply quantitative analysis and logical reasoning to inform and influence business decisions


Why you should join SumUp:

🌍 Opportunity to work with SumUppers globally on large-scale fintech products used by millions of businesses worldwide, from our Berlin office. This involves an office-first setup.

🌈 Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: Be part of a workplace that values and promotes diversity, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone's perspectives are respected and embraced

📚 A dedicated annual L&D budget of €2,000 for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education.

🚀 Enrolment onto our VSOP program: You will own a stake in SumUp’s future success

💶 A corporate pension scheme where we match up to 20% of your contributions

🔄 30 Days Sabbatical: Enjoy the unique opportunity to take a well-deserved break with our 30 days sabbatical benefit after completing 3 years of employment with SumUp.

🔗 Referral Bonus: Earn additional rewards by referring talented individuals to join the SumUp team.

🚵🏾‍♂️ Numerous other benefits such as Urban Sports Club subsidy, Kita placement assistance, relocation assistance, subsidised office lunches.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by Company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

About us:

SumUp is a leading financial technology company, founded in 2012 with the goal of empowering small businesses around the globe. We’re the financial partner of choice for more than 4 million merchants in over 35 markets. We collectively build, plan and fine-tune the technology that drives SumUp and empowers small businesses around the world.

We believe in the everyday hero. Those who have the courage to follow their passion and who have the strength and determination to realise their dreams. Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their business. With a founders mentality and a 'team-first attitude' our diverse teams across Europe, South America, and the United States work together to ensure that small business owners can be successful doing what they love.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don’t tick every box, it’s ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

Title: Working Student Data Analytics (f/m/d)
Description:
Upvest, founded in 2017, enables any financial institution to offer great investment experiences to its customers. Upvest is an investment firm regulated by the German supervision authority (BaFin). The company currently employs 160+ people across Europe with its headquarters based in Berlin, Germany.

The company is backed by the world’s largest venture capital funds and investors including Bessemer Venture Partners, BlackRock, Earlybird, HV Capital, Notion Capital, and ABN Amro Ventures, as well as by renowned fintech entrepreneurs (including Maximilian Tayenthal, founder of N26, and Felix Haas, founder of IDnow).

We’re looking for fintech enthusiasts to join us in creating the financial infrastructure of tomorrow. We’re building the first European Investment API to enable any financial institution offering a wide range of efficient and transparent investment products, such as stocks and ETFs in nominal, portfolio, and fractional form. Our mission and vision is to make investing as easy as spending money.

We’re based in Berlin but are also open to hiring remotely in Germany or Estonia for this role. If you're currently based elsewhere but would like to move to Germany, we’re happy to support your relocation.

Your Mission

At Upvest, you'll become an integral part of our Data Management community where Analysts, and Engineers collaborate to learn and grow together. Moreover, our integrated organisational structure provides you with the opportunity to work closely across finance, product, engineering, finance, and operations areas.

This Role Will Give You The Opportunity To


Data Analysis and Insights: Dive into complex datasets to extract valuable insights and trends that drive data-informed decisions, ensuring our B2B offerings are optimised for success.
Client Data Analysis & Customised Reporting: You'll conduct in-depth analysis of client data to provide actionable insights and create custom reports and data visualisations tailored to our B2B clients' specific needs, enabling them to make informed decisions and gain a competitive edge.
Data Architecture and Tools: Collaborate on data architecture projects with a primary focus on achieving 100% data consistency. Utilise advanced tools such as DBT, BigQuery, and Looker, prioritising data quality and integrity in all data modelling and analysis tasks. This approach enhances our ability to meet client needs by ensuring consistent and reliable data.
Cross-Functional Impact: Collaborate with various teams, including developers and product managers, to seamlessly integrate your data-driven insights into our B2B products and services, driving continuous improvement.
Data Strategy Implementation and Product Enhancement: Play a pivotal role in executing our data strategy, ensuring that data-driven solutions are seamlessly integrated into our B2B offerings, and work to enhance our financial APIs and services based on data-driven insights that meet our clients' evolving needs. Additionally, actively support the initiative to transform our data into a standalone product, leveraging your analytical skills to develop valuable insights and features that can be marketed and sold to a wider audience, thus expanding our revenue streams and market presence


Job Requirements


Data-Driven Impact: You will play a crucial role in our data analytics team, contributing to data collection, cleaning, and analysis. By developing analytical models, interpreting trends, and presenting your findings, you will help shape our business intelligence solutions and drive our data capabilities forward.
Variety of Data Challenges: You'll face a diverse range of data tasks, working with various data sources. Your role will involve creating comprehensive dashboards, tackling data mining and analysis projects. Regular team discussions will provide opportunities to present your innovative solutions, fostering a collaborative environment focused on excellence and continuous improvement in data analysis.
Collaboration: Expect a collaborative environment where you'll work closely with talented professionals across different teams, including developers, product managers, and financial experts. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do.
Continuous Learning: You'll enjoy ongoing opportunities for professional development. We provide comprehensive training programs, workshops, and resources to enhance your data analysis skills and keep you at the forefront of industry trends.
An experienced team and culture driven organisation: Despite the early stage of the company, we have assembled a world-class team with lots of experience across all key domains that we require for our success, from banking and risk to regulatory, legal and compliance to product and engineering. The organisation is also full of people who have successfully scaled companies before, who understand the importance of live and breath culture and “people first”.


Minimum Requirements


Graduate or current master's student in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related fields, with at least 2 semesters completed.
Ability to understand technical information quickly, derive insights, and devise solutions.
Ideally, you have already gained practical experience in conducting quantitative analysis (e. g. experience abroad, internships) and are interested in financial data
Familiarity with statistical techniques, data visualisation, and database management is advantageous.
Experience with Business Intelligence (BI) tools such as Looker or PowerBI.
You have good knowledge of SQL and Python (PySpark, pandas, scikit-learn) or other programming languages
A self starter with a strong sense of ownership for your work and an ability to iterate quickly
A team player who is excited about working with a diverse range of colleagues
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
Based in Berlin (where our office is located) to experience the unique team culture at Upvest
Eligibility to work in Germany


Why Upvest?


Greenfield projects. We’re building something quite complex and a first in Europe. This means we’re working with cutting-edge technologies and with no legacy code.
Wellbeing. At Upvest, everyone has access to our in-house coach where you can have regular sessions to support you personally and professionally.
Development. In keeping with one of our core values, ‘Learn and Grow’, every Upvenger has access to a development budget. In line with one of our other values, ‘Own the Outcome’, how you choose to make the most of it, is up to you.
Flexibility. We work in a hybrid setup with the team distributed around Germany and Europe. We give you the choice (and budget) to spend your time where you are most comfortable and productive, either at home or the office. You choose.


Our Values


Learn and grow. We aim high to shape our future. We give and request honest feedback knowing that we develop together. Progression over Perfection.
Team first. We make it easy for others. We value our differences and are open to others' opinions. We win and celebrate together! Team over Egos.
Own the outcome. Whether we win or we lose, we stand together. We are proactive and get the job done. Outcome over Process.
Tell the story. We always start with the why. We share knowledge to empower others. Transparency over Complexity.


Upvest is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Merge Mansion
Description:
We are a mobile game company, based in both Helsinki and Berlin, creating world-class entertainment by building a portfolio of hit games. Since our launch in 2020, our first chart-topping game Merge Mansion has been entertaining over 55 million players worldwide, and we have grown into a team of over 200.

Our mission is to entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades, with our games, and also through our creative marketing, community, and beyond – while having fun with it.

We’re ordinary people crafting extraordinary games with passion and ambition, united by our culture of trust, psychological safety and wellbeing.

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to make the much-loved hit game Merge Mansion even better by conducting in-depth data analyses and presenting findings to a wide range of different stakeholders. You’ll join a multidisciplinary feature team for Merge Mansion and work closely with game development teams to provide valuable data insights and analyses that support their efforts.

More about Metacore crafts: https://metacoregames.com/our-crafts

Responsibilities


Supporting product managers and designers by finding insights through quantitative and qualitative analysis, as well as ideating and monitoring the impact of our product decisions
Proactively analyzing our game data to spot opportunities for improvements and growth that will guide our game design and monetization strategies
Designing and evaluating experiments
Driving decision-making through in-depth statistical modeling and analyses, and well-crafted presentations for both technical and non-technical team members
Building and maintaining dashboards, version-controlled tools and reports
Designing analytics tracking events that help us better understand our players and features
Designing data pipelines in cooperation with our data engineering team
Spreading best practices to elevate our data team’s success



Requirements


Prior work experience as an analyst in the F2P gaming industry
Proficiency in SQL and coding skills in a scripting language like Python or R
Hands-on experience in data modeling and cloud data warehouses such as Snowflake, BigQuery, or Redshift
Practical know-how of some BI tools such as Looker, Qlick, Tableau, or similar
Solid knowledge of industry-standard statistical analyses like A/B testing
Proactive mindset with a focus on identifying and working on high-impact tasks
A curious personality complemented by strong teamwork skills



In addition to these, it would be nice but not mandatory for you to have these as well:


Extensive experience in applying data science methods from concept to production
Practical knowledge in metrics/semantic-layer and/or dbt
A degree in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or Engineering



What We Offer


Workplace where we aim high, without taking ourselves too seriously
Autonomy and accountability with support to foster professional development
Great opportunities to grow with the company
Work-life balance and strong emphasis on wellbeing
Approachable leaders with low ego
Flexible hybrid workplace where people enjoy working at the office



Basics


Location: Helsinki, Finland or Berlin, Germany
Relocation: Relocating to Finland or Germany expected, full support provided
Work model: Mix of office and remote work
Working language: English



Our equal opportunity statement

To entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades, we need diverse teams that understand our diverse audiences. The key to unleash our creativity is a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture of trust where Metacoreans from all walks of life can be themselves. We celebrate our differences and believe they are the strength that drives us forward.

We are committed to offering equal opportunities for all, regardless of background, age, race, color, ethnicity, religion, disability, gender, sexual orientation, family status, education, socioeconomic status or any other characteristic. We build and maintain a workplace and industry free of harassment and discrimination.

We also aspire to have DE&I as a fundamental part of our game design process to enable us to create even better and more inclusive games, communities and entertainment.

If you require any support or have specific needs during the application process, please don't hesitate to let us know. We look forward to hearing from you!

Our culture

Our culture is based on trust, psychological safety and wellbeing. At Metacore, autonomy and accountability go firmly hand in hand, and we cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace where you can be yourself.

We are collaborative and humble, and think “we” before “me”. We enable focus through transparency and ownership. We aim high, and aspire to be nothing less than the best game company in the world to work for.

To create even better games, communities and entertainment, we welcome talent with diverse experiences, who are passionate about their roles and bold in their ambition.

We have collectively defined our culture and values, and we uphold them together, every day.

Read more about our culture: https://metacoregames.com/culture
Show more

  • Proactively analyzing our game data to spot opportunities for improvements and growth that will guide our game design and monetization strategies
  • Designing and evaluating experiments
  • Driving decision-making through in-depth statistical modeling and analyses, and well-crafted presentations for both technical and non-technical team members
  • Building and maintaining dashboards, version-controlled tools and reports
  • Designing analytics tracking events that help us better understand our players and features
  • Designing data pipelines in cooperation with our data engineering team
  • Spreading best practices to elevate our data team’s success


Requirements

  • Prior work experience as an analyst in the F2P gaming industry
  • Proficiency in SQL and coding skills in a scripting language like Python or R
  • Hands-on experience in data modeling and cloud data warehouses such as Snowflake, BigQuery, or Redshift
  • Practical know-how of some BI tools such as Looker, Qlick, Tableau, or similar
  • Solid knowledge of industry-standard statistical analyses like A/B testing
  • Proactive mindset with a focus on identifying and working on high-impact tasks
  • A curious personality complemented by strong teamwork skills


In addition to these, it would be nice but not mandatory for you to have these as well:

  • Extensive experience in applying data science methods from concept to production
  • Practical knowledge in metrics/semantic-layer and/or dbt
  • A degree in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or Engineering


What We Offer

  • Workplace where we aim high, without taking ourselves too seriously
  • Autonomy and accountability with support to foster professional development
  • Great opportunities to grow with the company
  • Work-life balance and strong emphasis on wellbeing
  • Approachable leaders with low ego
  • Flexible hybrid workplace where people enjoy working at the office


Basics

  • Location: Helsinki, Finland or Berlin, Germany
  • Relocation: Relocating to Finland or Germany expected, full support provided
  • Work model: Mix of office and remote work
  • Working language: English


Our equal opportunity statement

To entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades, we need diverse teams that understand our diverse audiences. The key to unleash our creativity is a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture of trust where Metacoreans from all walks of life can be themselves. We celebrate our differences and believe they are the strength that drives us forward.

We are committed to offering equal opportunities for all, regardless of background, age, race, color, ethnicity, religion, disability, gender, sexual orientation, family status, education, socioeconomic status or any other characteristic. We build and maintain a workplace and industry free of harassment and discrimination.

We also aspire to have DE&I as a fundamental part of our game design process to enable us to create even better and more inclusive games, communities and entertainment.

If you require any support or have specific needs during the application process, please don't hesitate to let us know. We look forward to hearing from you!

Our culture

Our culture is based on trust, psychological safety and wellbeing. At Metacore, autonomy and accountability go firmly hand in hand, and we cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace where you can be yourself.

We are collaborative and humble, and think “we” before “me”. We enable focus through transparency and ownership. We aim high, and aspire to be nothing less than the best game company in the world to work for.

To create even better games, communities and entertainment, we welcome talent with diverse experiences, who are passionate about their roles and bold in their ambition.

We have collectively defined our culture and values, and we uphold them together, every day.

Read more about our culture: https://metacoregames.com/culture

Title: User Growth Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Founded in 1999 and listed on NASDAQ in 2003 and HKEX in 2021, Trip.com Group is a leading global travel service provider comprising of Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar.




Across its platforms, Trip.com Group integrates travel resources from industry partners and helps travellers worldwide pursue the perfect trip with exceptional travel products and services.




We have four Customer Service Centres for Trip.com established in Japan, Korea, the UK, and the Philippines, providing 24/7 customer service in 19 different languages.




We have more than 30,000 employees scattered across 30 countries in Asia, Europe, the Americas, and Oceania, striving to expand our global markets and aiming to be the world’s leading and most trusted family of online travel brands that aspire to deliver the perfect trip at the best price for every traveller.




We are seeking a User Growth Data Analyst to join our User Growth Team, a group dedicated to expanding and engaging our customer base. In this role, you will optimize customer communication channels, analyse performance, and develop strategies to improve onboarding, engagement, and retention. The ideal candidate is data-driven, analytical, and passionate about creating seamless customer experiences.




In this Role, you’ll get to:

Analyse new user acquisition, retention, LTV, and CRM performance to identify growth opportunities and improve onboarding, engagement, and retention strategies.
Monitor and optimize CRM activities (e.g., campaigns, incentives, referral programs) and communication channels using key metrics and customer segmentation based on behaviour, demographics, and preferences.
Conduct in-depth research using large datasets in BigQuery to test hypotheses, uncover trends, and provide actionable recommendations.
Define and track KPIs for CRM projects, analysing factors that drive performance and applying statistical techniques to validate results.
Collaborate with HQ BI teams to ensure accurate data collection and reporting, and present findings with actionable insights to stakeholders.
Partner with cross-functional teams to drive data-informed decisions and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.




What you'll Need to Succeed:

5+ years of hands-on technical experience in user growth, CRM, or retention-focused roles, with strong SQL skills a must, statistical knowledge, and proficiency in tools like Tableau, Excel, or BigQuery.
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, or Business).
Proven ability to perform qualitative and quantitative analyses, identify root causes, and deliver actionable insights with a user-focused mindset.
Experience analysing user acquisition, retention, LTV, and CRM performance to drive growth strategies.
Excellent communication and storytelling skills, able to present findings clearly to stakeholders of all technical levels.
Strong attention to detail, ownership, and a structured, results-driven approach to problem-solving.
Experience in the travel industry and a portfolio of past work are a plus.




Why Trip.com Group

We offer a stage to unleash your full potential and drive global impact. As an international team, we embrace an open and inclusive culture that supports and respect team members in and out of the workplace. Everyone is on a trip, whether it's a career trip or a life trip. At Trip.com Group, you can define your own trip by setting a goal and celebrate your success by recognizing the progress you have made.

What’s more?




Our rapid business growth in global offers abundant career opportunities at various levels and in multiple functions
Internal transfer is encouraged, and global job rotation program enable you to pursue a global career path and make global impact
We provide learning opportunities to further your career in areas of leadership capability, soft skill and professional expertise.
We encourage flexible work arrangement.
Have fun with company-sponsored greetings and activities at holidays, birthdays, and colorful team events.




Click the link to learn more about What makes Trip.com Group a leading global travel service provider?




Click the link to learn more about This is a Trip Where Both Your Career and Life Can Flourish!




Find out more job opportunities at https://careers.trip.com




Have a good trip, and see you soon!

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Willkommen bei CBTW! Wir sind ein innovatives Team mit über 3.000 Mitarbeitern in 21 Ländern und führend in den Bereichen Strategie & Governance, Software-Engineering, Datenanalyse & KI und mehr.




Als Mitglied unseres Teams bei CBTW arbeitest Du in einem inspirierenden Umfeld an anspruchsvollen Projekten. Wir fördern die Entwicklung der Experten von morgen und schätzen Deine Ideen. Wenn Du bereit bist, die Zukunft der datengetriebenen Transformation mit einem hochmotivierten Team zu gestalten, bewirb Dich jetzt bei CBTW! Zusammen schaffen wir Großartiges.


Aufgaben


Deine Leidenschaft





Analyse fachlicher Anforderungen und Ableitungen analytischer Zielsetzungen für Kund:innen


Zusammenhänge komplexer Geschäftsdaten erzeugen und diese in performanten Reports visualisieren


Self-Service Datenanalysen gestalten sowie die Datenvorverarbeitung


Konsolidierung von Daten zur Ableitung angemessener Handlungsempfehlungen





Dieses Wissen bietet unseren Kund:innen echten Mehrwert. Du bist das Bindeglied zwischen IT und Business. Du konzipierst. Du realisierst. Du treibst voran.


Qualifikation


Dein Talent





Deutsch-Kenntnisse auf C1 Niveau - Beherrschung der Sprache (German Fluency is a must)


Masterabschluss, vorzugsweise in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung


Ca. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics


Technologieerfahrung: Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, Cognos BI, Tools wie Alteryx oder Yellowfin


Erfahrung in R Shiny, KNIME oder Visual Analytics ist von Vorteil


Reisebereitschaft innerhalb der DACH Region





Es ist unwahrscheinlich, dass jede:r Kandidat:in all diese Anforderungen erfüllt. Wenn Deine Erfahrungen anders sind und Du glaubst, dass Du einen Mehrwert für die Position bieten kannst, lass uns gerne darüber sprechen!


Benefits


Unser Versprechen




Wir bieten Dir eine Kultur, die von unseren Führungsleitsätzen angetrieben wird: unternehmerisch, ergebnisorientiert, Eigenverantwortung fördernd und sich gegenseitig zum Erfolg verhelfend. Wir schaffen Transparenz über Unternehmensziele, Zusammenarbeit und Unterstützung durch ein internationales Team auf Augenhöhe. Wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So erhielten wir in 2022, 2023 und 2024 die kununu Auszeichnung „TOP Company“.




Das erwartet Dich bei uns:





Onboarding: Vernetzung ab dem ersten Tag - Welcome Day, Hello Drink, Mentoring-Programm.


Entwicklung: Individuelle Förderung Deiner Stärken - Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, Karrierepfade, Career Committees, Online-Trainingskatalog, internationales Arbeiten mit verschiedenen Kulturen.


Work-Life-Balance: Raum für Deine Lebensplanung - Sabbatical, Remote Working aus dem Ausland, flexible Arbeitsmodelle, Elternzeitprogramme, 30 Tage Urlaub, Feiertagskalender Baden-Württemberg.


Nachhaltigkeit: Unsere Arbeit hat einen positiven Einfluss auf die Umwelt und die Gesellschaft - wir machen unsere Lösungen und Zusammenarbeit jeden Tag nachhaltiger.


Events: Fachliche und unterhaltsame Events - Summer-Tech-Event, lokale Afterworks, Sportevents, Teamevents, Weihnachtsfeiern.


Netzwerken: Verbinde Dich mit internationalen Kolleg:innen - Communities, Lunch Breaks, interne Know-How Sessions.


Fehlerkultur: Teste Dich aus und lerne aus Fehlern - Wir geben Dir Freiraum, mit neuesten Technologien zu arbeiten.


Prämien: Zahlreiche Prämien für zusätzliches Engagement.


Weitere Vorteile: Digitales Mobilitätsbudget, Corporate Benefits, Jobfahrrad, Deutschlandticket, betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement.





Schau Dir unsere CBTW Spotify Playlist an und erhalte einen ersten musikalischen Eindruck von unserem Team: https://open.spotify.com/playlist/44kgWZRt5jmmgppH0qGszg?si=L312ch\_9SMKsCKBcN-EB\_A




Aber genug von uns, jetzt bist Du an der Reihe - Wir freuen uns darauf, Dich kennenzulernen!

Title: Data Analyst - Supply, Sales & Operations (f/m/x)
Description:
Berlin, Germany - Hybrid

HOP ON YOUR NEXT ADVENTURE WITH US!

At Tourlane, we empower travel planners to create travel experiences beyond expectations. We build just the right tools and services to assist them in creating custom itineraries from carefully selected travel elements while delivering exceptional customer care.

Our vision is to provide the best experience in travel, based on our determined spirit and will to win. Our culture centers on impact at speed – emphasizing clarity, precision, and quality. Our customer centricity, dedication to operational excellence, and focus on making a tangible impact define us.

Founded in 2016 by our CEO, Julian Weselek, we have been transforming travel planning in the DACH region and France. Our success is rooted in a highly motivated team, composed of talented professionals from around the world, each contributing unique perspectives and innovative solutions. We are currently seeking Data Analyst focused on our Sales, Supply and Operations. If you are driven to transform the travel industry and enable travel planners to craft unforgettable experiences, we are eager to meet you.

What is the role about?


Deep dive analyses: Conduct detailed analyses of processes in Supply, Sales and Operations. Communicate findings in compelling stories to technical and non-technical audiences. Proactively suggest improvements.
Dashboard Creation: Build interactive reports with Looker.
Develop and implement the entire tracking landscape to understand our customer and run effective A/B tests.
Own data projects from end-to-end. You will manage data pipelines, ensure data quality, model data in dbt, and put them into reports or visualisations in Looker.
Bring ideas to life. We welcome prototyping solutions which generate impact right away.
Work as one team with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and Product Managers to improve our digital customer journey.



The Tools We Use:


Warehousing and ELT: Snowflake, dbt, SQL
Visualisation: Looker (LookML)
Data Sources and Importing Tools: Salesforce, Fivetran
Ad-Hoc Analysis: SQL, R, Python



What will you need to be successful?


You are proficient in SQL and bring previous experience in data analytics, data science, business intelligence or a related field. We welcome applicants with an academic background.
You have knowledge of statistics -- using statistical concepts in testing, modelling, and forecasting
You have knowledge of tracking and A/B testing
You have a strong business mindset and are able to communicate data topics to non-technical stakeholders.
You are able to work independently and have a problem solving mindset.
You like to collaborate with your colleagues. You ask colleagues when you’re stuck and help them out when they are. You discuss ideas and challenges.
Having prior experience in an e-commerce environment is a plus!



YOU ARE THE WORLD


We value your participation in Tourlane's success and complement your cash compensation with a package of employee stock options (ESOP)
Flexible working setup to get the most of your working hours: we offer full flexibility in our Berlin based Hybrid model, however we do expect that you take advantage of our lively Berlin office 2-3 days per week
We share your passion for traveling: enjoy working abroad through our new program
Your wellbeing matters to us: we offer mindfulness classes to take care of your mental health, sessions with Nilo.health
We support all the diverse communities that make us Tourlane: join or create your own Employee Resource Group (ERG) and connect with Tourlaneans
Dog-friendly office: we can’t wait to meet your furry friend!



Sounds interesting? We are excited to get to know you!

Data privacy policy.

Title: Senior Data & Analytics Specialist (w/m/d)
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Job Description


Work closely with the Heat Pump division stakeholders to design, build, and maintain automated data pipelines and ensure the best-in-class reporting infrastructure.
Implement and maintain automated Reporting for different business units to provide visibility and performance tracking across segments.
Develop deep knowledge of customer journey processes and use it to empower the business stakeholders to optimize the conversion funnel and achieve operational excellence.



Qualifications


5+ years of relevant experience in business intelligence, data analytics or similar roles.
Enthusiasm for working in dynamic, rapidly changing environments.
Strong ability to analyse data, identify patterns, and communicate. technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record in automating data pipelines.
Exposure to Python for data analysis (e.g. pandas).
Our BI stack includes Snowflake, Streamlit, Tableau and dbt. Familiarity with the two latter ones is required/desired.
High proficiency in SQL and ETL processes.



Additional Information


The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there’s plenty of room for your ideas.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.



At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.
