  • High proficiency in SQL and ETL processes.


Additional Information

  • The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
  • A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.
  • Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there’s plenty of room for your ideas.
  • Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.


At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: Staff Data Analyst, DATA (m/f/d)
Description:
The role

Our Behavioral Data Squad is a cross-functional team with end-to-end ownership of digital tracking across all markets globally at HelloFresh, from infrastructure all the way to the curated data products. As our Staff Data Analyst, you will play an integral part in ensuring data quality, governance and observability by defining and building the metrics, visualisations, and targets within the squad. You will also be a data detective, deep diving into root cause analyses of tracking discrepancies or anomalous readings, to further drive up trust and adoption.

If you are an expert analyst and a self-starter, with the product-sense to create effective success metrics and use these to inspire trust in a global business, this could be the role for you. Your deep understanding of behavioural tracking infrastructure and data models enables you to identify needs and pain points across Data Infrastructure, Platform, Engineering and Analytics, and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practices across our teams.

What You’ll Do


Accountable for your teams’ data catalogue and delivery documentation
Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the “so-whats” of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams


What You'll Bring


Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


#Data

Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

For insight into our interview process take a look at our recent post here

JR102528

Title: Data & Analytics Consulting - Analyst (m/d/f)
Description:
Who We Are




Oliver Wyman is a global management consultancy working across all areas of industry, financial services, government, and non-profit organizations. Clients approach us with their most significant challenges, and we assemble teams of experts to address each facet of these complex issues. Together, we create breakthroughs that lead to remarkable impact.

Within Oliver Wyman, the Data and Analytics (DNA) division was established in 2017 and is operating across the entire world, with a focus on Europe. We are a dynamic and rapidly growing team of quantitative analytics specialists, collaborating closely with colleagues across the firm to cover a global footprint, working across multiple industries including, but not limited to, Financial Services, Climate & Sustainability, Energy, Retail, and Transportation.

We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and collaborative teams to drive innovation. Our team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and we embrace the unique skills and insights they bring to our work. At Oliver Wyman and within DNA, we are proud of the values we uphold that guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.




What You Will Do




As a member of Oliver Wyman’s Data & Analytics team, you will collaborate with colleagues and clients at all levels from your very first day, helping clients solve their most pressing challenges. Our DNA team is committed to developing tailored solutions for clients around the globe, including designing potential solutions for analytical challenges, implementing various prototypes while also assessing their effectiveness, and engaging in discussions with clients and colleagues to share ideas. Your contributions will be invaluable to delivering impactful results for our clients.

Notable projects include:

Developing an NLP-based machine learning toolkit to predict credit rating downgrades using news articles – click here for more information
Modelling portfolio decarbonization strategies leveraging advanced analytics techniques for large European banks
Optimizing and developing a promotional program using data from historical promotions for an Asian health & beauty chain by deploying a promotion analytics toolkit
Validating a customer-facing GenAI chatbot for an American bank
Developing probability of default and loss models in Python for European and UK-based banks
Identifying supply chain risks by combining multiple live data feeds, and developing and applying a bespoke AI based risk methodology – click here for more information
Developing a next best action model to reduce customer churn for a global telecom company




Why Join Us?




Expect a steep learning curve, as no two projects are ever the same. You’ll have the opportunity to travel internationally, gaining invaluable experiences and insights across different cultures and with access to the latest technologies, you’ll constantly expand your toolkit with each new endeavor.

You won’t be alone on this journey; various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career. You’ll have a dedicated buddy, a career adviser, and a talent manager to help you navigate your professional path. We also care deeply about sustainable work-life quality, providing you with the flexibility to balance your career aspirations with your personal life.

This role will empower you to embrace your curiosity and step out of your comfort zone. You will have the opportunity to work alongside genuine colleagues who measure success by the lasting impact we create together. If you’re excited by challenges and eager to make a meaningful impact, we look forward to welcoming you aboard!




Who Can Apply?




Bachelor's, Master’s, or PhD in a quantitative discipline from a top academic program (Data Science, Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Data-driven mindset and proficiency with numbers, paired with the ability to explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner to clients and colleagues
Ideally, programming skills in Python or R, but more importantly, an eagerness to continuously extend your knowledge of technologies
Strong commitment to teamwork and resilience in a creative and constantly changing environment
Excellent command of German & English (verbal and written)
Interest and experience in financial services and risk management is a plus




How to Apply?




To ensure that we can proceed with your application, we kindly ask you to submit your CV together with all of your academic and practical transcripts. This includes your high school diploma, your Bachelor's (and, if applicable, your Master's) transcripts, along with references from your previous work experiences.

Please be aware that applications with incomplete documents will not be eligible for further consideration in the application process.

If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website or alternatively, apply to attend one of our events, details of which can be found here.

Oliver Wyman is an equal opportunity employer and a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies. To learn more, please follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram or Twitter. Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity employers.




What to expect during the interviews process?




At Oliver Wyman, we want you to shine in your interview. Our process is designed like our work environment — it’s challenging, exciting, and fun.

With a mix of conversational and case interviews, our approach not only helps us to get to know you better, understanding your strengths and interests, but it also enables you to learn more about our people and our business.

If you want to learn more about consulting interviews and start your preparation, please visit our careers page: https://www.oliverwyman.com/careers/entry-level/interview-preparation.html




Oliver Wyman, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is a management consulting firm combining deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise to help clients optimize their business, improve operations and accelerate performance. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit oliverwyman.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.




Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.




Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Company

Payrails is an innovative technology company with a team that has many years of experience in the payment industry and a real-life understanding of the merchants’ needs. We have seen the complexity firsthand and we have learned from all the challenges we've faced. Now we want to help leading technology companies around the world accept payments and build financial services with minimal upfront investments.

Our vision at Payrails is to reimagine payments. We do this by removing heavy reliance on Engineering efforts using composable building blocks that put the control firmly in the hands of our customers. We exist to help our customers become more productive and flexible, impacting directly on their ability to grow.

We are joined in our mission by top-tier investors Andreessen Horowitz, HV Capital, EQT and General Catalyst alongside a great cast of knowledgeable angel investors to enable us to solve the growing complexity of payments.

At Payrails, we are committed to building a team full of the most talented people. Excellence is part of our values and we understand that in order to achieve this, we need to build an environment where skilled people can work openly, collaboratively, and with the utmost trust in one another. We believe people thrive the most when they are fully aware of what the business is trying to achieve, why it is important to the market, and what challenges lie in the way to reaching our goals. In such an environment we believe people can truly excel, grow and enjoy working together. We try hard to be a company where everyone is inspired and feels a sense of responsibility to do the right thing to help us bring our vision to life. Succeeding with us is about finding solutions to the most pressing problems and executing them effectively.

Your Team

At Payrails, our Data team empowers all teams to uncover insights and transform them into actions that enhance the value and impact of our products and solutions. We champion data-enabled decision-making and recognize the importance of using the data as a tool to make optimal decisions.

What You Will Be Doing


You will develop and optimize reports, perform ad-hoc and deep-dive analyses to facilitate data-driven decision making.
You will improve and maintain our reporting data models, enabling self-service analytics across the company..
You will gain insights from the data and utilize them to enhance internal functions performance.
You will work in a highly effective team focusing on increasing the value and impact of our products.


You'll be great for this role if


You have more than 7 years of professional experience in Analytics, Business Intelligence or other related fields.
You have strong SQL skills, and have worked with GoodData, Tableau, Looker, or other Business Intelligence tools.
You have a solid knowledge of statistical techniques: distributions, statistical testing, regression, multivariate testing, etc.
You have experience in data analysis and can handle confidently large datasets
You have a good understanding of data modeling.
You are fluent in English and have excellent communication skills (both with technical and business teams).
Strong analytical and natural curiosity with a desire to explore new ideas, concepts, and ways to improve.
Proactive approach, taking initiative to anticipate needs and drive results independently.


Why You should join Payrails


You can truly create your own path by taking responsibility and implementing your own ideas
We offer visa and relocation support to you and your family where required
We offer a hybrid working environment
You have 27 annual vacation days + 1 day of paid birthday leave for you to have fun and party without any worries!
We get together regularly for team lunches and events
You help us shape the future of payments


At Payrails, we prioritize a culture of inclusivity and diversity, evaluating candidates solely based on their skills and potential, regardless of age, gender, identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds and identities. In line with our commitment to fairness, we kindly request applicants to refrain from including personal details such as a picture, age, or marital status in their CVs.

Title: Principal Data Analyst
Description:
About Fit Analytics Innovation




Fit Analytics Innovation is a leading technology company specializing in innovative and sustainable solutions for the retail industry, based in Berlin and Chicago. Our mission is to revolutionize the online shopping experience by providing accurate sizing and fit recommendations, ultimately reducing returns and enhancing customer satisfaction.




As a trusted partner for e-commerce platforms and retailers, Fit Analytics is dedicated to revolutionizing the online shopping journey. By seamlessly integrating our sizing technology, we empower customers to make informed choices, leading to a more efficient and enjoyable shopping experience.




Our cutting-edge AI solution - Fit Finder - delivers precise size recommendations tailored to individual customers. Our machine learning technology takes brand-specific sizing variations and individual body measurements into account, ensuring a personalized and reliable fit for each shopper.




Our team members come from all around the world, creating a global collective of passionate domain experts dedicated to solving sizing for our partners and their shoppers.







Role Overview:




Embark on an exciting journey with Fit Analytics Innovation as a Principal Product Analyst from our Berlin office, where you'll play a critical leadership role in driving the success of our cutting-edge sizing and fit recommendation solutions.




As a seasoned professional, you will drive strategic decision-making and execution while providing mentorship and thought leadership across the organization. You will lead complex data-driven initiatives, optimize client implementation and performance, and spearhead the ideation and development of advanced insights tools.




Additionally, you will own the vision and delivery of our data science products ensuring alignment with broader business objectives. Your responsibilities will encompass everything from creating and executing A/B test programs to driving performance upgrade projects and driving reporting processes and automation, all while providing invaluable insights that contribute to improving and optimizing every stage of our product development and delivery process.







Key Responsibilities:




Showcase and exemplify to team members a high level of expertise in conducting investigative tasks, providing hands-on support to help clients understand performance and areas for improvement through effective data storytelling. Utilize analytical skills to delve deep into data, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of client needs and challenges.




Proactively generate actionable insights aimed at improving our performance, processes and product features. Employ a data-driven mindset to identify opportunities for continuous optimization and innovation.




Lead the inception and implementation of A/B test programs, demonstrating a clear Return on Investment (ROI), and aligning initiatives with our overarching product vision in close collaboration with our data science and product teams.




Lead tooling and reporting automation initiatives to streamline and enhance accurate, data-centric decision-making in order to ensure a seamless alignment with business objectives.







Requirements and Qualifications:




7-12 years of experience in a product analytics or related role.




Expert proficient in SQL and python.




Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proven ability to generate actionable business strategies.




Proven expertise in A/B testing, data analysis, and experimental design.




Excellent communication and storytelling abilities to convey complex analytical findings effectively to diverse stakeholders.




Hands-on experience with data visualization tools and a deep understanding of data science concepts.




Demonstrated ability to drive innovation and continuous improvement in product analytics processes.




Prior experience in designing and optimizing data pipelines and ETL processes is a strong plus.

Show more

Embark on an exciting journey with Fit Analytics Innovation as a Principal Product Analyst from our Berlin office, where you'll play a critical leadership role in driving the success of our cutting-edge sizing and fit recommendation solutions.


As a seasoned professional, you will drive strategic decision-making and execution while providing mentorship and thought leadership across the organization. You will lead complex data-driven initiatives, optimize client implementation and performance, and spearhead the ideation and development of advanced insights tools.


Additionally, you will own the vision and delivery of our data science products ensuring alignment with broader business objectives. Your responsibilities will encompass everything from creating and executing A/B test programs to driving performance upgrade projects and driving reporting processes and automation, all while providing invaluable insights that contribute to improving and optimizing every stage of our product development and delivery process.



Key Responsibilities:


  • Showcase and exemplify to team members a high level of expertise in conducting investigative tasks, providing hands-on support to help clients understand performance and areas for improvement through effective data storytelling. Utilize analytical skills to delve deep into data, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of client needs and challenges.


  • Proactively generate actionable insights aimed at improving our performance, processes and product features. Employ a data-driven mindset to identify opportunities for continuous optimization and innovation.


  • Lead the inception and implementation of A/B test programs, demonstrating a clear Return on Investment (ROI), and aligning initiatives with our overarching product vision in close collaboration with our data science and product teams.


  • Lead tooling and reporting automation initiatives to streamline and enhance accurate, data-centric decision-making in order to ensure a seamless alignment with business objectives.



Requirements and Qualifications:


  • 7-12 years of experience in a product analytics or related role.


  • Expert proficient in SQL and python.


  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proven ability to generate actionable business strategies.


  • Proven expertise in A/B testing, data analysis, and experimental design.


  • Excellent communication and storytelling abilities to convey complex analytical findings effectively to diverse stakeholders.


  • Hands-on experience with data visualization tools and a deep understanding of data science concepts.


  • Demonstrated ability to drive innovation and continuous improvement in product analytics processes.


  • Prior experience in designing and optimizing data pipelines and ETL processes is a strong plus.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir suchen Dich!

DR. EMI ARPA Skin GmbH steht für moderne, wissenschaftlich fundierte Hautpflege – hergestellt in Deutschland. Gegründet von der in Berlin lebenden Dermatologin Dr. Emi Arpa, verbindet das Unternehmen effektive, hochwertige Inhaltsstoffe mit Fermenten, um wirksame und nachhaltige Lösungen für alle Hauttypen zu schaffen. Vegan und PETA-zertifiziert legt DR. EMI ARPA Skin großen Wert auf Transparenz und Hautgesundheit, mit dem Ziel, eine neue Skincare Ära einzuleiten.

Du bist bereit, dein Talent in einem hoch engagierten Team und einem dynamischen Arbeitsumfeld unter Beweis zu stellen? Du möchtest aktiv etwas bewegen und Teil einer aufregenden Start-up Reise sein? Dann nutze die Chance und werde ein Teil unseres tatkräftigen Teams.

Deine Aufgaben


Analyse großer Datenmengen zur Ableitung strategischer Empfehlungen
Entwicklung und Implementierung von Dashboards & Berichten für datenbasierte Entscheidungen
Durchführung von A/B-Tests & Performance-Analysen für Marketing- und Vertriebskampagnen
Identifikation von Trends, Mustern & Korrelationen in Kundendaten zur Verbesserung der Customer Experience
Unterstützung der Geschäftsführung und ggf. Fachabteilungen mit datengetriebenen Insights & Handlungsempfehlungen
Sicherstellung der Datenqualität & Optimierung von Analyseprozessen
Zusammenarbeit mit IT, CRM, Marketing und anderen Teams zur Integration & Nutzung von Datenquellen


Das Bringst Du Mit


Abgeschlossenes Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Statistik, Mathematik, Data Science oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung
Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse, idealerweise im E-Commerce, Retail oder CRM-Umfeld
Sehr gute SQL-Kenntnisse & Erfahrung mit relationalen Datenbanken
Sicherer Umgang mit BI-Tools wie Tableau, Power BI oder Looker
Kenntnisse in Python oder R für Datenanalysen
Analytische Denkweise & Problemlösungskompetenz
Fähigkeit, komplexe Daten verständlich & zielgruppengerecht zu kommunizieren
Verhandlungssicheres Deutsch & Englisch


Das Bieten Wir Dir


Gestaltungsfreiraum in einem wachsenden Start-up mit Verantwortung und Eigeninitiative
Flache Hierarchien und exzellente Karrierechancen, die deine Entwicklung fördern
Dynamisches Team und regelmäßige Events für ein starkes Wir-Gefühl
Attraktive Lage: Modernes Büro in Berlin-Charlottenburg inmitten lebendiger Umgebung
Exklusive Rabatte auf unsere Produkte sowie vielfältige Weiterbildungsangebote
Fit bleiben: Zuschuss zur Urban Sports Club Mitgliedschaft
Mobilität: Einen Zuschuss zum Deutschlandticket


Über uns

Das klingt ganz nach dir? Dann freuen wir uns über deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung mit Angabe deines frühestmöglichen Starttermins und Wunschgehalts.

Bei Dr. Emi Arpa Skin legen wir großen Wert auf eine Arbeitskultur, in der jeder mit all ihren und seinen einzigartigen Perspektiven und Hintergründen willkommen ist. Vielfalt bereichert nicht nur unser Team, sondern auch unsere Mission, hochwertige Hautpflege für alle zu entwickeln. Daher ermutigen wir Menschen mit unterschiedlichsten Erfahrungen, Fähigkeiten und Identitäten ausdrücklich zur Bewerbung. Bei uns wirst du respektiert, unterstützt und geschätzt, sodass du in einem inklusiven Umfeld dein Potenzial voll entfalten kannst.

Title: Operations Analyst
Description:
This role can be based in either our Berlin DE, or Amsterdam NL office.

👩‍💻👨‍💻 About the role

At Mondu we are moving fast in terms of building new products and processes. Also, we continually challenge our processes and improve them on an ongoing basis. For this, we are committed to a data-driven approach and rely on analytical insights. This role focuses on our core business processes in Operations. This includes reconciliation processes, customer support, and other Finance-related activities. Exemplary projects are setting up dashboards in the Customer Support area or the calculation of AP KPIs.

🚧 What you'll do

Your role is about improving our Operations processes on an ongoing basis. For this purpose, you'll have to gain a good understanding of the business processes we run, define relevant KPIs that allow us to understand the efficiency of them and derive actionable conclusions. The job will require that you are able to connect different data sources, set up dashboards with relevant views, and analytically interpret the analyses.


Analyze current business processes and workflows using SQL / Python to identify areas for improvement and develop strategies to enhance efficiency
Develop and implement process improvements applying methodologies such as Lean, Six Sigma, and Kaizen
Collaborate with various teams to understand their needs and challenges
Develop and present process improvement plans to senior management
Monitor the implementation of new processes and make or propose adjustments as needed
Train staff on new processes and ensure smooth transitions
Collect and analyze data to measure the effectiveness of process improvements
Prepare detailed reports and documentation on process changes
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in process improvement



Requirements

🏅What you need to succeed

Please note: Do not be put off from applying because you believe you cannot tick every box. If you think you can help, and you really want to join our growing and exciting business please get in touch, we would love to hear from you.


At least Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Management, or a related analytical field
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in continuous improvement or a related analytical role
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with proven experience in using SQL or Python to analyze and/or automate processes
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams
Proven track record of successfully implementing process improvements
Proficiency in data analysis and process mapping tools
Strong project management skills



It would be a plus if you also have:


Previous experience working on an operational role.
Certification in process improvement methodologies such as Lean, Six Sigma, or Kaizen



Benefits

🎁 What's in it for you?


€ 1000 per year for you to contribute to your learning & development to help you grow professionally and personally
€300 per year for you to endorse team build, including dinners, games, and events
28 vacation days per year (increasing 1 day every year up to 30)
We welcome you to our office in the center of Berlin or Amsterdam 3+ days a week
Take advantage of our Workation policy, allowing for up to 6 weeks every year of work outside of Germany (some restrictions apply)
Subsidised gym membership to boost your physical and mental well-being
€ 46 per month towards the DeutschlandTicket (for DE role) / public transport (for NL role)
Tax relief for payments into our Business Bike scheme
You can accelerate your career and take ownership of your work and development in a flat hierarchy where 360 feedback is encouraged.



🦸 Are you a Monduneer in disguise?

Working in a truly diverse group makes us stronger and more resilient. Furthermore, it enables an unfair advantage - the opportunity to learn from each other, see different perspectives, and consider a broader range of variables in our decision-making. That is what being a Monduneer is all about.

Thus, regardless of your background, age, disability, gender, parental status, race, religion, sexual orientation, educational background, or any other aspect you feel is a statement of your diversity, we look forward to discussing your role in mind.

If you believe you are a Monduneer in disguise, and it's time for you to shine, submit your application, and we'll take it from there.

💜 Meet Mondu

At Mondu, we have the vision to disrupt and become the leader in B2B payments. We are building a Buy Now, Pay Later solution for B2B e-commerce businesses. Our business will address a new set of customer needs in a vast new market segment. To do so, we will need to re-invent core parts of the payment experience to serve the needs of business customers. Moreover, we will need to listen closely to local customer needs and tailor our approach to the requirements of local customers in Europe.

After hugely successful funding rounds, we are looking to move at a phenomenal pace and this will not be possible without the right people in the team.

Title: Social Media Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Daten über das Social Media Verhalten deiner Zielgruppe faszinieren dich? Du liebst es, aus einer großen, ungeordneten Menge an Zahlen, konkrete Schlüsse zu ziehen und dein gewonnenes Wissen für andere verständlich zu machen? Du bist außerdem detailverliebt und hast Lust neue Prozesse mitzugestalten?




Dann sucht unser Team Dich! Als Social Media Analyst (w/m/d).




Bewirb Dich! Auch wenn das Profil auf den ersten Blick nicht zu 100% passt.


Aufgaben



Auswertung und Analyse von Performance-Daten auf allen relevanten Social-Media-Kanälen


Nutzung von Analyse-Tools (Sprinklr, Google Analytics, Google Looker Studio etc.)


Ableiten und Präsentieren von relevanten Erkenntnissen und Empfehlungen


Optimierung/Automatisierung von Datenverarbeitung und Prozessen


Visuelle Datenaufbereitung & Dashboarding


Unterstützung von interdisziplinären Projektteams


Die Chance, mit einer der weltweit führenden Automobilmarken zu arbeiten



Qualifikation



Expertise im Bereich Social Media Analytics, zusätzliche Kenntnisse in Social-Media-Strategie und Advertising


Ein Gespür für Zahlen


Kompetenz im Umgang mit den aktuell relevanten Social-Media-Netzwerken


Fähigkeit zum Aufbau vertrauensvoller Kund:innenbeziehungen


Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office und eine unbändige Excel-Leidenschaft


Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse


Interesse an der Automobilbranche ist von Vorteil



Benefits



Hybrides Arbeitszeitmodell mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten


Regelmäßige Teamevents


Bis zu vier Wochen im Jahr im EU-Ausland arbeiten


30 Urlaubstage für alle Mitarbeiter:innen


Unbefristeter Vertrag nach 6-monatiger Probezeit


Raum zur Entfaltung und zum eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten in deiner neuen Rolle


Jährliches Weiterbildungsbudget mit individuellem Gestaltungsspielraum





Wer wir sind




Seit 2008 Kreativagentur und Unternehmensberatung mit über 200 sehr guten Leuten in Berlin-Kreuzberg.





Autonomie, Vertrauen und Gestaltungsspielraum sind unsere Vision der modernen Arbeitswelt von morgen.


Wir unterstützen uns gegenseitig und glauben an die kulturstiftende Wirkung von regelmäßigen Teamevents zur beruflichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung.


Diversity, Gleichberechtigung sowie eine gesunde Work-Life Balance gehören zu unseren wichtigsten Werten.


Unser transparenter Feedbackprozess trägt bei uns zu einer offenen und wertschätzenden Kommunikationskultur bei.


Wir wollen zu deinem Leben passen. Zur Unterstützung in jeder Lebensphase bieten wir den vollen Work-Life-Care-Service des Fürstenberg Instituts an.





Wir freuen uns über deine digitale Bewerbung unter Angabe deines optimalen Einstiegstermins.

Wer wir sind


Seit 2008 Kreativagentur und Unternehmensberatung mit über 200 sehr guten Leuten in Berlin-Kreuzberg.

Wir freuen uns über deine digitale Bewerbung unter Angabe deines optimalen Einstiegstermins.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Job Description


Work closely with the Heat Pump division stakeholders to design, build, and maintain automated data pipelines and ensure the best-in-class reporting infrastructure.
Implement and maintain automated Reporting for different business units to provide visibility and performance tracking across segments.
Develop deep knowledge of customer journey processes and use it to empower the business stakeholders to optimize the conversion funnel and achieve operational excellence.



Qualifications


5+ years of relevant experience in business intelligence, data analytics or similar roles.
Enthusiasm for working in dynamic, rapidly changing environments.
Strong ability to analyse data, identify patterns, and communicate. technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record in automating data pipelines.
Exposure to Python for data analysis (e.g. pandas).
Our BI stack includes Snowflake, Streamlit, Tableau and dbt. Familiarity with the two latter ones is required/desired.
High proficiency in SQL and ETL processes.



Additional Information


The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there’s plenty of room for your ideas.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.



At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
CarOnSale is a start-up in the heart of Berlin. As a tech company, we have made it our mission to enable smooth digital processes in the automotive trade across Europe. Join us and develop new, innovative solutions for the B2B sector.

For our Data based at our HQ in Berlin - Schöneberg, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)

Your tasks:

Data Analysis:


Analyse and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights.
Identify opportunities for data-driven decision-making within the organisation.
Define and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success.



Project Leadership:


Lead data exploration projects to uncover actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and define data needs for various business initiatives.



Dashboard Creation:


Develop and maintain dashboards that enable stakeholders to monitor and analyse critical business metrics.



Report Generation:


Generate reports that provide valuable insights to support decision-making across multiple teams.



Stakeholder Management:


Engage with internal stakeholders to ensure their expectations align with our deliverables.
Manage multiple projects simultaneously, setting clear expectations for scope and timeline.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and product managers.



Enablement:


Provide support to enhance daily reporting and analytics tasks within the company.
Offer training and education to team members on data analysis tools and techniques for better decision-making



Your profile


4+ years’ experience as a data analyst
Proven experience in data analysis, interpretation, and visualisation.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Tableau).
Experience working with Python.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects with attention to detail.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Familiarity with Google Analytics & tracking data
Fluency in English (C1)



Nice to have:


Being able to communicate in German



Why COS?


First things first: You’ll be taken seriously from day one and will play an important role in our mission, because we want to disrupt Europe’s automotive market together with you
Growth and development: benefit from a detailed on-boarding program, systematic feedback cycles and individual coaching
Your gear, your choice: you will be provided with a MacBook or Windows laptop and all the hardware and software you need to work
Become a COSie: be part of a motivated team with ambitious goals and enjoy lots of fun, lots of awesome team events and a unique COS team spirit
Truly diverse and inclusive: Diversity is important to you? It is important to us too! Diversity in which everyone feels comfortable, is absolutely central to us



Show more

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.


Who You Are


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
Strong project management skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
EMBRACE THE WORLD: HOP ON YOUR NEXT ADVENTURE WITH US!

We are a lively and diverse team, founded by our CEO Julian Weselek in 2016, currently active in the DACH region and France. Our ambition is to become the leading travel company for authentic, customized, multi-day trips while being mindful of our planet: we are the first travel company in the EU to set near-term carbon reduction targets approved by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi): this is an imperative step toward decarbonization. We are and always will be driving the change in the travel industry for a better tomorrow.

DESTINATION? THE WORLD!

We are discoverers. We are believers in the life-changing power of travel. On our journey we've built the amazing team that we have today - a team that sets the ambition to be remembered for building the future of travel, for consistently changing the norms of the industry and, simply, for staying true to our passion for bringing together the cultures of the world.

What is the role about?


Ultimately, we work to create the best experience in travel, using data to improve our customer experience and our product, increase our marketing reach, and optimize our costs
Own data projects fully end to end. You will manage data pipelines, ensure data quality, model data in dbt, and put them into reports or visualizations in Looker
Bring ideas to life. We welcome prototyping solutions that generate impact right away
Work as one team with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and business users to maintain and improve our data infrastructure
The Tools We Use:
Warehousing and ELT: Snowflake, dbt, SQL
Visualisation: Looker (LookML)
Data Sources and Importing Tools: Salesforce, Internal Applications, Event Data, Fivetran and Airbyte
Ad-Hoc Analysis: SQL, R, Python



What will you need to be successful?


You are proficient in SQL and bring previous experience in data analytics, data science, business intelligence, or a related field. We welcome applicants with an academic background
You have knowledge of statistics - using statistical concepts in testing, modeling, and forecasting
You have a strong business mindset and you are able to communicate data topics to non-technical stakeholders
You are able to work independently and have a problem-solving mindset
You like to collaborate with your colleagues. You ask colleagues when you’re stuck and help them out when they are. You discuss ideas and challenges



YOU ARE THE WORLD


We value your participation in Tourlane's success and complement your cash compensation with a package of employee stock options (ESOP)
Flexible working setup to get the most of your working hours: we offer full flexibility in our Hybrid/Remote model, however we do expect that you take advantage of our lively Berlin office 2-3 days per week
We share your passion for traveling: enjoy working abroad through our new program
Your wellbeing matters to us: we offer mindfulness classes to take care of your mental health, sessions with Nilo.health
We support all the diverse communities that make us Tourlane: join or create your own Employee Resource Group (ERG) and connect with Tourlaneans
Dog-friendly office: we can’t wait to meet your furry friend!



Sounds interesting? We are excited to get to know you!

Data privacy policy.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Werde Teil eines innovativen Teams bei Education Partners als “Data Analyst” (m/w/d)




Bist du begeistert von der Macht der Daten und möchtest entscheidende Einblicke liefern, die den Unternehmenserfolg vorantreiben? Education Partners, ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich der transformativen Bildung, gestaltet das Lernen und Wachsen neu. Mit aktuell 12 hochmodernen Akademien in ganz Europa treiben wir Innovationen in der digitalen Bildung voran.




Was wir bieten:

Hybrides Arbeitsmodell: Genieße die Flexibilität, sowohl von zu Hause als auch in unserem modernen Büro im Herzen Berlins zu arbeiten.
Modernste Technologie-Umgebung: Nutze die neuesten Datenanalyse-Tools und Business Intelligence-Lösungen in einem dynamischen Umfeld.
Wirkungsvolle Arbeit: Deine Analysen und Insights beeinflussen direkt die strategischen Entscheidungen.
Berufliche Weiterentwicklung: Wir fördern kontinuierliches Lernen durch Zugang zu Workshops, Konferenzen und erstklassigen Weiterbildungsangeboten.
Attraktives Gesamtpaket: Profitiere von 30 Tagen Urlaub, einem Remote-First-Ansatz, modernster Hardware und einem wettbewerbsfähigen Gehalt.




Dein Impact:

Datenanalyse & Insights: Du analysierst große und komplexe Datensätze, um wertvolle Insights zu gewinnen, die unser Verständnis von Kundenverhalten, Markttrends und Geschäftsentwicklungen vertiefen.
Dashboard- & Reporting-Erstellung: Du entwickelst aussagekräftige Dashboards und Berichte, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu erleichtern – idealerweise mit Power BI oder vergleichbaren Tools.
Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung: Du identifizierst Potenziale zur Verbesserung interner Prozesse und unterstützt die Fachbereiche dabei, datenbasierte Strategien umzusetzen.
Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen: Du arbeitest eng mit Teams aus Marketing, Produkt und Business Development zusammen, um operative sowie strategische Maßnahmen zu steuern.
Tracking & Datenqualität: Du stellst sicher, dass relevante Daten zuverlässig erfasst werden. Dafür unterstützt du bei der Implementierung von Tracking- und Analyse-Tools wie Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager.
Automatisierung & Skalierung: Du optimierst Datenprozesse, entwickelst Automatisierungen und sorgst für eine effiziente Nutzung der verfügbaren Datenquellen.




Was wir suchen:

Analytische Denkweise & datengetriebenes Mindset: Du hast ein ausgeprägtes Gespür für Daten, erfasst komplexe Zusammenhänge schnell und übersetzt diese in präzise Handlungsempfehlungen.
Tools: Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL und Excel/Google Sheets und kannst große Datensätze effizient analysieren und verarbeiten.
Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung: Du kennst Dich mit Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder Looker aus und erstellst Dashboards und Berichte, die wichtige KPIs verständlich darstellen (Power BI bevorzugt).
Kenntnisse in Tracking & Web Analytics: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung mit Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager (GTM) und weißt, wie man Nutzerverhalten richtig auswertet.
Teamplayer & Kommunikationsstärke: Du arbeitest gerne mit verschiedenen Fachabteilungen zusammen und kannst komplexe Daten verständlich präsentieren – auch für Nicht-Analysten.
Startup-Mentalität & Eigeninitiative: Du fühlst dich in dynamischen Umfeldern wohl, übernimmst Verantwortung und treibst datengetriebene Projekte eigenständig voran.
Sprachkenntnisse: Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind für diese Rolle erforderlich.

Nice-to-Have:

Erfahrung im Marketing oder Performance Marketing und ein Verständnis für datengetriebene Marketingstrategien.
Erfahrung mit Automatisierung und Skalierung von Datenprozessen.
Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics sind ein Plus.




Werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf dabei, die Zukunft des Lernens zu gestalten, indem du fundierte datengetriebene Entscheidungen ermöglicht, die unsere Geschäftsstrategie maßgeblich beeinflussen.

Startup-Mentalität & Eigeninitiative: Du fühlst dich in dynamischen Umfeldern wohl, übernimmst Verantwortung und treibst datengetriebene Projekte eigenständig voran.
Sprachkenntnisse: Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind für diese Rolle erforderlich.

Nice-to-Have:

Erfahrung im Marketing oder Performance Marketing und ein Verständnis für datengetriebene Marketingstrategien.
Erfahrung mit Automatisierung und Skalierung von Datenprozessen.
Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics sind ein Plus.




Werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf dabei, die Zukunft des Lernens zu gestalten, indem du fundierte datengetriebene Entscheidungen ermöglicht, die unsere Geschäftsstrategie maßgeblich beeinflussen.

Show more
HTML:
Werde Teil eines innovativen Teams bei Education Partners als “Data Analyst” (m/w/d)


Bist du begeistert von der Macht der Daten und möchtest entscheidende Einblicke liefern, die den Unternehmenserfolg vorantreiben? Education Partners, ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich der transformativen Bildung, gestaltet das Lernen und Wachsen neu. Mit aktuell 12 hochmodernen Akademien in ganz Europa treiben wir Innovationen in der digitalen Bildung voran.


Was wir bieten:

  • Hybrides Arbeitsmodell: Genieße die Flexibilität, sowohl von zu Hause als auch in unserem modernen Büro im Herzen Berlins zu arbeiten.
  • Modernste Technologie-Umgebung: Nutze die neuesten Datenanalyse-Tools und Business Intelligence-Lösungen in einem dynamischen Umfeld.
  • Wirkungsvolle Arbeit: Deine Analysen und Insights beeinflussen direkt die strategischen Entscheidungen.
  • Berufliche Weiterentwicklung: Wir fördern kontinuierliches Lernen durch Zugang zu Workshops, Konferenzen und erstklassigen Weiterbildungsangeboten.
  • Attraktives Gesamtpaket: Profitiere von 30 Tagen Urlaub, einem Remote-First-Ansatz, modernster Hardware und einem wettbewerbsfähigen Gehalt.


Dein Impact:

  • Datenanalyse & Insights: Du analysierst große und komplexe Datensätze, um wertvolle Insights zu gewinnen, die unser Verständnis von Kundenverhalten, Markttrends und Geschäftsentwicklungen vertiefen.
  • Dashboard- & Reporting-Erstellung: Du entwickelst aussagekräftige Dashboards und Berichte, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu erleichtern – idealerweise mit Power BI oder vergleichbaren Tools.
  • Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung: Du identifizierst Potenziale zur Verbesserung interner Prozesse und unterstützt die Fachbereiche dabei, datenbasierte Strategien umzusetzen.
  • Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen: Du arbeitest eng mit Teams aus Marketing, Produkt und Business Development zusammen, um operative sowie strategische Maßnahmen zu steuern.
  • Tracking & Datenqualität: Du stellst sicher, dass relevante Daten zuverlässig erfasst werden. Dafür unterstützt du bei der Implementierung von Tracking- und Analyse-Tools wie Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager.
  • Automatisierung & Skalierung: Du optimierst Datenprozesse, entwickelst Automatisierungen und sorgst für eine effiziente Nutzung der verfügbaren Datenquellen.


Was wir suchen:

  • Analytische Denkweise & datengetriebenes Mindset: Du hast ein ausgeprägtes Gespür für Daten, erfasst komplexe Zusammenhänge schnell und übersetzt diese in präzise Handlungsempfehlungen.
  • Tools: Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL und Excel/Google Sheets und kannst große Datensätze effizient analysieren und verarbeiten.
  • Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung: Du kennst Dich mit Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder Looker aus und erstellst Dashboards und Berichte, die wichtige KPIs verständlich darstellen (Power BI bevorzugt).
  • Kenntnisse in Tracking & Web Analytics: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung mit Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager (GTM) und weißt, wie man Nutzerverhalten richtig auswertet.
  • Teamplayer & Kommunikationsstärke: Du arbeitest gerne mit verschiedenen Fachabteilungen zusammen und kannst komplexe Daten verständlich präsentieren – auch für Nicht-Analysten.
  • Startup-Mentalität & Eigeninitiative: Du fühlst dich in dynamischen Umfeldern wohl, übernimmst Verantwortung und treibst datengetriebene Projekte eigenständig voran.
  • Sprachkenntnisse: Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind für diese Rolle erforderlich.

Nice-to-Have:

  • Erfahrung im Marketing oder Performance Marketing und ein Verständnis für datengetriebene Marketingstrategien.
  • Erfahrung mit Automatisierung und Skalierung von Datenprozessen.
  • Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics sind ein Plus.


Werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf dabei, die Zukunft des Lernens zu gestalten, indem du fundierte datengetriebene Entscheidungen ermöglicht, die unsere Geschäftsstrategie maßgeblich beeinflussen.

Title: Market Intelligence Analyst for Poland (w/m/d)
Description:
Our Renewables Team in Berlin and/or Stettin is looking for you!

Deine Aufgaben


Vertiefung des Verständnisses des Teams für aktuelle und erwartete Marktentwicklungen, regulatorische Rahmenbedingungen, einschließlich Beschreibungen der wichtigsten Auktionsmechanismen, Entwicklung von Auktionsprognosen und Herausforderungen (z. B. Kürzung)
Förderung der Marktexpertise mit dem Ziel, alle erforderlichen Beiträge für den Strategieüberprüfungsprozess des Unternehmens sowie für seine Arbeit an LCOEs bereitzustellen
Überwachung und Analyse der Aktivitäten der Wettbewerber und der Marktbedingungen, die für die Branche der erneuerbaren Energien spezifisch sind, um die strategische Planung zu informieren, neue Möglichkeiten zu identifizieren und Positionierungsstrategien nach Bedarf anzupassen
Überprüfung interner und externer Preisprognosen und Kennzeichnung potenzieller Risiken
Entwicklung einer Meinung zu PPAs zusammen mit dem Input des Trading-Teams von Uniper
Möglichkeit, Verständnis für andere Märkte für erneuerbare Energien zu entwickeln und bei der Identifizierung von Markteintrittsoptionen zu helfen
Arbeite mit funktionsübergreifenden Teams zusammen, einschließlich, aber nicht beschränkt auf Projektentwicklung, EPCO, kommerzielle Analyse, Marktanalyse, um die Position des Unternehmens im Land zu verbessern


Dein Profil


Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Volkswirtschaftslehre, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, Wirtschaftsrecht oder vergleichbares Studium
2 - 5 Jahre einschlägige Berufserfahrung
Expertise in den Märkten für Strom und erneuerbare Energien, Preisgestaltungssysteme sowie regulatorische Vergütungssysteme und das Bestreben, den Übergang zu erneuerbaren Energien zu unterstützen
Ausgeprägtes analytisches, strategisches, unternehmerisches Denken, kombiniert mit einem wissbegierigen Geist
Leichtigkeit und Interesse, Fähigkeiten im Projektmanagement zu entwickeln, Stakeholder kollaborativ einzubinden und neue Herausforderungen anzunehmen
Kreativer und aufgeschlossener Mensch mit einem guten Sinn für Humor
Verhandlungssichere Kenntnisse in Polnisch und Englisch (weitere Sprachen willkommen)


Our Renewables Team in Berlin and/or Stettin is looking for you!

Title: Data Analyst with ML Experience (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie’s Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a diligent Data Analyst to join Billie’s Analytics team and contribute to the development and enhancement of Billie’s analytical capabilities.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, and is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

You Will


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie’s portfolio
Use statistics and ML concepts in developing actionable business solutions
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who we are looking for


You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in advanced data and analytics and statistical concepts, tools, and methodologies
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Experience with Python, R and other advanced analytical tools
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!
