Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.
Show more
HTML:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie’s Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

Responsibilities

  • Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
  • Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
  • Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
  • Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
  • Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
  • Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie’s portfolio
  • Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
  • Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
  • Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners

Who We Are Looking For

  • You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
  • Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
  • Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
  • Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
  • Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
  • Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
  • Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
  • You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
  • You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
  • Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
  • Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage

What We Offer

  • Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
  • One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
  • Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
  • A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
  • Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
  • Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
  • A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
  • Free German group classes
  • An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
  • Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
  • Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more

Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Title: B2B Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
Was wir suchen ...



Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir einen B2B Data Analyst (all genders), der nicht nur Zahlen analysiert, sondern auch die richtigen Schlüsse zieht, Trends erkennt und neue Möglichkeiten aufzeigt. Wenn du Lust hast, mit deinem Daten-Know-how Prozesse zu optimieren, smarte Prognosen zu erstellen und unser B2B-Business aufs nächste Level zu bringen, dann freuen wir uns, von dir zu hören.

Wichtig: Für diese Position sind Deutschkenntnisse mindestens auf B2-Niveau ein Muss.



Deine Aufgaben



Du analysierst interne und externe Datenquellen und findest die relevanten Insights.
Du erstellst Forecasts, Demand Plannings und Co., damit alle wissen, wo die Reise hingeht.
Du beantwortest Fragen des B2B-Teams, testest Hypothesen und ziehst proaktiv Schlüsse aus den Daten – immer mit Blick auf konkrete Handlungsempfehlungen.
Du nutzt vorhandene Daten, um Vorhersagen zu möglichen Kampagnen-Ergebnissen zu treffen.
Du baust eine neue Datenstruktur auf, die alle notwendigen Standard-Reportings enthält – gemeinsam mit dem Team legst du fest, wie maximale Transparenz und Sichtbarkeit erreicht werden können.
Du identifizierst Geschäftsmöglichkeiten: Sei es durch das Erkennen von Marketing- und Kampagnentrends, die Verbesserung interner Prozesse oder durch den Einsatz datengetriebener Plattformen, die Vertriebsaktivitäten transparenter machen





Dein Profil



fundierte Erfahrung im Bereich Datenanalyse und Business Intelligence (BI)
umfangreiche Kenntnisse in mathematischen und statistischen Analysen sowie den entsprechenden Tools
schnelle Auffassungsgabe zur Übersetzung komplexer Anforderungen in konkrete Aufgaben
service- und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise mit einer Balance aus Perfektionismus und Pragmatismus
visionäre Denkweise, um Innovationen voranzutreiben und das B2B-Geschäft weiterzuentwickeln
Sicherstellung von Datenintegrität und -genauigkeit sowie Optimierung von Datenprozessen
Erfahrung mit Excel, SQL, Tableau, Power BI und Programmierung in Python oder R
Fähigkeit, komplexe Datenanalysen in umsetzbare Erkenntnisse für Entscheidungsträger zu übersetzen
akademischer Abschluss in einem betriebswirtschaftlichen Fachbereich oder vergleichbare Berufserfahrungen






Warum wir?



Wir sind ein motiviertes Team mit echtem Zusammenhalt – wir unterstützen einander.
Du wirst schnell ein fester Teil unseres Teams und kannst deine Ideen jederzeit einbringen.
Für alles, was deinen Job einfacher oder flexibler macht, bekommst du ein Budget.
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Home-Office? Machen wir möglich – ganz unkompliziert in Absprache.
28 Urlaubstage warten auf dich – und jedes Jahr bei uns gibt’s einen extra Tag obendrauf (bis max. 30).
Stell dir jeden Monat Gutscheine im Wert von 50 Euro zusammen – bei vielen spannenden Partner*innen.
Dein Deutschland-Ticket? Das übernehmen wir für dich!
Nutze unseren Zugang zu OpenUp für anonyme, professionelle Unterstützung - für deine mentale Gesundheit.
Regelmäßige Team-Aktivitäten, ob im Office oder draußen, gehören bei uns dazu.
Teste Produktneuheiten und Trends, bevor sie auf den Markt kommen.
Sichere dir exklusive Rabatte auf unser Sortiment und viele weitere Vorteile mit Corporate Benefits.
Modernes Arbeiten mit Apple-Produkten und einem funktionalen Arbeitsplatz ist bei uns Standard.





Du willst dich bewerben? Dann los!



Schicke uns deinen Lebenslauf sowie ein kurzes Anschreiben unter der Angabe deiner Gründe, warum DU unser Perfect Match bist.

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!



Über uns



Als Beauty-Onlineshop bringen wir deine liebsten Produkte kuratierter Marken aus den USA, UK & Co. nach Deutschland und sehen uns dabei auch als Sprungbrett für kleine, noch wachsende Beauty-Brands.

Denn neben unserer Präsenz als Beauty-Onlineshop arbeiten wir hinter den Kulissen auch als Distributor für innovative Marken aus dem Ausland. Dazu gehören Geek & Gorgeous, RevitaLash und The Fox Tan, denen wir neue Zugänge zu bekannten Retailern in Europa eröffnen.

Dabei legen wir mit unserem diversen, jungen Team aus rund 50 Mitarbeitenden den Fokus auf ganzheitliche Marketingkonzepte, um Tag für Tag das Beauty-Game in der DACH-Region weiter zu revolutionieren. Das macht unsere Arbeit weltweit einzigartig und besonders abwechslungsreich.

Die PURISH GmbH fördert aktiv eine Kultur der Wertschätzung von Vielfalt. Daher begrüßen wir Bewerbungen von People of Color, Menschen aller Nationalitäten, Religionen und Weltanschauungen, sexueller Orientierungen und geschlechtlicher Identitäten sowie aller Altersgruppen und möglichen Einschränkungen.

Wir ermutigen alle, sich bei uns zu bewerben!

Show more

Du beantwortest Fragen des B2B-Teams, testest Hypothesen und ziehst proaktiv Schlüsse aus den Daten – immer mit Blick auf konkrete Handlungsempfehlungen.

Du nutzt vorhandene Daten, um Vorhersagen zu möglichen Kampagnen-Ergebnissen zu treffen.

Du baust eine neue Datenstruktur auf, die alle notwendigen Standard-Reportings enthält – gemeinsam mit dem Team legst du fest, wie maximale Transparenz und Sichtbarkeit erreicht werden können.

Du identifizierst Geschäftsmöglichkeiten: Sei es durch das Erkennen von Marketing- und Kampagnentrends, die Verbesserung interner Prozesse oder durch den Einsatz datengetriebener Plattformen, die Vertriebsaktivitäten transparenter machen

Dein Profil

fundierte Erfahrung im Bereich Datenanalyse und Business Intelligence (BI)

umfangreiche Kenntnisse in mathematischen und statistischen Analysen sowie den entsprechenden Tools

schnelle Auffassungsgabe zur Übersetzung komplexer Anforderungen in konkrete Aufgaben

service- und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise mit einer Balance aus Perfektionismus und Pragmatismus

visionäre Denkweise, um Innovationen voranzutreiben und das B2B-Geschäft weiterzuentwickeln

Sicherstellung von Datenintegrität und -genauigkeit sowie Optimierung von Datenprozessen

Erfahrung mit Excel, SQL, Tableau, Power BI und Programmierung in Python oder R

Fähigkeit, komplexe Datenanalysen in umsetzbare Erkenntnisse für Entscheidungsträger zu übersetzen

akademischer Abschluss in einem betriebswirtschaftlichen Fachbereich oder vergleichbare Berufserfahrungen

Warum wir?

Wir sind ein motiviertes Team mit echtem Zusammenhalt – wir unterstützen einander.

Du wirst schnell ein fester Teil unseres Teams und kannst deine Ideen jederzeit einbringen.

Für alles, was deinen Job einfacher oder flexibler macht, bekommst du ein Budget.

Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Home-Office? Machen wir möglich – ganz unkompliziert in Absprache.

28 Urlaubstage warten auf dich – und jedes Jahr bei uns gibt’s einen extra Tag obendrauf (bis max. 30).

Stell dir jeden Monat Gutscheine im Wert von 50 Euro zusammen – bei vielen spannenden Partner*innen.

Dein Deutschland-Ticket? Das übernehmen wir für dich!

Nutze unseren Zugang zu OpenUp für anonyme, professionelle Unterstützung - für deine mentale Gesundheit.

Regelmäßige Team-Aktivitäten, ob im Office oder draußen, gehören bei uns dazu.

Teste Produktneuheiten und Trends, bevor sie auf den Markt kommen.

Sichere dir exklusive Rabatte auf unser Sortiment und viele weitere Vorteile mit Corporate Benefits.

Modernes Arbeiten mit Apple-Produkten und einem funktionalen Arbeitsplatz ist bei uns Standard.

Du willst dich bewerben? Dann los!

Schicke uns deinen Lebenslauf sowie ein kurzes Anschreiben unter der Angabe deiner Gründe, warum DU unser Perfect Match bist.

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Über uns

Als Beauty-Onlineshop bringen wir deine liebsten Produkte kuratierter Marken aus den USA, UK & Co. nach Deutschland und sehen uns dabei auch als Sprungbrett für kleine, noch wachsende Beauty-Brands.

Denn neben unserer Präsenz als Beauty-Onlineshop arbeiten wir hinter den Kulissen auch als Distributor für innovative Marken aus dem Ausland. Dazu gehören Geek & Gorgeous, RevitaLash und The Fox Tan, denen wir neue Zugänge zu bekannten Retailern in Europa eröffnen.

Dabei legen wir mit unserem diversen, jungen Team aus rund 50 Mitarbeitenden den Fokus auf ganzheitliche Marketingkonzepte, um Tag für Tag das Beauty-Game in der DACH-Region weiter zu revolutionieren. Das macht unsere Arbeit weltweit einzigartig und besonders abwechslungsreich.

Die PURISH GmbH fördert aktiv eine Kultur der Wertschätzung von Vielfalt. Daher begrüßen wir Bewerbungen von People of Color, Menschen aller Nationalitäten, Religionen und Weltanschauungen, sexueller Orientierungen und geschlechtlicher Identitäten sowie aller Altersgruppen und möglichen Einschränkungen.

Wir ermutigen alle, sich bei uns zu bewerben!

Wenn du Lust hast, mit deinem Daten-Know-how Prozesse zu optimieren, smarte Prognosen zu erstellen und unser B2B-Business aufs nächste Level zu bringen, dann freuen wir uns, von dir zu hören.

Wichtig: Für diese Position sind Deutschkenntnisse mindestens auf B2-Niveau ein Muss.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir von der Lidl e-commerce schaffen als digitaler Systembereitsteller für das Onlinegeschäft von Lidl effiziente, skalierbare digitale Produkte und Services und entwickeln diese zukunftsfähig weiter.

Als Marke der IT- und Digitalsparte Schwarz Digits unterteilen sich unsere Bereiche in Commerce Platforms, Marketing Tech & Enablement, Data Tech & Enablement, New Digital Business Models sowie SCRM Loyalty Platforms.

Deine Aufgaben


Als Analyst unterstützt du den Fachbereich mit aussagekräftigen Analysen, um die strategische Ausrichtung zu steuern und zu evaluieren
Du entwickelst und wartest Datenpipelines zur Aufbereitung und Bereitstellung von Daten für das Management, Marketing und deine Kollegen
Du stellst komplexe Zusammenhänge zielgruppengerecht dar und hilfst so dem Fachbereich, Wissen aufzubauen
Du unterstützt den Fachbereich in der Planung, Durchführung und Auswertung von verschiedenen Projekten und leitest selbständig Projekte und Analysen ab
Du konzipierst und implementierst automatisierte Prozesse, um die Produktivität von dir und deinen Kollegen zu erhöhen
Du identifizierst Optimierungspotenziale und setzt Maßnahmen um, um die Datenqualität und -verfügbarkeit zu maximieren


Dein Profil


Du besitzt einen Hochschulabschluss in Volkswirtschaftslehre, Ökonometrie, Statistik, (Wirtschafts-)Mathematik oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung
Du konntest bereits mehrjährige Berufserfahrung als Data Analyst oder Data Engineer sammeln
Du hast Erfahrung mit Datenbank- und Tabellenmodellen (Data Lakehouse, Data Vault etc.).
Du hast ein datengetriebenes Mindset und gehst sicher mit gängigen Analytics-Tools (z.B. Databricks, Snowflake, BigQuery) und Sprachen (Python, SQL) um
Du besitzt eine Hands-on-Mentalität und hast Lust darauf, den Bereich aufzubauen und weiterzuentwickeln
Du bist geduldig, teamfähig und hast Humor
Du sprichst fließend Deutsch und gut Englisch
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Consumer & Market Insights (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


The Consumer & Market Insights team plays a crucial role in shaping customer-centric strategies at Zalando. By focusing on in-depth analytics and research, the team uncovers valuable insights that inform decision-making and enhance our competitive edge. The understanding of consumer needs and behaviours enables more effective sales, marketing, product development, and overall business strategies.

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Brand & Satisfaction tracking sub-team, your goal is to shed light on what drives customer perception and behaviour, leveraging the wide variety of data sources at your disposal. You will act as the voice of our customers internally and support data-driven decisions to improve their experience.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)




Connecting transactional data, onsite behavioural data and perception insights (derived from customer and panel surveys) to build a holistic understanding of our customers’ experience
Successfully leading and owning analytical projects by conducting descriptive, diagnostic and predictive analytics using state-of-the-art modelling techniques and deriving recommendations for our stakeholders.
Support more junior analysts with guidance and sparring, leveraging your knowledge and experience to raise the bar for analytics within the team




WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




University degree in economics, computer science, mathematics, statistics, or in a similar quantitative field
Proven track record of a minimum of 5 years in a highly analytical role, ideally in an e-commerce environment
Strong analytical skills and solid understanding of statistical methods, with the ability to extract meaningful insights from large and complex data sets
Solid programming skills in SQL and in Python, as well as experience with Google Analytics (BigQuery)
Previous experience with data visualisation tools (e. g. Microstrategy, Tableau, PowerBI) is a plus
Knowledge of time series forecasting and causality (causal inference and A/B testing) is considered a plus
Ability to concisely communicate the essence, conveying meaningful and relevant insights to analytical and non-analytical stakeholders alike
Excellent verbal and written English skills




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with up to 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us


Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Help Experience
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 20+ markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

As a Decision Scientist in our Help Experience domain, you’ll play a key role in enhancing the support experience for our Vinted members. This role will be embedded in a new cross-functional product team within the domain, where you will take the lead in driving experimentation. You will collaborate closely with your team to deliver impactful, data-informed decisions that improve quality, scalability, and efficiency in support operations through automation, self-service, and operational excellence.

We’re looking for someone who is a strategic thinker, a problem solver, with a strong data background, who aims high. You like to work in a fast-changing environment, and you are passionate about the product we’re building together.

Next to the product team you will be part of the cross-domain Data Science & Analytics (DSA) guild where you will interact and learn from all data people in Vinted. Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.


You will report to the Director of Data Science & Analytics in Help Experience and work closely with other leaders in the domain, particularly in the data science & analytics and product functions.

In this position, you’ll


Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions
Ensure these questions are answered in an optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis)
Analyse identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact (i.e. size opportunities)
Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, tracking, forecasting, and proactively flagging issues
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker)
Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyze the results of (A/B) tests
Help to create a backlog with prioritized hypotheses and analyses


About You


Demonstratable experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Product Analyst
BSc or MSc in Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Econometrics, or another related field (equivalent working experience is also acceptable)
Highly business-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes
A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences
Excellent written and spoken English
Are able to balance between analyses depth (time needed) and business impact
Ability to deal with uncertainty and to combine data insights with strategic thinking
Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis)
Advanced knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.)
Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

We invest in your professional growth! As part of our commitment to continuous learning, we offer an annual learning budget to support your personal and career development through courses, certifications, workshops and more.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The base salary range for this position is €69,700 - €94,300 gross per year.
Show more

  • Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
  • Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
  • Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.

You will report to the Director of Data Science & Analytics in Help Experience and work closely with other leaders in the domain, particularly in the data science & analytics and product functions.

In this position, you’ll

  • Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions
  • Ensure these questions are answered in an optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis)
  • Analyse identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact (i.e. size opportunities)
  • Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, tracking, forecasting, and proactively flagging issues
  • Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker)
  • Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyze the results of (A/B) tests
  • Help to create a backlog with prioritized hypotheses and analyses

About You

  • Demonstratable experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Product Analyst
  • BSc or MSc in Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Econometrics, or another related field (equivalent working experience is also acceptable)
  • Highly business-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes
  • A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences
  • Excellent written and spoken English
  • Are able to balance between analyses depth (time needed) and business impact
  • Ability to deal with uncertainty and to combine data insights with strategic thinking
  • Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis)
  • Advanced knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.)
  • Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)

Work perks

  • The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
  • 30 days of paid annual leave
  • Newest MacBook models
  • Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
  • Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
  • A daily lunch allowance
  • Frequent team-building events
  • A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
  • A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
  • A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
  • Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
  • Life and disability insurance provided
  • A subsidised Deutschlandticket
  • The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
  • A dog-friendly office

Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

We invest in your professional growth! As part of our commitment to continuous learning, we offer an annual learning budget to support your personal and career development through courses, certifications, workshops and more.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The base salary range for this position is €69,700 - €94,300 gross per year.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics (Attribution & Paid Search) and will focus mostly on helping optimize our Paid Search operations and scaling our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. The analyst will need to intervene in our campaign setup and bidding strategies and our attribution and experimentation solutions.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value…)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Develop new methodologies to scale our Display and Partnerships channel, among others
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers and a track record in sharing insights to business stakeholders
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Knowledge or previous experience of attribution and paid search.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.




Qualification Path:




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Germany for the last 2 Years consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Germany
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Senior Growth Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
The role

As a Growth Data Analyst in the Growth Analytics team, you will join the wider International Marketing Analytics group which acts as a key consultant for the International part of HelloFresh business. Your main focus will be on supporting your Growth stakeholders in their decision making, and you will be their key contact person regarding data and analytics questions. Your experience with Growth analytics and related technologies, together with your excellent communication, stakeholder management and organizational skills will have a big impact on the company’s performance.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don’t “tick all the boxes” but think you’d thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You’ll Do


Provide cracking insights to optimize marketing campaigns and channel targeting and efficiency
Translate business questions into meaningful analytics for your stakeholders via multiple Growth channels
Creating ad-hoc insights, Lift Tests, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
Utilise various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
Improve how we look at Growth Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
You will not only take responsibility of own projects, but also be a team player to collaborate and share knowledge with other analysts


What You’ll Bring


Proven experience in Growth Marketing Analytics or any of the following domains: Data Analytics/Business Analytics/Marketing Analytics/Product Analytics/Data Science
5+ years of experience in data analytics and statistical modelling
A degree in Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
Preferably experience in working with web analytics (Google Analytics, Meta AA, ADH etc.)
Preferably experience with growth marketing analytics and testing (lift tests, campaign analytics, channel efficiency, AB testing)
Expertise in SQL, Python & bigquery with excitement to learn more on the technical side!
Expertise in building dashboards, we use Tableau
Experience in statistical modeling, regression, clustering, time series etc is good to have
Any team management experience, mentoring or managing 1-2 analyst is good to have
Experience in performing analysis with large datasets and knowing what the common pitfalls are
Marketing or product related experience is good, not a must
Analytical and critical thinking combined with good presentation and communication skills
Strong problems solving skills and hands-on & can-do attitude
Ability to work independently


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Comprehensive relocation assistance to move to Berlin plus visa application support (if applicable)
A significant discount on your weekly HelloFresh box
Internal learning and development opportunities with the HelloFresh Academy
Mental health support, including Headspace subscription and access to qualified therapists through Spill
Monthly transportation budget through Rydes app
Working parents support
Additional perks include: Annual German language budget, discounts for John Reed gyms & Urban Sports Club, regular company events, fresh fruit & free drinks in the office, in-house yoga classes, monthly discount on the Convini vending machine in the office
Hybrid working model (option to work from home for up to 2 days per week if preferred)
Sabbatical leave option after 18 months of being with HelloFresh
HelloFresh Pension Scheme that is subsidized with 20% on top
A diverse and vibrant international environment of 90+ different nationalities
The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

JR100987

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Marketing (d/f/m)
Description:
Personio's intelligent HR platform helps small and medium-sized organizations unlock the power of people by making complicated, time-consuming tasks simple and efficient. Our growing team of 1,800+ Personios across Europe and the US are building user-friendly products that delight our 14,000+ customers and their 1.5 million employees. Ready to make an impact from day one?

The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be hybrid from one of the following office locations: London, Munich, Dublin, Madrid, or Berlin.

We empower Personio's decision-making with advanced analytics and strategic insights, while boosting productivity through systems improvement and automation. Be part of our transformative journey in HR technology, where your contributions will shape our data-driven future.

In this pivotal role, you'll spearhead our marketing strategies, aligning them seamlessly with sales objectives to propel business success. As a Senior Marketing Data Analyst, you'll be the cornerstone of our Go-to-market department, leveraging your expertise in analysis, trend forecasting, and strategic planning to ignite innovative marketing initiatives and foster robust collaboration with our Sales team.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Strategic Marketing Planning: You'll lead data-driven strategies within our Go-to-market framework, ensuring they resonate with our sales targets and organizational objectives.
Marketing Campaign Analysis: You're responsible for assessing campaign performance, optimizing for maximum ROI across various channels and regions.
Customer Segmentation and Personalization: You will execute advanced segmentation and collaborate with the GTM team for targeted marketing, boosting lead conversion and retention.
Trend Identification and Forecasting: Your role involves analyzing market trends, predicting future shifts, and offering competitive insights.
Team Leadership and Collaboration: You will mentor analysts and ensure cross-departmental cohesion, particularly with Sales and CX teams.
Report Generation and Presentation: You're tasked with creating and presenting reports that drive continuous improvement.
Budget Management: You oversee marketing KPI adjustments within our bi-annual budget review, ensuring alignment with financial and marketing goals.


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


Experience: 5+ years in marketing analytics, with a leadership background.
Statistical Knowledge: Understanding of basic statistical models for business problem analysis.
Platform Familiarity: Skilled in Google Analytics, HubSpot, Salesforce, Marketo, Dreamdata, and Snowflake.
Data-Driven Leadership: Experience in fostering a data-centric culture and making data-based decisions.
Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve into data, identifying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to simplify complex data insights for diverse stakeholders.
Entrepreneurial Approach: Proactive problem-solving, focusing on impactful results and leveraging data insights for tangible improvements.


Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package – reevaluated each year – that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years
Make an impact on the environment and society with 1 Impact Day per year
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities
We follow an office-led, remote-friendly approach, including opportunities to work from home and international locations. Many of our teams have designated days for gathering in the office to enhance collaboration and foster a sense of community.
We enjoy gathering for meals, cultural initiatives, and events like local Summer Sessions and year-end celebrations. There's also healthy snacks, drinks, and a weekly catered lunch.

Title: Consultant Business Intelligence (m/w/d)
Description:
P3 Group GmbH | online seit: 10.05.2023

P3 entwickelt neue Geschäftsmodelle, erschließt für den Kunden zukünftige Einnahmequellen und begleitet ihn beim Kompetenzaufbau.P3 unterstützt und befähigt Kundenorganisationen zu robusten Strukturen um nachhaltig zu wirtschaften und zukünftig zu wachsen.P3 liefert End-to-End-Lösungen im Bereich Security Consulting und gewährleistet einen nahtlosen Service- und Produkt-Rollout.

What You'll Do


Du berätst Kunden von der Konzeption über die Entwicklung bis hin zur Implementierung von modernen BI-Lösungen für die Bereiche Datenmanagement, Automatisierung und Visualisierung
Du analysierst heutige (Daten-)Prozesse und entwirfst neue Zielbilder für diese Prozesse
Du entwickelst eigenständig BI-Lösungen und bildest die Schnittstelle zu unseren Entwicklungsabteilungen
Du moderierst Projektbesprechungen mit entsprechenden internen und externen Stakeholdern, um eine funktionsübergreifende Zusammenarbeit auch über die Softwareentwicklung hinaus zu ermöglichen
Du bist Teil des BI-Teams und vernetzt dich mit internen Themenfeldern und (internationalen) Standorten der P3
Du übersetzt Kundenanforderungen in für Entwickler umsetzbare Lösungsbausteine


Who You Are


Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes (IT-orientiertes) Hochschulstudium (z.B. im Bereich Business Intelligence, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, BWL)
Du bringst idealerweise Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Business Intelligence, Digitalisierung und Prozess-Automatisierung mit
Du kannst dich schnell in (Daten-)Prozesse hineindenken und erkennst Optimierungspotentiale
Du kannst mit Low Code entwickeln und verfügst idealerweise über Expertise in einem der folgenden Themen: Power BI, DAX, Power Query, Azure Logic Apps, Power Automate, Power Apps, Power FX, JSON, XML, REST API, Python, SQL
Du bist wissbegierig und motiviert dich in neue Technologien einzuarbeiten

HTML:
P3 Group GmbH | online seit: 10.05.2023

P3 entwickelt neue Geschäftsmodelle, erschließt für den Kunden zukünftige Einnahmequellen und begleitet ihn beim Kompetenzaufbau.P3 unterstützt und befähigt Kundenorganisationen zu robusten Strukturen um nachhaltig zu wirtschaften und zukünftig zu wachsen.P3 liefert End-to-End-Lösungen im Bereich Security Consulting und gewährleistet einen nahtlosen Service- und Produkt-Rollout.

What You'll Do

  • Du berätst Kunden von der Konzeption über die Entwicklung bis hin zur Implementierung von modernen BI-Lösungen für die Bereiche Datenmanagement, Automatisierung und Visualisierung
  • Du analysierst heutige (Daten-)Prozesse und entwirfst neue Zielbilder für diese Prozesse
  • Du entwickelst eigenständig BI-Lösungen und bildest die Schnittstelle zu unseren Entwicklungsabteilungen
  • Du moderierst Projektbesprechungen mit entsprechenden internen und externen Stakeholdern, um eine funktionsübergreifende Zusammenarbeit auch über die Softwareentwicklung hinaus zu ermöglichen
  • Du bist Teil des BI-Teams und vernetzt dich mit internen Themenfeldern und (internationalen) Standorten der P3
  • Du übersetzt Kundenanforderungen in für Entwickler umsetzbare Lösungsbausteine

Who You Are

  • Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes (IT-orientiertes) Hochschulstudium (z.B. im Bereich Business Intelligence, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, BWL)
  • Du bringst idealerweise Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Business Intelligence, Digitalisierung und Prozess-Automatisierung mit
  • Du kannst dich schnell in (Daten-)Prozesse hineindenken und erkennst Optimierungspotentiale
  • Du kannst mit Low Code entwickeln und verfügst idealerweise über Expertise in einem der folgenden Themen: Power BI, DAX, Power Query, Azure Logic Apps, Power Automate, Power Apps, Power FX, JSON, XML, REST API, Python, SQL
  • Du bist wissbegierig und motiviert dich in neue Technologien einzuarbeiten
  • Du verfügst über sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

GOOD TO KNOW

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d) - SAP & Finance
Description:
At Statista, we’re all about facts and data, for we are the world's leading business data platform. By providing reliable and easy-to-use data as well as various data analytics products and services, we empower people worldwide to make fact-based decisions.

Founded in Hamburg in 2007, we have quickly grown into a global company with offices in major cities such as London, New York, Berlin and Tokyo. And we still have a lot of plans. Our constant growth does not only prove our success, but also keeps creating new development and career opportunities for our employees.

We value and celebrate our diverse culture. You are welcome here for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or whether you prefer bar graphs to pie charts. Your story matters – keep writing it as part of our team.

Are you ready to join us?

Tasks


Assume responsibility for the development and refinement of the data models in our Redshift data warehouse.
Help transition our current MS Navision-based financial reporting to a newly designed SAP-based reporting.
Act as a bridge between Finance Controlling, Finance Tech and Data Department. Systematically translate business requirements and questions into precise data queries and insightful data models.
Provide crucial support to our Embedded Analysts and Finance Controlling Team, aiding in their understanding and utilization of the data warehouse.
Engage with stakeholders across the organization driving value from our data.


Requirements


Proven proficiency in SQL and experience working with data warehouses like Redshift.
Hands-on data modeling skills and familiarity with dbt.
Understanding of SAP-data and the SAP-system as well as Finance processes.
Adeptness in translating business needs into data models.
Exceptional communication skills in both spoken and written in English. German is a plus.
Analytical mindset with the ability to identify patterns, trends, and insights from data.
Strong collaboration skills, with the ability to work closely with teams and stakeholders at all levels of the organization.


The team

At Statista Tech, our mission is to to harness the possibilities of modern technology to bring Statista’s data assets to the fingertips of our customers around the globe as conveniently and reliably as possible. Internally, we provide a productive digital workplace environment at Statista globally.

What We Offer

In addition to our great team, culture, and our shared goal of empowering people with data, there are many other things that make Statista a great place to work! Join us and benefit from:


Work from abroad 10 days a year (up to 30 if your family lives abroad)
Hybrid work and flex-time
International team and social events
Career & training opportunities
Attractive locations and modern offices
Mental health support by Fürstenberg Institute


Some of the benefits listed here apply only to the German entity and to Junior-level roles or above.
Show more

Title: (Data) Supply Analytics Manager (m / f / d )
Description:
Company Description

Omio’s vision is to enable people to travel seamlessly anywhere, anyway. We are bringing all global transport into a single distribution system and creating end-to-end magical consumer journeys.

With Omio you can compare and book trains, buses, ferries and flights anywhere in Europe, the US, and Canada with one simple search, on mobile, app or desktop. By offering transparent pricing and easy booking, Omio makes travel planning simple, flexible and personal.

Omio is the largest source of inventory, with 1000+ suppliers operating in 39 countries. Our brands also include Rome2Rio for global discovery, while Omio powers ticketing and journeys, which attract 900m+ users every year. Our offices are based in Berlin, Prague, Melbourne, Brazil, Bangalore, and London.

We are a growing team of more than 400 passionate employees from more than 50 countries who share the same vision: to create a single tool to help send travellers almost anywhere in the world.

Job Description

Job Description

Omio is rapidly expanding its product offerings across all of its markets and is looking to grow its capabilities and improve the efficiency of how we enable the use of data to drive fast, accurate decision-making across the business.

We are working through a major change programme designed to evolve the use of data across the organisation, focussing on quality and accessibility, and taking a product-led approach.

As a part of this change, we are building a new function dedicated to supporting our supply of travel inventory. This is a role offering huge variety, onboarding, and monitoring our suppliers through the whole lifecycle, ensuring we are best using their inventory and working with finance to ensure the correct allocation of commissions and invoicing.

The role also takes responsibility for zooming out from suppliers and looking across whole modes (e.g. trains, buses, ferries) and geographies (initially European countries only).

Key Responsibilities


Understand Omio’s business model, particularly around the supply of travel inventory across the globe.
Define and adopt efficient automation around supplier onboarding, performance measurement and financial reconciliation.
Understand and lead on establishing Omio’s top-line metrics and KPIs, reporting their evolution, detecting anomalies, evaluating key drivers, and diagnosing issue root causes.
Build forecasting models to understand gaps in current performance and sales/revenue optimization models to enhance margins without negatively impacting user experience
Perform statistical analyses - including A/B tests and pre/post analyses
Correlate marketing/product/commercial data to derive key insights
Work with our data engineering/business intelligence teams to build data models, which best summarise and utilise our production data
Act as an advocate of our company’s data-driven culture: produce reports that are actionable, dashboards that are diagnostic, and recommendations that drive growth


Qualifications

A successful candidate will be:


Passionate about continuous improvement.
An excellent stakeholder manager with great communication and presentation skills.
Enthusiastic, with a sense of pride in the work delivered and the quality of how it was delivered.
An open and honest individual who both welcomes and provides feedback in a way that is constructive and thoughtful.
Highly collaborative with fantastic facilitation skills at team and department level.
Comfortable with flexibility, ambiguity and changing priorities.
Value and outcome-driven, with a positive “can-do” attitude.


A Successful Candidate Will Have


Minimum 5 years of experience as a product or data analyst, ideally in the tech start-up/scale-up environment.
Ideally some experience of B2B or B2B2C environments.
Experience in working with European travel providers would be a significant advantage.
Experience of line management, leading and developing a small team.
Strong analytical thinking with a structured approach to problem-solving.
Experienced in using SQL extensively.
Strong communication skills and a proven track record of collaborating effectively within cross-functional teams
Strong business intuition and a data-driven mindset to drive impactful solutions that meet strategic objectives. Communicate complex insights clearly and collaborate seamlessly with senior management to support decision-making
Bonus points if you have:
GCP, BigQuery, Looker, Python, Spark

Additional Information

What’s in it for you?


Have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are changing the way people travel, and you too can have an impact on this ride
A competitive and attractive compensation package
Subsidized Urban Sports Club membership
A diverse team of more than 45 nationalities


Diversity makes us stronger

We value diversity and welcome all applicants regardless of ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age or disability.

Hiring process and background checks

At Omio, we work in partnership with Giant Screening, once a job offer has been accepted, Giant will be engaged to carry out background screening. Giant will reach out to you via email and occasionally via telephone/text message so that they can gather all the relevant information required. Consent will be requested prior to any information being passed to our services company.

Recruitment scams: Important notice

Protect yourself from scammers, Omio wants to ensure your ongoing safety during the application process at Omio. Please keep in mind potential scammers impersonating Omio recruiters (mainly via a global professional networking site, and messenger app's).

Remember, Omio never requests payment or sensitive personal information during the recruitment process. All official job opportunities are exclusively posted on our careers page. If you suspect fraudulent activity, report it to recruitment@omio.com. Remember to cross-reference against our careers page if you question the authenticity, stay vigilant, and protect yourself from recruitment scams.

Intrigued? Apply here in English.

Title: Senior BI Analyst
Description:
Why us?

RABOT Energy is looking for a Senior BI Analyst to take our data insights to the next level. With our fast company and consumer growth, the demand for high-quality insights rises across the company., We are looking for an experienced analyst to join our BI team and become a trusted partner for our stakeholders. This role will be key in delivering actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making across all departments.

Your Impact


Design and develop BI solutions, dashboards, and reports to provide meaningful insights to business stakeholders.
Play a key role in structuring and defining our Data Warehouse to ensure scalability and data integrity.
Guide and mentor team members and peers, providing technical QA and ensuring best practices in data visualization and reporting.
Analyze complex datasets and translate them into clear, strategic recommendations for leadership and cross-functional teams.
Work closely with different departments to understand data needs, ensuring insights are accessible and impactful for decision-making.


What Can You Bring


Professional Experience: Proven track record in designing and developing BI solutions, dashboards, and reports together with top-tier-stakeholders.
Technical Expertise: Advanced proficiency in BI tools (e.g., Metabase, Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Looker).
SQL Mastery: Strong SQL skills for data extraction, manipulation, and optimization.
Data Warehousing & ETL: Experience working with data warehouses, dbt, ETL processes, and big data technologies.
Analytical Mindset: Ability to analyze large and complex datasets, extract key insights, and drive data-informed decisions.
Clear Communication: Ability to present complex data insights in an understandable way to senior management and non-technical teams.
Language Skills: Fluent in English. Knowledge of German is a plus


Lacking experience in some of the areas mentioned? No need for concern – we are committed to providing you with the necessary support for learning, training, and on-the-job coaching

Our Benefits


Enjoy flexible working hours and the freedom to work remotely 2 days a week, offering you a work-life balance that suits your lifestyle.
We're committed to your growth. Benefit from comprehensive training, regular team meetings, and open, transparent communication to keep you informed and engaged.
Maintain your physical well-being with an Urban Sports Club membership that offers you a world of fitness opportunities.
Immerse yourself in a vibrant startup atmosphere, where a spirited team, exciting team events, and our 'Employees Recruit Employees' program await you – your path to rewarding success.
Celebrate the holidays with peace of mind, as you'll always have Christmas Eve and New Year's Eve off to make cherished memories.
28 Vacation days
Workation: Enjoy two weeks of workation per year and work from anywhere in the EU


For all our positions, we are open to providing flexible work arrangements to accommodate the unique needs of each individual.

About Us

RABOT Energy is an independent supplier of 100 % renewable energy, offering dynamic electricity tariffs to private and business customers. By passing on exchange buying prices to our customers, we can save them up to 35 % on their electricity bills. Electric vehicle owners particularly benefit from our dynamic electricity tariff, as we have developed a smart system that signals the car when to automatically charge during periods of low electricity prices. And this is just the beginning!

Our mission is to empower every consumer to efficiently manage their energy consumption costs while safeguarding the environment and natural resources. Through our provision of 100% renewable energy and comprehensive smart charging and energy management solutions for homes, RABOT Energy actively contributes to increasing the real green power share in Germany's electricity consumption, thus driving the energy transition forward.

"Be part of something unique, the first of its kind in Germany. Join us at RABOT Energy and seize abundant growth opportunities in the thriving world of green energy. We're a team that believes in the power of our mission, and we're looking for individuals with the passion to match ours!”

Jan Rabe, CEO

At RABOT Energy, we cherish cognitive diversity as a cornerstone of our global culture and a driving force behind our mission to craft truly representative and impactful products for a sustainable future. We wholeheartedly embrace diversity in all its dimensions and recognize that each person contributes to our shared endeavour of assisting individuals in transitioning to green energy.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) Pricing
Description:
DocMorris steht für kundenorientierte innovative Dienstleistungen und eine große Produktvielfalt rund um die digitale Gesundheitsversorgung. Sie reichen von der schnellen Terminvereinbarung für den Online-Arztbesuch auf der Telemedizin-Plattform von TeleClinic bis zur pharmazeutischen Beratung und Versorgung mit verschreibungspflichtigen und rezeptfreien Medikamenten sowie Gesundheitsprodukten aus Deutschlands bekanntester Online-Apotheke.
Hinzu kommt der Marktplatz mit einem breiten ergänzenden Sortiment von Heil- und Hilfsmitteln sowie Produkten aus den Bereichen Ernährung, Beauty und Familie. Damit schafft DocMorris für ihre Kundinnen und Kunden einen einfachen Zugang zu umfassenden Gesundheitsdienstleistungen an einem Ort mit nur einem Klick. Im Segment Deutschland erwirtschaftete die Schweizer DocMorris AG im Jahr 2023 mit über 9 Millionen aktiven Kundinnen und Kunden einen Außenumsatz von 976 Millionen CHF.


Aufgaben



Du entwickelst Reportings und erstellst Ad-hoc-Analysen zur Umsatz-, Margen- und Preisentwicklung sowie zum Erfolg unserer Promotions.


Auf dieser Basis erarbeitest Du Handlungsempfehlungen für strategische und taktische Pricing-Entscheidungen. Damit trägst Du maßgeblich zum Geschäftserfolg unserer Produkte im Bereich der freiverkäuflichen Arzneimittel bei.


Du entwickelst unsere Pricing-Prozesse weiter und wirkst mit bei der Optimierung unserer Pricing-Algorithmen. Dabei wendest Du auch komplexe Analysemethoden an.


Du arbeitest eng mit den Bereichen Online-Marketing, Category Management, Supply-Chain-Management und Einkauf sowie unserem Data-Team zusammen.



Qualifikation



Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium in Mathematik, Statistik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Betriebswirtschaftslehre.


Ein kommerzielles Verständnis im Bereich E-Commerce, idealerweise im Bereich Pricing, rundet Dein Profil ab.


Du hast Kenntnisse im Umgang mit relationalen Datenbanken, hast bereits mit SQL gearbeitet und besitzt Erfahrungen mit BI- und Visualisierungstools (z.B. Tableau, Power BI, QlikView oder anderen).


Idealerweise hast Du bereits statistische Analysemethoden angewendet und mit gängigen Statistiksoftwarepaketen gearbeitet.


Du hast ausgeprägte analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten.


Du sprichst gutes Deutsch und gutes Englisch.



Benefits



Attraktive Vergünstigungen in diversen Shops über Corporate Benefits


Betriebliche Altersvorsorge mit attraktiven Arbeitgeberzuschüssen


30 Urlaubstage


Möglichkeit zur Teilnahme am Mitarbeiterbeteiligungsprogramm (Aktienoptionen)


Zugang zu eLearning-Plattformen wie LinkedIn Learning


Fairer Lohn für Festangestellte und Zeitarbeitnehmer sowie angemessene Vergütung von Praktika


Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und regelmäßige Entwicklungsgespräche


Tolle Mitarbeiter-Events und jährliche Firmenfeiern


Wohlfühl-Arbeitsumgebung mit klimatisierten, hellen Büros. Ergonomisch eingerichtete Arbeitsplätze mit hochmoderner technischer Ausstattung.


Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle und Homeoffice-Möglichkeiten


Gute Anbindung an den öffentlichen Nahverkehr





Gestalte mit uns das neue Gesund! Wir freuen uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung!




Bei Fragen steht Dir Matthias Wegerle unter der Telefonnummer +49 (0)621 397316 654 gerne zur Verfügung.

Show more
HTML:
DocMorris steht für kundenorientierte innovative Dienstleistungen und eine große Produktvielfalt rund um die digitale Gesundheitsversorgung. Sie reichen von der schnellen Terminvereinbarung für den Online-Arztbesuch auf der Telemedizin-Plattform von TeleClinic bis zur pharmazeutischen Beratung und Versorgung mit verschreibungspflichtigen und rezeptfreien Medikamenten sowie Gesundheitsprodukten aus Deutschlands bekanntester Online-Apotheke.
Hinzu kommt der Marktplatz mit einem breiten ergänzenden Sortiment von Heil- und Hilfsmitteln sowie Produkten aus den Bereichen Ernährung, Beauty und Familie. Damit schafft DocMorris für ihre Kundinnen und Kunden einen einfachen Zugang zu umfassenden Gesundheitsdienstleistungen an einem Ort mit nur einem Klick. Im Segment Deutschland erwirtschaftete die Schweizer DocMorris AG im Jahr 2023 mit über 9 Millionen aktiven Kundinnen und Kunden einen Außenumsatz von 976 Millionen CHF.


Aufgaben

  • Du entwickelst Reportings und erstellst Ad-hoc-Analysen zur Umsatz-, Margen- und Preisentwicklung sowie zum Erfolg unserer Promotions.

  • Auf dieser Basis erarbeitest Du Handlungsempfehlungen für strategische und taktische Pricing-Entscheidungen. Damit trägst Du maßgeblich zum Geschäftserfolg unserer Produkte im Bereich der freiverkäuflichen Arzneimittel bei.

  • Du entwickelst unsere Pricing-Prozesse weiter und wirkst mit bei der Optimierung unserer Pricing-Algorithmen. Dabei wendest Du auch komplexe Analysemethoden an.

  • Du arbeitest eng mit den Bereichen Online-Marketing, Category Management, Supply-Chain-Management und Einkauf sowie unserem Data-Team zusammen.


Qualifikation

  • Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium in Mathematik, Statistik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Betriebswirtschaftslehre.

  • Ein kommerzielles Verständnis im Bereich E-Commerce, idealerweise im Bereich Pricing, rundet Dein Profil ab.

  • Du hast Kenntnisse im Umgang mit relationalen Datenbanken, hast bereits mit SQL gearbeitet und besitzt Erfahrungen mit BI- und Visualisierungstools (z.B. Tableau, Power BI, QlikView oder anderen).

  • Idealerweise hast Du bereits statistische Analysemethoden angewendet und mit gängigen Statistiksoftwarepaketen gearbeitet.

  • Du hast ausgeprägte analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten.

  • Du sprichst gutes Deutsch und gutes Englisch.


Benefits

  • Attraktive Vergünstigungen in diversen Shops über Corporate Benefits

  • Betriebliche Altersvorsorge mit attraktiven Arbeitgeberzuschüssen

  • 30 Urlaubstage

  • Möglichkeit zur Teilnahme am Mitarbeiterbeteiligungsprogramm (Aktienoptionen)

  • Zugang zu eLearning-Plattformen wie LinkedIn Learning

  • Fairer Lohn für Festangestellte und Zeitarbeitnehmer sowie angemessene Vergütung von Praktika

  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und regelmäßige Entwicklungsgespräche

  • Tolle Mitarbeiter-Events und jährliche Firmenfeiern

  • Wohlfühl-Arbeitsumgebung mit klimatisierten, hellen Büros. Ergonomisch eingerichtete Arbeitsplätze mit hochmoderner technischer Ausstattung.

  • Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle und Homeoffice-Möglichkeiten

  • Gute Anbindung an den öffentlichen Nahverkehr


Gestalte mit uns das neue Gesund! Wir freuen uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung!


Bei Fragen steht Dir Matthias Wegerle unter der Telefonnummer +49 (0)621 397316 654 gerne zur Verfügung.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Werde Teil eines innovativen Teams bei Education Partners als “Data Analyst” (m/w/d)




Bist du begeistert von der Macht der Daten und möchtest entscheidende Einblicke liefern, die den Unternehmenserfolg vorantreiben? Education Partners, ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich der transformativen Bildung, gestaltet das Lernen und Wachsen neu. Mit aktuell 12 hochmodernen Akademien in ganz Europa treiben wir Innovationen in der digitalen Bildung voran.




Was wir bieten:

Hybrides Arbeitsmodell: Genieße die Flexibilität, sowohl von zu Hause als auch in unserem modernen Büro im Herzen Berlins zu arbeiten.
Modernste Technologie-Umgebung: Nutze die neuesten Datenanalyse-Tools und Business Intelligence-Lösungen in einem dynamischen Umfeld.
Wirkungsvolle Arbeit: Deine Analysen und Insights beeinflussen direkt die strategischen Entscheidungen.
Berufliche Weiterentwicklung: Wir fördern kontinuierliches Lernen durch Zugang zu Workshops, Konferenzen und erstklassigen Weiterbildungsangeboten.
Attraktives Gesamtpaket: Profitiere von 30 Tagen Urlaub, einem Remote-First-Ansatz, modernster Hardware und einem wettbewerbsfähigen Gehalt.




Dein Impact:

Datenanalyse & Insights: Du analysierst große und komplexe Datensätze, um wertvolle Insights zu gewinnen, die unser Verständnis von Kundenverhalten, Markttrends und Geschäftsentwicklungen vertiefen.
Dashboard- & Reporting-Erstellung: Du entwickelst aussagekräftige Dashboards und Berichte, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu erleichtern – idealerweise mit Power BI oder vergleichbaren Tools.
Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung: Du identifizierst Potenziale zur Verbesserung interner Prozesse und unterstützt die Fachbereiche dabei, datenbasierte Strategien umzusetzen.
Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen: Du arbeitest eng mit Teams aus Marketing, Produkt und Business Development zusammen, um operative sowie strategische Maßnahmen zu steuern.
Tracking & Datenqualität: Du stellst sicher, dass relevante Daten zuverlässig erfasst werden. Dafür unterstützt du bei der Implementierung von Tracking- und Analyse-Tools wie Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager.
Automatisierung & Skalierung: Du optimierst Datenprozesse, entwickelst Automatisierungen und sorgst für eine effiziente Nutzung der verfügbaren Datenquellen.




Was wir suchen:

Analytische Denkweise & datengetriebenes Mindset: Du hast ein ausgeprägtes Gespür für Daten, erfasst komplexe Zusammenhänge schnell und übersetzt diese in präzise Handlungsempfehlungen.
Tools: Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL und Excel/Google Sheets und kannst große Datensätze effizient analysieren und verarbeiten.
Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung: Du kennst Dich mit Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder Looker aus und erstellst Dashboards und Berichte, die wichtige KPIs verständlich darstellen (Power BI bevorzugt).
Kenntnisse in Tracking & Web Analytics: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung mit Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager (GTM) und weißt, wie man Nutzerverhalten richtig auswertet.
Teamplayer & Kommunikationsstärke: Du arbeitest gerne mit verschiedenen Fachabteilungen zusammen und kannst komplexe Daten verständlich präsentieren – auch für Nicht-Analysten.
Startup-Mentalität & Eigeninitiative: Du fühlst dich in dynamischen Umfeldern wohl, übernimmst Verantwortung und treibst datengetriebene Projekte eigenständig voran.
Sprachkenntnisse: Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind für diese Rolle erforderlich.

Nice-to-Have:

Erfahrung im Marketing oder Performance Marketing und ein Verständnis für datengetriebene Marketingstrategien.
Erfahrung mit Automatisierung und Skalierung von Datenprozessen.
Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics sind ein Plus.




Werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf dabei, die Zukunft des Lernens zu gestalten, indem du fundierte datengetriebene Entscheidungen ermöglicht, die unsere Geschäftsstrategie maßgeblich beeinflussen.
