Title: Data Analytics Specialist
Description:
Company Description

Vialto Partners is a market leader in global mobility services. Our purpose is to ‘Connect the world’. We are unique and the only stand-alone global mobility business. This presents a rare opportunity for our clients, stakeholders and colleagues.

Our teams help companies streamline and effectively manage their global mobility programs in a cost-efficient and compliant manner. Our services focus on providing cross-border compliance and risk assessment for tax, immigration, business travel, rewards and compensation, and remote work.

Working at Vialto Partners is about getting the chance to be part of a global and dynamic team. Globally, Vialto Partners has over 6,500 staff worldwide and continues to grow. You will work with clients from a range of industries and different geographical locations. We believe in connecting the world and supporting our colleagues to do the same in their careers by undertaking assignments and opportunities globally that broaden their skills and ultimately benefit our clients.

Vialto is unstoppable when we work together in a culture of belonging, where everyone can thrive. We encourage employees to bring their true selves and share their unique talents and expertise to positively impact the communities we serve.

To learn more about what we do, tune in to our podcast On the Move to hear expert insights on issues affecting global mobility, and read about the latest news in the industry. You can also follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram .

Job Description Summary

The Global Office of Transformation at Vialto Partners has the mission to continuously optimize our delivery model and business processes, leveraging our people, technology and scale as a global enterprise. We are obsessed with driving value for our clients, assignees and employees.

Your pivotal role revolves around applying your expertise in data interpretation & manipulation to transform complex datasets into actionable insights. You will take the lead in automating routine tasks, deploying scalable tools across the organization, and enabling the organization to make faster, more informed decisions, all while driving growth and innovation.

Job Description

Data Analysis


Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide actionable insights for business decisions in the form of dashboards & business intelligence products
Utilize statistical tools and software to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven strategies
Assist in optimizing business operations through data analysis
Ensure data accuracy and consistency across reports and analyses
Stay up to date with the latest trends and best practices in data analytics


Self-service Automation


Design, develop, and maintain self-service automation solutions that allow users to independently manage tasks and access data with minimal manual intervention
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify automation opportunities that improve user experience and operational workflows
Create user-friendly interfaces for automation tools, ensuring accessibility and ease of use for non-technical users
Implement automation solutions that integrate with various applications
Monitor and troubleshoot the performance of self-service automation tools, ensuring high availability and minimal disruptions
Develop training materials & documentation to empower users to take full advantage of self-service tools
Continuously analyze automation processes and feedback to improve functionality and user satisfaction
Stay updated with the latest automation technologies and best practices to continuously enhance service offerings


Change Management & Collaboration


Lead change management initiatives for the rollout of self-service automation tools and new data analytics capabilities, ensuring smooth transitions and adoption across teams
Collaborate closely with the Technology function and stakeholders in Client Service teams to align automation efforts with organizational goals and ensure tools meet business needs
Support ongoing communication and training efforts to encourage self-service adoption and guide users through any process changes


Qualifications & Skills


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
>5 years of proven experience in transforming operational and client-facing processes through data manipulation and insights
>5 years of proven experience in developing and implementing automation solutions, particularly self-service tools
Strong understanding of automation platforms and scripting languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell, Power Automate or similar)
Highly proficient with tools such as Power BI, Power Apps, and Google Apps Script or Web Apps. Certification in these areas would be preferable
Knowledge of data-wrangling tools e.g. Alteryx is useful but not a must-have
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively to build effective solutions
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical users
Experience working with cross-functional teams to drive automation projects and improve workflows


Additional Information


We are an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate based on any legally protected status.


Please note, AI is used as part of the application process.

  • Knowledge of data-wrangling tools e.g. Alteryx is useful but not a must-have
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively to build effective solutions
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical users

Please note, AI is used as part of the application process.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Job Description


Work closely with the Heat Pump division stakeholders to design, build, and maintain automated data pipelines and ensure the best-in-class reporting infrastructure.
Implement and maintain automated Reporting for different business units to provide visibility and performance tracking across segments.
Develop deep knowledge of customer journey processes and use it to empower the business stakeholders to optimize the conversion funnel and achieve operational excellence.



Qualifications


5+ years of relevant experience in business intelligence, data analytics or similar roles.
Enthusiasm for working in dynamic, rapidly changing environments.
Strong ability to analyse data, identify patterns, and communicate. technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record in automating data pipelines.
Exposure to Python for data analysis (e.g. pandas).
Our BI stack includes Snowflake, Streamlit, Tableau and dbt. Familiarity with the two latter ones is required/desired.
High proficiency in SQL and ETL processes.



Additional Information


The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there’s plenty of room for your ideas.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.



At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Sprachkenntnisse: Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind für diese Rolle erforderlich.

Nice-to-Have:

Erfahrung im Marketing oder Performance Marketing und ein Verständnis für datengetriebene Marketingstrategien.
Erfahrung mit Automatisierung und Skalierung von Datenprozessen.
Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics sind ein Plus.




Werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf dabei, die Zukunft des Lernens zu gestalten, indem du fundierte datengetriebene Entscheidungen ermöglicht, die unsere Geschäftsstrategie maßgeblich beeinflussen.

Show more
HTML:
Werde Teil eines innovativen Teams bei Education Partners als “Data Analyst” (m/w/d)


Bist du begeistert von der Macht der Daten und möchtest entscheidende Einblicke liefern, die den Unternehmenserfolg vorantreiben? Education Partners, ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich der transformativen Bildung, gestaltet das Lernen und Wachsen neu. Mit aktuell 12 hochmodernen Akademien in ganz Europa treiben wir Innovationen in der digitalen Bildung voran.


Was wir bieten:

  • Hybrides Arbeitsmodell: Genieße die Flexibilität, sowohl von zu Hause als auch in unserem modernen Büro im Herzen Berlins zu arbeiten.
  • Modernste Technologie-Umgebung: Nutze die neuesten Datenanalyse-Tools und Business Intelligence-Lösungen in einem dynamischen Umfeld.
  • Wirkungsvolle Arbeit: Deine Analysen und Insights beeinflussen direkt die strategischen Entscheidungen.
  • Berufliche Weiterentwicklung: Wir fördern kontinuierliches Lernen durch Zugang zu Workshops, Konferenzen und erstklassigen Weiterbildungsangeboten.
  • Attraktives Gesamtpaket: Profitiere von 30 Tagen Urlaub, einem Remote-First-Ansatz, modernster Hardware und einem wettbewerbsfähigen Gehalt.


Dein Impact:

  • Datenanalyse & Insights: Du analysierst große und komplexe Datensätze, um wertvolle Insights zu gewinnen, die unser Verständnis von Kundenverhalten, Markttrends und Geschäftsentwicklungen vertiefen.
  • Dashboard- & Reporting-Erstellung: Du entwickelst aussagekräftige Dashboards und Berichte, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu erleichtern – idealerweise mit Power BI oder vergleichbaren Tools.
  • Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung: Du identifizierst Potenziale zur Verbesserung interner Prozesse und unterstützt die Fachbereiche dabei, datenbasierte Strategien umzusetzen.
  • Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen: Du arbeitest eng mit Teams aus Marketing, Produkt und Business Development zusammen, um operative sowie strategische Maßnahmen zu steuern.
  • Tracking & Datenqualität: Du stellst sicher, dass relevante Daten zuverlässig erfasst werden. Dafür unterstützt du bei der Implementierung von Tracking- und Analyse-Tools wie Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager.
  • Automatisierung & Skalierung: Du optimierst Datenprozesse, entwickelst Automatisierungen und sorgst für eine effiziente Nutzung der verfügbaren Datenquellen.


Was wir suchen:

  • Analytische Denkweise & datengetriebenes Mindset: Du hast ein ausgeprägtes Gespür für Daten, erfasst komplexe Zusammenhänge schnell und übersetzt diese in präzise Handlungsempfehlungen.
  • Tools: Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL und Excel/Google Sheets und kannst große Datensätze effizient analysieren und verarbeiten.
  • Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung: Du kennst Dich mit Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder Looker aus und erstellst Dashboards und Berichte, die wichtige KPIs verständlich darstellen (Power BI bevorzugt).
  • Kenntnisse in Tracking & Web Analytics: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung mit Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager (GTM) und weißt, wie man Nutzerverhalten richtig auswertet.
  • Teamplayer & Kommunikationsstärke: Du arbeitest gerne mit verschiedenen Fachabteilungen zusammen und kannst komplexe Daten verständlich präsentieren – auch für Nicht-Analysten.
  • Startup-Mentalität & Eigeninitiative: Du fühlst dich in dynamischen Umfeldern wohl, übernimmst Verantwortung und treibst datengetriebene Projekte eigenständig voran.
  • Sprachkenntnisse: Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind für diese Rolle erforderlich.

Nice-to-Have:

  • Erfahrung im Marketing oder Performance Marketing und ein Verständnis für datengetriebene Marketingstrategien.
  • Erfahrung mit Automatisierung und Skalierung von Datenprozessen.
  • Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics sind ein Plus.


Werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf dabei, die Zukunft des Lernens zu gestalten, indem du fundierte datengetriebene Entscheidungen ermöglicht, die unsere Geschäftsstrategie maßgeblich beeinflussen.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
EMBRACE THE WORLD: HOP ON YOUR NEXT ADVENTURE WITH US!

We are a lively and diverse team, founded by our CEO Julian Weselek in 2016, currently active in the DACH region and France. Our ambition is to become the leading travel company for authentic, customized, multi-day trips while being mindful of our planet: we are the first travel company in the EU to set near-term carbon reduction targets approved by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi): this is an imperative step toward decarbonization. We are and always will be driving the change in the travel industry for a better tomorrow.

DESTINATION? THE WORLD!

We are discoverers. We are believers in the life-changing power of travel. On our journey we've built the amazing team that we have today - a team that sets the ambition to be remembered for building the future of travel, for consistently changing the norms of the industry and, simply, for staying true to our passion for bringing together the cultures of the world.

What is the role about?


Ultimately, we work to create the best experience in travel, using data to improve our customer experience and our product, increase our marketing reach, and optimize our costs
Own data projects fully end to end. You will manage data pipelines, ensure data quality, model data in dbt, and put them into reports or visualizations in Looker
Bring ideas to life. We welcome prototyping solutions that generate impact right away
Work as one team with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and business users to maintain and improve our data infrastructure
The Tools We Use:
Warehousing and ELT: Snowflake, dbt, SQL
Visualisation: Looker (LookML)
Data Sources and Importing Tools: Salesforce, Internal Applications, Event Data, Fivetran and Airbyte
Ad-Hoc Analysis: SQL, R, Python



What will you need to be successful?


You are proficient in SQL and bring previous experience in data analytics, data science, business intelligence, or a related field. We welcome applicants with an academic background
You have knowledge of statistics - using statistical concepts in testing, modeling, and forecasting
You have a strong business mindset and you are able to communicate data topics to non-technical stakeholders
You are able to work independently and have a problem-solving mindset
You like to collaborate with your colleagues. You ask colleagues when you’re stuck and help them out when they are. You discuss ideas and challenges



YOU ARE THE WORLD


We value your participation in Tourlane's success and complement your cash compensation with a package of employee stock options (ESOP)
Flexible working setup to get the most of your working hours: we offer full flexibility in our Hybrid/Remote model, however we do expect that you take advantage of our lively Berlin office 2-3 days per week
We share your passion for traveling: enjoy working abroad through our new program
Your wellbeing matters to us: we offer mindfulness classes to take care of your mental health, sessions with Nilo.health
We support all the diverse communities that make us Tourlane: join or create your own Employee Resource Group (ERG) and connect with Tourlaneans
Dog-friendly office: we can’t wait to meet your furry friend!



Sounds interesting? We are excited to get to know you!

Data privacy policy.
Show more

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.


Who You Are


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
Strong project management skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Operations Analyst
Description:
This role can be based in either our Berlin DE, or Amsterdam NL office.

👩‍💻👨‍💻 About the role

At Mondu we are moving fast in terms of building new products and processes. Also, we continually challenge our processes and improve them on an ongoing basis. For this, we are committed to a data-driven approach and rely on analytical insights. This role focuses on our core business processes in Operations. This includes reconciliation processes, customer support, and other Finance-related activities. Exemplary projects are setting up dashboards in the Customer Support area or the calculation of AP KPIs.

🚧 What you'll do

Your role is about improving our Operations processes on an ongoing basis. For this purpose, you'll have to gain a good understanding of the business processes we run, define relevant KPIs that allow us to understand the efficiency of them and derive actionable conclusions. The job will require that you are able to connect different data sources, set up dashboards with relevant views, and analytically interpret the analyses.


Analyze current business processes and workflows using SQL / Python to identify areas for improvement and develop strategies to enhance efficiency
Develop and implement process improvements applying methodologies such as Lean, Six Sigma, and Kaizen
Collaborate with various teams to understand their needs and challenges
Develop and present process improvement plans to senior management
Monitor the implementation of new processes and make or propose adjustments as needed
Train staff on new processes and ensure smooth transitions
Collect and analyze data to measure the effectiveness of process improvements
Prepare detailed reports and documentation on process changes
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in process improvement



Requirements

🏅What you need to succeed

Please note: Do not be put off from applying because you believe you cannot tick every box. If you think you can help, and you really want to join our growing and exciting business please get in touch, we would love to hear from you.


At least Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Management, or a related analytical field
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in continuous improvement or a related analytical role
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with proven experience in using SQL or Python to analyze and/or automate processes
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams
Proven track record of successfully implementing process improvements
Proficiency in data analysis and process mapping tools
Strong project management skills



It would be a plus if you also have:


Previous experience working on an operational role.
Certification in process improvement methodologies such as Lean, Six Sigma, or Kaizen



Benefits

🎁 What's in it for you?


€ 1000 per year for you to contribute to your learning & development to help you grow professionally and personally
€300 per year for you to endorse team build, including dinners, games, and events
28 vacation days per year (increasing 1 day every year up to 30)
We welcome you to our office in the center of Berlin or Amsterdam 3+ days a week
Take advantage of our Workation policy, allowing for up to 6 weeks every year of work outside of Germany (some restrictions apply)
Subsidised gym membership to boost your physical and mental well-being
€ 46 per month towards the DeutschlandTicket (for DE role) / public transport (for NL role)
Tax relief for payments into our Business Bike scheme
You can accelerate your career and take ownership of your work and development in a flat hierarchy where 360 feedback is encouraged.



🦸 Are you a Monduneer in disguise?

Working in a truly diverse group makes us stronger and more resilient. Furthermore, it enables an unfair advantage - the opportunity to learn from each other, see different perspectives, and consider a broader range of variables in our decision-making. That is what being a Monduneer is all about.

Thus, regardless of your background, age, disability, gender, parental status, race, religion, sexual orientation, educational background, or any other aspect you feel is a statement of your diversity, we look forward to discussing your role in mind.

If you believe you are a Monduneer in disguise, and it's time for you to shine, submit your application, and we'll take it from there.

💜 Meet Mondu

At Mondu, we have the vision to disrupt and become the leader in B2B payments. We are building a Buy Now, Pay Later solution for B2B e-commerce businesses. Our business will address a new set of customer needs in a vast new market segment. To do so, we will need to re-invent core parts of the payment experience to serve the needs of business customers. Moreover, we will need to listen closely to local customer needs and tailor our approach to the requirements of local customers in Europe.

After hugely successful funding rounds, we are looking to move at a phenomenal pace and this will not be possible without the right people in the team.

Title: Data Analyst with ML Experience (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie’s Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a diligent Data Analyst to join Billie’s Analytics team and contribute to the development and enhancement of Billie’s analytical capabilities.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, and is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

You Will


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie’s portfolio
Use statistics and ML concepts in developing actionable business solutions
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who we are looking for


You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in advanced data and analytics and statistical concepts, tools, and methodologies
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Experience with Python, R and other advanced analytical tools
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.
Show more
HTML:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie’s Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a diligent Data Analyst to join Billie’s Analytics team and contribute to the development and enhancement of Billie’s analytical capabilities.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, and is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

You Will

  • Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
  • Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
  • Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
  • Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
  • Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
  • Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie’s portfolio
  • Use statistics and ML concepts in developing actionable business solutions
  • Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
  • Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
  • Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners

Who we are looking for

  • You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
  • Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
  • Proficiency in advanced data and analytics and statistical concepts, tools, and methodologies
  • Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
  • Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
  • Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
  • Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
  • You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
  • You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
  • Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
  • Experience with Python, R and other advanced analytical tools
  • Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage

What We Offer

  • Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
  • One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
  • Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
  • A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
  • Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
  • Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
  • A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
  • Free German group classes
  • An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
  • Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
  • Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more

Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Title: Market Intelligence Analyst for Poland (w/m/d)
Description:
Our Renewables Team in Berlin and/or Stettin is looking for you!

Deine Aufgaben


Vertiefung des Verständnisses des Teams für aktuelle und erwartete Marktentwicklungen, regulatorische Rahmenbedingungen, einschließlich Beschreibungen der wichtigsten Auktionsmechanismen, Entwicklung von Auktionsprognosen und Herausforderungen (z. B. Kürzung)
Förderung der Marktexpertise mit dem Ziel, alle erforderlichen Beiträge für den Strategieüberprüfungsprozess des Unternehmens sowie für seine Arbeit an LCOEs bereitzustellen
Überwachung und Analyse der Aktivitäten der Wettbewerber und der Marktbedingungen, die für die Branche der erneuerbaren Energien spezifisch sind, um die strategische Planung zu informieren, neue Möglichkeiten zu identifizieren und Positionierungsstrategien nach Bedarf anzupassen
Überprüfung interner und externer Preisprognosen und Kennzeichnung potenzieller Risiken
Entwicklung einer Meinung zu PPAs zusammen mit dem Input des Trading-Teams von Uniper
Möglichkeit, Verständnis für andere Märkte für erneuerbare Energien zu entwickeln und bei der Identifizierung von Markteintrittsoptionen zu helfen
Arbeite mit funktionsübergreifenden Teams zusammen, einschließlich, aber nicht beschränkt auf Projektentwicklung, EPCO, kommerzielle Analyse, Marktanalyse, um die Position des Unternehmens im Land zu verbessern


Dein Profil


Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Volkswirtschaftslehre, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, Wirtschaftsrecht oder vergleichbares Studium
2 - 5 Jahre einschlägige Berufserfahrung
Expertise in den Märkten für Strom und erneuerbare Energien, Preisgestaltungssysteme sowie regulatorische Vergütungssysteme und das Bestreben, den Übergang zu erneuerbaren Energien zu unterstützen
Ausgeprägtes analytisches, strategisches, unternehmerisches Denken, kombiniert mit einem wissbegierigen Geist
Leichtigkeit und Interesse, Fähigkeiten im Projektmanagement zu entwickeln, Stakeholder kollaborativ einzubinden und neue Herausforderungen anzunehmen
Kreativer und aufgeschlossener Mensch mit einem guten Sinn für Humor
Verhandlungssichere Kenntnisse in Polnisch und Englisch (weitere Sprachen willkommen)


Our Renewables Team in Berlin and/or Stettin is looking for you!
Show more

Title: Senior BI Analyst
Description:
Why us?

RABOT Energy is looking for a Senior BI Analyst to take our data insights to the next level. With our fast company and consumer growth, the demand for high-quality insights rises across the company., We are looking for an experienced analyst to join our BI team and become a trusted partner for our stakeholders. This role will be key in delivering actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making across all departments.

Your Impact


Design and develop BI solutions, dashboards, and reports to provide meaningful insights to business stakeholders.
Play a key role in structuring and defining our Data Warehouse to ensure scalability and data integrity.
Guide and mentor team members and peers, providing technical QA and ensuring best practices in data visualization and reporting.
Analyze complex datasets and translate them into clear, strategic recommendations for leadership and cross-functional teams.
Work closely with different departments to understand data needs, ensuring insights are accessible and impactful for decision-making.


What Can You Bring


Professional Experience: Proven track record in designing and developing BI solutions, dashboards, and reports together with top-tier-stakeholders.
Technical Expertise: Advanced proficiency in BI tools (e.g., Metabase, Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Looker).
SQL Mastery: Strong SQL skills for data extraction, manipulation, and optimization.
Data Warehousing & ETL: Experience working with data warehouses, dbt, ETL processes, and big data technologies.
Analytical Mindset: Ability to analyze large and complex datasets, extract key insights, and drive data-informed decisions.
Clear Communication: Ability to present complex data insights in an understandable way to senior management and non-technical teams.
Language Skills: Fluent in English. Knowledge of German is a plus


Lacking experience in some of the areas mentioned? No need for concern – we are committed to providing you with the necessary support for learning, training, and on-the-job coaching

Our Benefits


Enjoy flexible working hours and the freedom to work remotely 2 days a week, offering you a work-life balance that suits your lifestyle.
We're committed to your growth. Benefit from comprehensive training, regular team meetings, and open, transparent communication to keep you informed and engaged.
Maintain your physical well-being with an Urban Sports Club membership that offers you a world of fitness opportunities.
Immerse yourself in a vibrant startup atmosphere, where a spirited team, exciting team events, and our 'Employees Recruit Employees' program await you – your path to rewarding success.
Celebrate the holidays with peace of mind, as you'll always have Christmas Eve and New Year's Eve off to make cherished memories.
28 Vacation days
Workation: Enjoy two weeks of workation per year and work from anywhere in the EU


For all our positions, we are open to providing flexible work arrangements to accommodate the unique needs of each individual.

About Us

RABOT Energy is an independent supplier of 100 % renewable energy, offering dynamic electricity tariffs to private and business customers. By passing on exchange buying prices to our customers, we can save them up to 35 % on their electricity bills. Electric vehicle owners particularly benefit from our dynamic electricity tariff, as we have developed a smart system that signals the car when to automatically charge during periods of low electricity prices. And this is just the beginning!

Our mission is to empower every consumer to efficiently manage their energy consumption costs while safeguarding the environment and natural resources. Through our provision of 100% renewable energy and comprehensive smart charging and energy management solutions for homes, RABOT Energy actively contributes to increasing the real green power share in Germany's electricity consumption, thus driving the energy transition forward.

"Be part of something unique, the first of its kind in Germany. Join us at RABOT Energy and seize abundant growth opportunities in the thriving world of green energy. We're a team that believes in the power of our mission, and we're looking for individuals with the passion to match ours!”

Jan Rabe, CEO

At RABOT Energy, we cherish cognitive diversity as a cornerstone of our global culture and a driving force behind our mission to craft truly representative and impactful products for a sustainable future. We wholeheartedly embrace diversity in all its dimensions and recognize that each person contributes to our shared endeavour of assisting individuals in transitioning to green energy.

Title: B2B Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
About

Was wir suchen ...

Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir einen B2B Data Analyst (all genders), der nicht nur Zahlen analysiert, sondern auch die richtigen Schlüsse zieht, Trends erkennt und neue Möglichkeiten aufzeigt. Wenn du Lust hast, mit deinem Daten-Know-how Prozesse zu optimieren, smarte Prognosen zu erstellen und unser B2B-Business aufs nächste Level zu bringen, dann freuen wir uns, von dir zu hören.

Wichtig: Für diese Position sind Deutschkenntnisse mindestens auf B2-Niveau ein Muss.

Deine Aufgaben

Du analysierst interne und externe Datenquellen und findest die relevanten Insights.

Du erstellst Forecasts, Demand Plannings und Co., damit alle wissen, wo die Reise hingeht.

Du beantwortest Fragen des B2B-Teams, testest Hypothesen und ziehst proaktiv Schlüsse aus den Daten – immer mit Blick auf konkrete Handlungsempfehlungen.

Du nutzt vorhandene Daten, um Vorhersagen zu möglichen Kampagnen-Ergebnissen zu treffen.

Du baust eine neue Datenstruktur auf, die alle notwendigen Standard-Reportings enthält – gemeinsam mit dem Team legst du fest, wie maximale Transparenz und Sichtbarkeit erreicht werden können.

Du identifizierst Geschäftsmöglichkeiten: Sei es durch das Erkennen von Marketing- und Kampagnentrends, die Verbesserung interner Prozesse oder durch den Einsatz datengetriebener Plattformen, die Vertriebsaktivitäten transparenter machen

Dein Profil

fundierte Erfahrung im Bereich Datenanalyse und Business Intelligence (BI)

umfangreiche Kenntnisse in mathematischen und statistischen Analysen sowie den entsprechenden Tools

schnelle Auffassungsgabe zur Übersetzung komplexer Anforderungen in konkrete Aufgaben

service- und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise mit einer Balance aus Perfektionismus und Pragmatismus

visionäre Denkweise, um Innovationen voranzutreiben und das B2B-Geschäft weiterzuentwickeln

Sicherstellung von Datenintegrität und -genauigkeit sowie Optimierung von Datenprozessen

Erfahrung mit Excel, SQL, Tableau, Power BI und Programmierung in Python oder R

Fähigkeit, komplexe Datenanalysen in umsetzbare Erkenntnisse für Entscheidungsträger zu übersetzen

akademischer Abschluss in einem betriebswirtschaftlichen Fachbereich oder vergleichbare Berufserfahrungen

Warum wir?

Wir sind ein motiviertes Team mit echtem Zusammenhalt – wir unterstützen einander.

Du wirst schnell ein fester Teil unseres Teams und kannst deine Ideen jederzeit einbringen.

Für alles, was deinen Job einfacher oder flexibler macht, bekommst du ein Budget.

Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Home-Office? Machen wir möglich – ganz unkompliziert in Absprache.

28 Urlaubstage warten auf dich – und jedes Jahr bei uns gibt’s einen extra Tag obendrauf (bis max. 30).

Stell dir jeden Monat Gutscheine im Wert von 50 Euro zusammen – bei vielen spannenden Partner*innen.

Dein Deutschland-Ticket? Das übernehmen wir für dich!

Nutze unseren Zugang zu OpenUp für anonyme, professionelle Unterstützung - für deine mentale Gesundheit.

Regelmäßige Team-Aktivitäten, ob im Office oder draußen, gehören bei uns dazu.

Teste Produktneuheiten und Trends, bevor sie auf den Markt kommen.

Sichere dir exklusive Rabatte auf unser Sortiment und viele weitere Vorteile mit Corporate Benefits.

Modernes Arbeiten mit Apple-Produkten und einem funktionalen Arbeitsplatz ist bei uns Standard.

Du willst dich bewerben? Dann los!

Schicke uns deinen Lebenslauf sowie ein kurzes Anschreiben unter der Angabe deiner Gründe, warum DU unser Perfect Match bist.

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Über uns

Als Beauty-Onlineshop bringen wir deine liebsten Produkte kuratierter Marken aus den USA, UK & Co. nach Deutschland und sehen uns dabei auch als Sprungbrett für kleine, noch wachsende Beauty-Brands.

Denn neben unserer Präsenz als Beauty-Onlineshop arbeiten wir hinter den Kulissen auch als Distributor für innovative Marken aus dem Ausland. Dazu gehören Geek & Gorgeous, RevitaLash und The Fox Tan, denen wir neue Zugänge zu bekannten Retailern in Europa eröffnen.

Dabei legen wir mit unserem diversen, jungen Team aus rund 50 Mitarbeitenden den Fokus auf ganzheitliche Marketingkonzepte, um Tag für Tag das Beauty-Game in der DACH-Region weiter zu revolutionieren. Das macht unsere Arbeit weltweit einzigartig und besonders abwechslungsreich.

Die PURISH GmbH fördert aktiv eine Kultur der Wertschätzung von Vielfalt. Daher begrüßen wir Bewerbungen von People of Color, Menschen aller Nationalitäten, Religionen und Weltanschauungen, sexueller Orientierungen und geschlechtlicher Identitäten sowie aller Altersgruppen und möglichen Einschränkungen.

Wir ermutigen alle, sich bei uns zu bewerben!

Nice-to-have skills


Data Analysis
Business Intelligence
SQL
Tableau
Power BI
Python
R
Berlin, Berlin, Germany


Work experience


Data Analyst
Business Intelligence


Languages


German
Show more

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Über uns

Als Beauty-Onlineshop bringen wir deine liebsten Produkte kuratierter Marken aus den USA, UK & Co. nach Deutschland und sehen uns dabei auch als Sprungbrett für kleine, noch wachsende Beauty-Brands.

Denn neben unserer Präsenz als Beauty-Onlineshop arbeiten wir hinter den Kulissen auch als Distributor für innovative Marken aus dem Ausland. Dazu gehören Geek & Gorgeous, RevitaLash und The Fox Tan, denen wir neue Zugänge zu bekannten Retailern in Europa eröffnen.

Dabei legen wir mit unserem diversen, jungen Team aus rund 50 Mitarbeitenden den Fokus auf ganzheitliche Marketingkonzepte, um Tag für Tag das Beauty-Game in der DACH-Region weiter zu revolutionieren. Das macht unsere Arbeit weltweit einzigartig und besonders abwechslungsreich.

Die PURISH GmbH fördert aktiv eine Kultur der Wertschätzung von Vielfalt. Daher begrüßen wir Bewerbungen von People of Color, Menschen aller Nationalitäten, Religionen und Weltanschauungen, sexueller Orientierungen und geschlechtlicher Identitäten sowie aller Altersgruppen und möglichen Einschränkungen.

Wir ermutigen alle, sich bei uns zu bewerben!

Nice-to-have skills

  • Data Analysis
  • Business Intelligence
  • SQL
  • Tableau
  • Power BI
  • Python
  • R
  • Berlin, Berlin, Germany

Work experience

  • Data Analyst
  • Business Intelligence

Languages

  • German

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
Description:
Wir suchen Dich als Business Intelligence Consultant




InfoFabrik ist ein dynamisches und wachsendes mittelständisches Unternehmen mit einem zentralen Office in Berlin. Wir suchen nach einem erfahrenen und engagierten Business Intelligence Consultant (m/w/d), der unser Team unterstützt und maßgeschneiderte BI-Lösungen entwickelt, die unseren Kunden helfen, fundierte Entscheidungen zu treffen und ihre Geschäftsprozesse zu optimieren.




Was wir uns von dir wünschen:

mindestens 2 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich BI & Data
Erfolgreiches Informatikstudium oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation/Ausbildung
Sicherer Umgang mit SQL und Erweiterungen (PL/SQL, T-SQL oder vergleichbar)
Erfahrung im Datawarehousing
Business Analyse & Beratung von externen Kunden
Anforderungsanalyse, Spezifikation und Umsetzung
Stetige Optimierung der Entwicklungsprozesse
Konzeption von Testkonzepten und Implementierung der jeweiligen Testumgebung sowie Durchführung von Tests
Ausgeprägte Kunden- und Ergebnisorientierung
Strukturierte Arbeitsweise / analytisches Denken
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse




Wir haben tolle Aufgaben für dich:

Mitarbeit in verschiedenen parallelen Projekten mit viel Abwechslung im Arbeitsalltag
fachliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung mit kompetenten Kollegen und anspruchsvollen Aufgaben
kleine Teams und übersichtliche Projekte




Techstack:

ReportServer (eigene Software für BI Lösungen)
Oracle Datenbank, PL/SQL
SQL-Server, T/SQL




Unsere Benefits:

mobiles Arbeiten ist möglich (2x pro Woche im Office)
Deutschlandticket
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
Teamevents




Was uns ausmacht:

eine offene, wertschätzende und respektvolle Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe
starker Teamzusammenhalt dank flacher Hierarchien und schneller Entscheidungen




Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt und Du hast Lust ein Teil unseres Teams zu werden, dann sende uns Deine Bewerbung an personal@InfoFabrik.de

Show more

Title: Knowledge Analyst
Description:
Knowledge Analyst - Contract - Till End of Year




My client is a not-for-profit entity who are key to the successful running of the electricity in the UK. They are vital to the operation of the wholesale electricity market and a trusted, independent and reliable market expert. They are seeking a Knowledge Analyst to support them with readiness for the introduction of a transformation programme which will help them move systems to a more accurate and efficient energy usage measurement system.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to define and deliver knowledge content required for Market Participant readiness.
Conduct knowledge audits to identify, organise, and categorise existing knowledge assets.
Work with business, IT, and data teams to align information architecture with organisational goals.
Develop and implement knowledge management processes, ensuring compliance with best practices.
Assist in creating and delivering knowledge materials, driving self-service adoption and customer journey efficiency.
Oversee the transition of knowledge content to 'business as usual' teams post-implementation.

Requirements:

Experience in the energy sector and customer-focused transformation (desirable but not essential).
Strong research, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Proficient in knowledge management systems and information categorisation.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities.
Degree or vocational qualification in information science, computer science, or a related field.
Strong organisational skills and ability to manage complex workloads.

Personal Attributes:

Proactive, logical thinker with a hands-on approach.
Strong attention to detail and outcome-driven focus.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-intensity environment.

Apply today to play a key role in this transformative programme!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The role

We are looking to hire a Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics Team in London.

Working at WGSN

Together, we create tomorrow

A career with WGSN is fast-paced, exciting and full of opportunities to grow and develop. We're a team of consumer and design trend forecasters, content creators, designers, data analysts, advisory consultants and much more, united by a common goal: to create tomorrow.

WGSN's trusted consumer and design forecasts power outstanding product design, enabling our customers to create a better future. Our services cover consumer insights, beauty, consumer tech, fashion, interiors, lifestyle, food and drink forecasting, data analytics and expert advisory. If you are an expert in your field, we want to hear from you.

Role Overview
We are looking for a strategic, intelligent and commercial individual to provide world class data analysis and collaborate strongly with our strategists and consultants. The Data Analyst must demonstrate an understanding in retail or consumer insights data analysis which they can combine to enhance and underpin the work that WGSN delivers. The successful candidate will work with our stakeholders to analyse data and aid in the generation of breakthrough insight for our clients. The work is focused on the Sports and Outdoors market, and experience or interest in the industry is a strong advantage.

The team

At WGSN we offer insights and inspiration from around the globe. We help our customers stay ahead and informed through trend forecasting and data science. The WGSN Data team is an exceptional mix of brilliant minds with diverse backgrounds in fashion, retail and consumer insights based in the UK, US and Asia. We prioritise collaboration to extract meaningful insights from our datasets and help our stakeholders take actionable business decisions.

Key Accountabilities


Provide high quality and accurate analysis for WGSN‘s clients, based on an understanding of one or more of the following categories that WGSN covers:
Consumer insights, key trends and drivers
Sports and Outdoors
Fashion
Tackle the challenge of extracting business intelligence from large data sets. Ability to see beyond the numbers
Ability to effectively present and synthesize actionable insights that respond to industry’s needs and business questions through effective data storytelling
Conduct primary and secondary research across a variety of quant data sets and deliver analysis that provides actionable recommendations that will benefit the client's future business
Proactively suggest ways to visualise complex data sets, generating charts/tables that give insightful views of key business issues and opportunities
Engage and collaborate with key stakeholders in the business and data teams in region and across territories to ensure consistency of data analysis across the company
Is confident to take an active and vocal role in team meetings, putting forward new ideas and suggestions for data integration
Responsibility for projects being delivered in brief, in a relevant, insightful and commercially successful manner with data integrity at the core





This list is not exhaustive and there may be other activities you are required to deliver.

Skills, Experience & Qualifications Required


Solid proven experience in a data analyst role
Experience in Retail, Ecommerce, Digital Marketing or Sports and Outdoors is strongly preferred
Strong organizational and communication skills, including excellent data storytelling skills
Excellent interpersonal skills comfortable to tackle work within a global team
A person that gets things done and a problem solver
An analytical mind, with the ability to distinguish between what is important and what is not, making the complex simple
Technical Experience with:
Data Warehouses (one or multiple): Snowflake, SQL, BigQuery, etc
Languages (one or multiple): SQL (must), Python/R (beneficial)
Visualisation (one or multiple): Tableau, Looker, Power BI, etc
Beneficial to have experience with:
Sprint Planning/Development using JIRA





What We Offer
Our benefits and wellbeing package offers flexible benefits you can tailor to your own personal needs, including:



25 days of holiday per year - with an option to buy/ sell up to 5 days
Pension, Life Assurance and Income Protection Flexible benefits platform with options including Private Medical, Dental Insurance & Critical Illness
Employee assistance programme, season ticket loans and cycle to work scheme
Volunteering opportunities and charitable giving options
Great learning and development opportunities





More About WGSN
WGSN is the global authority on consumer trend forecasting.

We help brands around the world create the right products at the right time for tomorrow’s consumer.

Our values

We Are Everywhere

The future is everything, it happens everywhere. WGSN is the world-leading forecaster because we track and analyse consumer behaviours, product innovation, design and creativity, everywhere.

We Are Future Focused

We utilise our global resources and intelligence to research, source and analyse quantitative and qualitative data to produce our forecasts. Everything we do is focused on working with our customers to create a successful and positive tomorrow.

We Are Rigorous

We source, review and assess quantitative and qualitative data to produce robust, actionable forecasts. To provide credible insights and design solutions for our clients, it is essential that rigour runs through everything we do.

Our culture

An inclusive culture is one of our key priorities. We want our people to truly be themselves and thrive. We love having a diverse team of people who bring new ideas, different strengths and perspectives & reflect the global audience we work with.

Inclusive workforce

We are committed to supporting the environment and sustainability, including ensuring our pension plan defaults to sustainable options and striving to be net zero by 2030.

Recognising great performance is a key part of our culture. Our Awards schemes recognise and reward the brilliant achievements of our people.

We offer a flexible working environment with a wide range of flexible, hybrid and agile working arrangements. Conversations about flexible working have always been—and will continue to be—actively encouraged here, but we do not offer full remote working.

We want to ensure everyone has the opportunity to perform their best when interviewing, so if you require any reasonable adjustments that would make you more comfortable during the process, please let us know so that we can do our best to support you.

A Note for Recruiters

Thank you so much for your interest in working with us at WGSN! Our internal Talent Acquisition team takes care of all our recruitment efforts. When we need some extra help, we partner with agencies on our Preferred Supplier List (PSL) that truly understand our business, culture and ways of working together. Since we focus on these established partnerships, we’re unable to respond to unsolicited contacts or CVs from outside our PSL. But don’t worry! If we decide to explore new partnerships, we’ll be sure to reach out.

Title: Data Analyst, Category Development
Description:
At Gopuff, we’re not just delivering convenience—we’re redefining how the world shops. Since pioneering instant needs in 2013, we’ve empowered millions of customers across the U.S. and U.K. to reclaim their time through seamless, fast, and reliable delivery. Behind this transformative journey is our tech-first mindset, relentless obsession with customer experience and operational excellence.

We’re looking for an exceptional Lead Data Analyst to shape the future of quick commerce.

This is not just a job—it’s a mission. As a Lead Data Analyst in the Category Development team, you will support the rapid growth of our business by analysing our huge datasets to uncover insights that drive improvements across our category & supply chain performance.

You’ll partner with cross-functional teams, challenge the status quo, and make high-impact recommendations. With your mastery of SQL, Python and advanced analytics, you won’t just support decisions—you’ll lead them.

We believe great work happens through collaboration, not competition. You foster a culture of curiosity, respect, and shared success, ensuring data is a tool for empowerment, not gatekeeping. No room for arrogance—just a commitment to helping others and making an impact together.

If you’re a high-performer who thrives in fast-paced, high-impact environments, this is your chance to build, innovate, and leave a lasting mark on one of the most disruptive industries in the world.

Are you ready to shape the future of commerce? Let’s go. 🚀

You Will:


Develop innovative measurement and analytical approaches that build our understanding of performance and customers, embedding these learnings into the Category & In-Stock team's day-to-day decision making.
Answer complex business questions through detailed quantitative analysis and experimentation, extracting meaningful and actionable insights.
Influence both strategic and tactical decision-making in our EU Leadership and Category Management teams through strong communication, and by proactively identifying opportunities for improvement.
Build the necessary models and tools to inform our pricing strategies, helping Category Managers maintain a competitive position versus our competitors while maximising margin opportunity.
Provide clear insight into the value and success of different buying policies we have built into our Stock Ordering Tool to ensure we are hitting the target levels of Waste and Availability.
Partner with our Customer Insights team, supporting them with their customer and competitor research projects and helping to embed learnings into the Category teams.
Partner with our MFC Operations team to ensure that inventory compliance reporting & capacity tooling are providing In-Stock team with correct insights they can use to adjust their buying decisions.
Proactively build and nurture a culture of data-driven decision making through coaching & supporting teams to increase their data literacy and confidence.


You Have:


3-5 years of experience in analytics or data science - preferably in fields related to grocery, trading, supply chain.
A strong understanding of statistical analysis and experiment design.
Expert skills in SQL / Python, able to write structured and efficient queries on large data sets.
Experience with dbt is a strong plus
Development experience with BI platforms such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI.
Experience with Looker and LookML in particular is strongly preferred.
A strong and confident communication style, with good knowledge of data visualization and storytelling.
A high degree of curiosity, comfortable gathering and analyzing large amounts of data across a variety of business dimensions.


Benefits:


Company RSU’s (Company Shares)
Private Medical + Dental cover
Annual performance appraisal and bonus
Employee Discount + FAM membership
Career growth opportunities


Company Summary & EEOC Statement:

At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable. Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it—stuff happens. But that’s where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes.

And now, we’re assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.

Like what you’re hearing? Then join us on Team Blue.

Gopuff is an equal employment opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

Data Science at Stripe is a vibrant community where data analysts, data scientists and engineers learn and grow together. You will work with some of Stripe’s most fundamental and exciting data, and use that data to help drive company-wide initiatives. We have a variety of Data Analytics roles and teams across Stripe and will seek to align you to the most relevant team based on your background.

What you'll do

In this role, you will partner deeply with teams across Stripe to ensure that our users, our products, and our business have the models, data products, and insights needed to make decisions and grow responsibly. You will work closely with partners to extract insights from Stripe's rich and complex data. You will also work with leaders to translate business needs into data problems. You will build metrics, scalable data pipelines, dashboards, and reports to inform and run the business. You will deliver actionable business recommendations through analyses and data storytelling.

Who you are

We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements


2-8+ years experience in Business Intelligence Engineering, Data Engineering, Data Analysis or Data Science roles, building data pipelines and analyzing large datasets to solve problems
Proficiency in SQL and Python
Strong statistical knowledge
Expertise in visualization and using data insights to make recommendations and achieve goals
Proven ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with great attention to detail
Ability to clearly communicate results and drive impact
Comfortable collaborating across functions to identify data analytics problems and execute solutions with technical rigor and data-driven insights.



Preferred Qualifications


Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or a related technical field.
Prior experience at a growth stage internet or software company.
Experience with distributed data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark to write and debug data pipelines.
Good understanding of development processes and best practices like engineering standards, code reviews, and testing.



Hybrid work at Stripe

This role is available either in an office or a remote location (typically, 35+ miles or 56+ km from a Stripe office).

Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams.

A remote location, in most cases, is defined as being 35 miles (56 kilometers) or more from one of our offices. While you would be welcome to come into the office for team/business meetings, on-sites, meet-ups, and events, our expectation is you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location where you currently or plan to live.

Pay and benefits

The annual salary range for this role in the primary location is C$121,100 - C$181,700. This range may change if you are hired in another location. For sales roles, the range provided is the role’s On Target Earnings (“OTE”) range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate’s experience, qualifications, and specific location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the primary location may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Specific benefits and details about what compensation is included in the salary range listed above will vary depending on the applicant’s location and can be discussed in more detail during the interview process. Benefits/additional compensation for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; retirement plans; health benefits; and wellness stipends.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Genpact (NYSE: G) is a global professional services and solutions firm delivering outcomes that shape the future. Our 125,000+ people across 30+ countries are driven by our innate curiosity, entrepreneurial agility, and desire to create lasting value for clients. Powered by our purpose – the relentless pursuit of a world that works better for people – we serve and transform leading enterprises, including the Fortune Global 500, with our deep business and industry knowledge, digital operations services, and expertise in data, technology, and AI.

Inviting applications for the role of Business System Analyst

Location: Toronto Canada ( 3 days onsite/week)




Skills:

Understanding the process of auto ingestion and its validation
Building a strategic platform on Azure from the legacy systems
Experience in Data mapping and doing it in a more efficient way and if anything has been done wrong in the source system then get it corrected
Analyse the data what is being done today and how it can be further improved for future
Streamline the data so that it can be used simultaneously at multiple places
Make sure data completion and data accuracy checks have been done on datasets bringing out to cloud platforms
Experience in SQL server and PySpark as legacy system has SQL and strategic platform has PySpark
Experience working in confluence
Experience working on Azure Databricks
Experience working in Web application, API’s and system requirements







Genpact is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Genpact is committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation. Get to know us at genpact.com and on LinkedIn, X, YouTube, and Facebook.

Furthermore, please do note that Genpact does not charge fees to process job applications and applicants are not required to pay to participate in our hiring process in any other way. Examples of such scams include purchasing a 'starter kit,' paying to apply, or purchasing equipment or training.
