Title: Intermediate Data Modeler
HTML:
Clio is more than just a tech company–we are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice.

Summary:

We are currently looking for a new Data Modeler to join our Business Intelligence team in one of our Vancouver, Calgary, or Toronto locations.

What your team does:

Our Business Intelligence team is part of the larger Data & AI group. Together, we’re focused on stewarding a scientific culture to drive better decisions. Along with the Manager of Business Intelligence, you will be working across departments to empower all stakeholders to make better decisions through data-oriented solutions, with a focus on making data easy and accessible at Clio. You will help our business grow, help our customers succeed, and continuously improve the way we operate.

Who you are:

We are looking for someone who takes data seriously, thrives in a rapid-growth, high-velocity environment, and someone who lives and breathes their values. We’re looking for an innovator and a thought leader! We’re looking for someone who is:

  • Passionate about driving growth empirically;
  • Always looking to innovate with data and explore open-ended questions;
  • Strategically minded and never shies away from a challenge;
  • Self-motivated and able to work autonomously and collaboratively;
  • Agile and responsive, and comfortable with constant change.

You will own our analytics infrastructure and be responsible for collecting, managing, and analyzing data to develop insights and recommendations to enable the business to take action and make better decisions.

You will drive new analytics projects, maintain and evolve existing reporting and dashboards, respond to incoming data requests, and implement data best practices and processes for consistency and scalability.

What you’ll work on:

  • Partnering with stakeholders, self-serve report creators, data scientists, and data engineers, to create meaningful, intentional data solutions;
  • Creating and editing data models for users to answer business questions and optimize queries and reports for performance;

What you may have:

  • An undergraduate or graduate degree in a relevant quantitative discipline (computing science, statistics, mathematics, etc.);
  • 3+ years applied experience in business intelligence and/or data modeling;
  • Proficiency in database modeling, SQL, and data warehousing principles;
  • Proficiency in understanding business requirements and translating them to data sets in a data warehouse;
  • Experience with version control concepts and tools (Git);
  • Experience building data models and sets to be consumed for reporting and analytics using dbt;
  • Familiar with concepts involving data modeling techniques such as Star schema and knowledge of Normalization/DeNormalization concepts;
  • Experience building analytics to drive operational efficiency and/or impact revenue (e.g., renewal models, TAM, churn analysis);
  • Proficiency with data visualization and data storytelling;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Serious bonus points if you:

  • Have experience working with Redshift or other cloud data warehouses;
  • Are an expert translating technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders;
  • Proven experience with one or several cloud based business intelligence tools, incl. Tableau, PowerBI, and Looker.
  • Decoupling analytics logic from BI dashboards and create unified data models using dbt that can be used to answer specific business questions;
  • Similar to the above responsibility, in order to drive new analytics projects, envisioning and delivering data sets that encompass key data points for core business subject areas, such as customer success, and revenue operations;
  • Understanding in-depth functioning of the business and how metrics related to business performance and leveraging your technical expertise and business acumen to make it easy for stakeholders to understand data;
  • Maintaining and evolving existing reporting and dashboards, responding to incoming data requests, and implementing data best practices and processes for consistency and scalability;
  • Effectively communicating findings and feedback to technical and non-technical stakeholders;
  • Working with the Business Intelligence Manager to govern our BI environment to empower our self serve stakeholders leveraging data and dashboards;
  • Working with the Business Intelligence Manager to proactively identify and resolve gaps in training, learning resources, and other roadblocks preventing stakeholders from leveraging data for decision making;
  • Working closely with the data engineering team, software developers, and/or 3rd party vendors to turn newly acquired raw data into a report/analysis -ready shape.

What you will find here:

Compensation is one of the main components of Clio’s Total Rewards Program. We have developed a series of programs and processes to ensure we are creating fair and competitive pay practices that form the foundation of our human and high-performing culture.

Some highlights of our Total Rewards program include:

  • Competitive, equitable salary with top-tier health benefits, dental, and vision insurance
  • Hybrid work environment, with expectation for local Clions (Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto, and Dublin) to be in office minimum 2 days per week on our Anchor Days.
  • Flexible time off policy, with an encouraged 20 days off per year.
  • $2000 annual counseling benefit
  • RRSP matching and RESP contribution
  • Clioversary recognition program with special acknowledgement at 3, 5, 7, and 10 years

The full salary range* for this role is $83,700 to $98,500 to $113,300 CAD.Please note there are a separate set of salary bands for other regions based on local currency.

  • We aim to hire all candidates between the minimum and the midpoint of the full salary range. We reserve the midpoint to the maximum of the salary band for internal employees who demonstrate sustained high performance and impact at Clio. The final offer amount for this role will be dependent on individual experience and skillset of the candidate. Please note there are a separate set of salary bands for other regions based on local currency.

Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility

Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion. We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Job description

Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.




A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:




In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide

Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.




Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!




TELUS Digital AI Community




Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.




Qualification path

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.







Basic Requirements




Full Professional Proficiency in English & French language

Being a resident in Canada for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Canada

Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information

Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance

Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment




In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

to diversity.
Show more

Title: Data Protection Analyst (Global Security)
Description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

We are looking for experienced Data Protection Analyst in the Greater Vancouver area. The opportunity is to work in a cross functional team with the primary goal to provide and maintain security infrastructure, providing stability by following and using the tools, policies, processes and procedures that are available while supporting RBC's constant growth, innovation and adoption of emerging technologies. The opportunity is to provide oversight, monitoring and technical control enhancements to existing data loss protection services and processes.

What will you do?


Proactively investigate and perform operational enhancements, support and protection efforts.
Communicate with internal areas at all reporting levels.
Collaborate with data protection teams while addressing operational issues and to enhancing monitoring controls.
Perform policy updates by coordinating with other team members.
Ensure that process documentation is maintained, reviewed, and updated on an ongoing basis
Create, review, maintain and update documentation. Undertake problem ownership and projects leadership.
Responsible for the planning and controlled execution of releases into the managed environment.
Improving the process by identify areas for automation and scripting wherever possible


What do you need to succeed?

Must have:


IT-security professional with solid experience in the infrastructure security domain or in the IT application security domain.
Experience running data discovery, loss and cloud-based protection services.
Familiar with data loss investigations and incident response processes.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Highly motivated with the ability to work independently and effectively manage multiple priorities.
A willingness to make a difference and help protect business areas and data.
Experience with global deployments of data loss prevention products and/or cloud-based solutions


Nice to have:


Industry related certification – e.g. CASP+/CISSP/CISA/CISM
Knowledge of financial services business line(s) and associated applications and processes
Information Technology standards, methodologies, and audit requirements
Experience on administrating and maintaining Red Hat Enterprise Linux system
General Networking skill including but not limited to firewalls, routing, NAT, SI Model, packet trace and analysis knowledge
Knowledge on Shell Scripting Project management skills Interpersonal Skills Communication, flexibility, self-driven, team player


What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

HTML:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

We are looking for experienced Data Protection Analyst in the Greater Vancouver area. The opportunity is to work in a cross functional team with the primary goal to provide and maintain security infrastructure, providing stability by following and using the tools, policies, processes and procedures that are available while supporting RBC's constant growth, innovation and adoption of emerging technologies. The opportunity is to provide oversight, monitoring and technical control enhancements to existing data loss protection services and processes.

What will you do?

  • Proactively investigate and perform operational enhancements, support and protection efforts.
  • Communicate with internal areas at all reporting levels.
  • Collaborate with data protection teams while addressing operational issues and to enhancing monitoring controls.
  • Perform policy updates by coordinating with other team members.
  • Ensure that process documentation is maintained, reviewed, and updated on an ongoing basis
  • Create, review, maintain and update documentation. Undertake problem ownership and projects leadership.
  • Responsible for the planning and controlled execution of releases into the managed environment.
  • Improving the process by identify areas for automation and scripting wherever possible

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • IT-security professional with solid experience in the infrastructure security domain or in the IT application security domain.
  • Experience running data discovery, loss and cloud-based protection services.
  • Familiar with data loss investigations and incident response processes.
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Highly motivated with the ability to work independently and effectively manage multiple priorities.
  • A willingness to make a difference and help protect business areas and data.
  • Experience with global deployments of data loss prevention products and/or cloud-based solutions

Nice to have:

  • Industry related certification – e.g. CASP+/CISSP/CISA/CISM
  • Knowledge of financial services business line(s) and associated applications and processes
  • Information Technology standards, methodologies, and audit requirements
  • Experience on administrating and maintaining Red Hat Enterprise Linux system
  • General Networking skill including but not limited to firewalls, routing, NAT, SI Model, packet trace and analysis knowledge
  • Knowledge on Shell Scripting Project management skills Interpersonal Skills Communication, flexibility, self-driven, team player

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Title: Senior Manager - Analytics
Description:
Who we are:

For over 20 years, Global Relay has set the standard in enterprise information archiving with industry-leading cloud archiving, surveillance, eDiscovery, and analytics solutions. We securely capture and preserve the communications data of the world’s most highly regulated firms, giving them greater visibility and control over their information and ensuring compliance with stringent regulations.

Though we offer competitive compensation and benefits and all the other perks one would expect from an established company, we are not your typical technology company. Global Relay is a career-building company. A place for big ideas. New challenges. Groundbreaking innovation. It’s a place where you can genuinely make an impact – and be recognized for it.

We believe great businesses thrive on diversity, inclusion, and the contributions of all employees. To that end, we recruit candidates from different backgrounds and foster a work environment that encourages employees to collaborate and learn from each other, completely free of barriers.

We encourage you to apply if your qualifications and experience are a good fit for any of our openings.

Your role:

We are looking for a dynamic Analytics Senior Manager to join our growing team to lead data analytics initiatives in identifying business needs, aligning analytics execution with our analytics vision and strategy, and manage the processes and people responsible for accurate data collection, processing, modeling and analysis. The ideal candidate has the insight and experience to distinguish between projects that range from prototype to scalable long-term analytics solutions and is able to manage these varying degrees of project complexity and outcomes with business stakeholders. A business mindset to convert insights into strategic opportunities for Global Relay is a necessity for this role. You will work closely with leaders across Accounting & Finance, Product, Sales, Customer Success, Customer Support and Marketing to support and implement high-quality, data-solutions that drive business decisions.

Your responsibilities:



Refine the Analytics vision and strategy for broader adoption of analytics across Finance, Sales, Customer Support, Marketing and Product, working collaboratively with other data teams to deliver value to the organization through data insights
Define multi-year analytics roadmaps by working closely with key business stakeholders to identify analytics business needs, detail requirements and crawl, walk, run adoption approaches
Use extensive knowledge of advanced data modelling techniques to evaluate initiatives for business value, complexity and feasibility to recommend prioritization of initiatives to business stakeholders
Oversee the data/report requests process: tracking requests submitted, prioritization, approval, etc.
Manage and optimize processes for data intake, validation, mining and engineering as well as modeling, visualization and communication deliverables
Develop and implement quality controls and departmental standards to ensure organizational quality expectations, data security and regulatory requirements are adhered to
Anticipate future demands of initiatives related to people, technology and business within your department to design and implement solutions to meet these needs
Organize and drive successful completion of data insight initiatives through effective management of analyst and data employees and effective collaboration with stakeholders
Manage our data and analytics platform products throughout the entire product development lifecycle, from discovery and experimentation to launch and make sure the Analytics platform is accessed and used in alignment with our Analytics vision and centre of excellence governance process
Play a key role in forming an Analytics Centre of Excellence and fostering close collaboration across Data and Business Analysts who will be the area subject matter experts across various domains within the organization
Define data governance standards and identify areas of improving data quality that will aid improved reporting
Define guiding principles and monitor their adherence for data and business analyst users when creating dashboards from corporate data sets or when defining their own data sets



About you:



5 to 8 years of experience in an Analytics leadership role setting strategies, vision and developing roadmaps
Experience of creating Analytical products for both internal business stakeholders and external customers with specific focus on secure data sharing between both
Ability to manage multiple projects and competing priorities effectively
Understanding of and experience using analytical concepts and statistical techniques: hypothesis development, designing tests/experiments, analyzing data, drawing conclusions, and developing actionable recommendations
Is someone who is continuously curious about the ever-changing advanced data analytics space and keeps their craft sharpened at all times
Has a willingness to create analytical prototypes where the need arises to drive decision making and aid planning for longer term scalability
Deep understanding of Data Management platforms and the role they play in scalable analytics
Ability to communicate Data Management needs to aid Analytics with sufficient understanding and insight to drive close collaboration and product development across Analytics and Data Management teams
Strong business acumen and the ability to relate to varying business stakeholder audiences to link concepts to needs and outcomes using story telling with data techniques
Has a track record of driving analytics maturity and adoption and the ability to scale the use of Analytics supported by effective strategy alignment, data governance and analytics community guidance to prioritize initiatives
Proficient in using Confluence, Jira and Product Board to organize, plan and document all analytics requirements, projects, roadmaps and procedures
Values precision and accuracy in defining, scoping, building and presenting data products
Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and exceptional communication skills allowing for effective work with a variety of different departments
Proficiency in MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint and the ability to conceptualize and visualize ideas in Miro
Experience in a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) subscription environment is a definite asset
Familiarity with Salesforce CRM system and cloud-based accounting applications like NetSuite an asset
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment with a solution-based mindset
Strong work ethic and integrity with the ability to exercise tact and discretion and to be entrusted with confidential information



Compensation:

Global Relay advertises the pay range for this role in compliance with British Columbia’s pay transparency laws. Individual pay rates are determined by evaluating factors such as expertise, skills, education, and professional background.

The range below reflects the expected annual base salary, which is only one element of our comprehensive total rewards package designed to reflect our company pay philosophy, culture and values. We aim to foster an inspiring work environment and support employees' work-life rhythms. We provide a comprehensive extended health benefits program, including virtual healthcare and a wellness allowance. Employees also receive annual allotted vacation days, which increase based on tenure. Other benefits include: Paid sick days, maternity/parental enhancement program, corporate bonuses, and an RRSP contribution matching program.

For Vancouver-based employees, we provide a subsidized meal program, courtesy of our talented in-house culinary team!

British Columbia - Base Salary Range:

$160,000—$200,000 CAD

What you can expect:

At Global Relay, there’s no ceiling to what you can achieve. It’s the land of opportunity for the energetic, the intelligent, the driven. You’ll receive the mentoring, coaching, and support you need to reach your career goals. You’ll be part of a culture that breeds creativity and rewards perseverance and hard work. And you’ll be working alongside smart, talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with complementary knowledge and skills.

Global Relay is an equal-opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.

We seek to ensure reasonable adjustments, accommodations, and personal time are tailored to meet the unique needs of every individual.

We understand flexible work arrangements are important, and we encourage that in our work culture. Whether it’s flexibility around work hours, workstyle, or lifestyle, we want to ensure our employees have a healthy work/life balance. We support and value a hybrid work model that blends collaboration with the team in the office and focus time from the comfort of your home.

To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About Us

Axiom Builders is a leading construction partner for many major developers in both residential and commercial construction, with over 5 million square feet under construction in Vancouver, Victoria, Calgary , Seattle and Nashville . Our skilled team of over 500 diverse construction professionals are dedicated to meeting client expectations, with the goal of becoming an extension of their project team. Together, we execute thoughtful community-centric projects, always with safety top of mind and backed by our COR safety certification.

From iconic residential towers, noteworthy rental developments, LEED Gold office buildings, and purpose-built tenant improvements, our portfolio and expertise continue to grow. Two of our projects – Fifteen Fifteen in Vancouver and REN in Seattle – received a 2023 Award of Excellence from the Council on Tall Buildings and Urban Habitat (CTBUH). We’re also proud to have representation on the UDI U40 Executive Committee, and to have made Kincentric’s Best Employers list a few times over the past few years.

Our expertise , determination and straightforward approach are derived from our values – Accountability, Autonomy, Excellence, Humility, and Respect. The result: a quality product that’s built right – the first time.

Learn more about life at Axiom and our projects .

About The Role

Axiom Builders is seeking a Data Engineer to support the development, implementation, and maintenance of our data infrastructure at our head office in Vancouver. Working with cross-functional stakeholders to understand and address data requirements, the Data Engineer will take ownership of the end-to-end data engineering components, develop data pipelines to collect, store and transform data effectively and accurately, while maintaining data engineering and architecture best practices.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and optimize data pipelines and workflows using Microsoft Fabric;
Implement medallion data architecture that supports batch data processing;
Integrate various data sources into a unified data model, leveraging Microsoft Fabric for storage and analytics;
Create and maintain ETL/ELT processes to load, transform, and cleanse data efficiently;
Build and maintain optimized, scalable data models for Power BI and other analytics tools and maintain comprehensive documentation for data pipelines, models, and workflows;
Collaborate with business stakeholders to translate business requirements into effective data solutions;
Enable advanced analytics and reporting by developing reusable data sets and semantic layers;
Optimize storage, compute, and data access strategies to balance performance and cost, focusing on Microsoft Fabric capabilities.
Provide support and guidance to team members or cross-functional teams using Microsoft tools.


What You Bring

The ideal candidate is a first-rate problem-solver that thrives in a fast-paced environment where autonomy is encouraged. You are detail-oriented, analytical, and you possess exceptional customer service and communication skills. Most importantly, you take great pride and ownership in your work, and you want to be part of a team that embraces new technology and innovation.

Skills And Experience


Diploma or degree in Data Science, Data Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field;
3+ years of professional experience in Data Engineering;
Strong expertise in Microsoft data technology stack including Azure Data Factory, ADLS Gen 2, Azure SQL, Azure Key Vault and Power BI;
Strong expertise implementing medallion architectures (experience with Microsoft Fabric is an asset);
Strong expertise in programming PySpark and SQL;
Experience in Microsoft Power BI, Power Query and other Power Platform tools;
Analytical mindset with the ability to problem-solve and troubleshoot to resolve complex data-related issues;
Clear and effective communication skills to interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders;
Experience in Construction industry or similar industries is considered an asset;
Excited to support the growth of data within an organization.


Your Rewards

We’re committed to the success and development of our people and recognize that they are the drivers behind our success. We provide our teams with the tools and support they need to strive, thrive, and advance their long-term career here.

The base salary range for this role is posted below , depending on experience, plus a competitive bonus program. During the interview process, let’s t alk to get the right fit for your experience level.

In Addition, Our Total Rewards Package Offers

Rewards


Benefits & Perks | 100% health/dental coverage,* up to 5% match on retirement savings, virtual healthcare, and great perks
Mental Health Support  | Unlimited counselling and support for you and your family
Compensation | Competitive pay with annual market analysis


Opportunities


Unique Projects | 40+ projects in motion, from skyline-changers to bespoke sales centres
Career Growth | Twice per year we level-up with our Performance Feedback Program
Learning & Development | 15 offerings from our dedicated L&D team


Community


The People | Annual events to bring us together and connect across markets and teams
Giving Back | 2000 + volunteer hours since launch of our Community Engagement program
Leadership | 12 passionate execs focused on developing our teams and emerging leaders


What’s Next: How to Apply

About

Want to love what you do? We’re always looking for talented people who fit our culture and are passionate about what they do. Here are t wo easy ways to apply:


Click ‘A pply Now ’
Email careers@axiombuilders.ca


Thank you for your interest in Axiom Builders! While we can only respond to shortlisted applicants, we will keep your information on file for future opportunities.

Follow us on LinkedIn to connect with our Talent Acquisition team and Instagram to see updates on our current projects.


For Canadian employees. Our US benefits package is equally competitive.


Apply Now

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Job description

Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.




A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:




In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide

Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.




Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!




TELUS Digital AI Community




Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.




Qualification path

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.







Basic Requirements




Full Professional Proficiency in English & French language

Being a resident in Canada for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Canada

Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information

Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance

Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment




In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

to diversity.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Insight Global is looking to hire a Data Engineer for a retail client based in Vancouver. This role is a hybrid position and requires 3 days onsite/week in Downtown Vancouver. You will be joining a team that works heavily with customer data - owning the customer data pipelines that gather data coming from multiple sources and consolidating that data for different use cases. The team has completed the implementation of an analytics tool to gather customer data from the web, and they are now tasked with moving the data from the analytics platform to their internal Snowflake platform. The ideal candidate will possess experience migrating data from a Google stack of GCP/BigQuery to an Azure/Snowflake environment. The successful candidate will be contributing to all areas of development, and operations and participate in day-to-day production releases and on-call support functions as needed. Additional projects include:

Creation and maintenance od data pipelines (GCP, Azure Cloud, Azure Databricks, Snowflake)
Creation of secure data views and publish them to the Enterprise Data Exchange via Snowflake
Modernization and migration of data pipelines using Databricks Delta Tables (DLT) and Unity Catalog
Analysis of Adobe Analytics GA4 analytics data




Qualifications:

3-5 years of experience with database engineering – building out and deploying data pipelines, ideally working with customer data
Experience with Google Analytics (version 4) or Adobe Analytics or any other analytics platform
3+ years of experience working with Azure applications (Azure Data Factory, Azure Batch, Azure SQL Server, Azure Data Warehouse, Azure Databricks, etc.) and building out Azure pipelines
2+ years of experience working with Azure Databricks
Experience with GCP and BigQuery
Strong scripting experience with Python & SQL
Experience working in an Agile environment
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal




Plusses:

Retail and/or e-commerce experience; experience working for a multi-channel retailer
Experience with Snowflake or any enterprise data warehouse

Title: Business Systems Analyst - Marketing Technology (Remote - Canada)
Description:
Summary

Have a passion for automation? Love working on Marketing platforms and processes? Enjoy using your creative ideas and technical knowledge to help catalyze business success? As a remote Marketing Technology Business System Analyst at Yelp, you'll have the opportunity to think creatively about how to make internal tools better, to research and evaluate new innovative solutions, to scale to support Yelp’s fast growth, and to contribute to the success of our marketing teams.

Business Systems Analysts are the drivers for all innovative and transformational projects that impact our marketers’ ability to deliver the right message, to the right customer, at the right time. On an average day, BSAs might be immersed in creating project planning artifacts, contributing to technical solution designs, collaborating with marketing leadership on their strategic goals, documenting user stories, and spec-ing out new ideas, while always improving the Yelper experience.

Our team leads and manages projects from conception through execution, forming the bridge between our business teams, product teams, and technical teams. We get excited about focusing on the business side of technical problems and finding creative solutions. Join a supportive team where you will continue to develop your skills while ensuring that Yelp has an effective and scalable platform for our business-critical departments!

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular area in Canada. We welcome applicants from throughout Canada. We’d love to have you apply, even if you don’t feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

What You'll Do


Manage, design, and improve marketing tools and processes: Oversee the development and enhancement of marketing tools and processes to drive efficiency and effectiveness.
Lead projects from conception to execution: Guide projects through all phases, including planning and scoping, research and analysis, functional design, testing, and rollout.
Planning and scoping: Collaborate with business partners to identify and refine project proposals. Develop project scope, timelines, estimates, and detailed work plans.
Analysis and design: Utilize strong analytical, problem-solving, and technical skills to understand business needs, redefine processes, and recommend best practices. Partner with technical teams to design quality, scalable solutions.
Testing and rollout: Ensure successful implementation of new processes and features. Lead change management initiatives and facilitate effective training efforts.
Vendor evaluation: Conduct research on tools, organize vendor demonstrations, and create comprehensive evaluation reports.


What It Takes To Succeed


Ideally 3+ years of business systems analyst experience.
Ideally 3+ years of hands-on, operational experience with Marketing Automation platforms like Braze, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Pardot, HubSpot or Iterable.
Clear understanding of the platform's technical capabilities and limitations.
Experience in creating presentations, workflows, roadmaps for effective project planning and requirements communications.
Skilled in driving adoption, facilitating change, and improving business results.
Strong skills in building consensus and effectively coordinating and managing projects across multiple business units and technical teams.
Exposure to and understanding of the salesforce.com platform


What You'll Get


Compensation range is $85,000-166,000 annually. Depending on your role and level, you may also be offered a bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits.
This opportunity has the option to be fully remote in all locations across Canada.
You can find more information about Yelp's five star benefits here!


Closing

At Yelp, we believe that diversity is an expression of all the unique characteristics that make us human: race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, and education — and those are just a few. We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. The foundation of our diversity efforts are closely tied to our core values, which include “Playing Well With Others” and “Authenticity.”

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other protected status.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-recruiting@yelp.com or 1-415-969-8488.

Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Recruiting and Applicant Privacy Notice

Title: Senior Risk Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Requirements

Description & Requirements

who we are

lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well. We owe our success to our innovative product, emphasis on stores, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. In particular, that includes creating an equitable, inclusive and growth-focused environment for our people.

About This Team

We believe in a culture-based and team approach to security and safety. Asset protection accomplishes this through collaboration and partnership to establish a culture of safety, honesty, and integrity. We align ourselves and our partners with the practice of gratitude and appreciation. We're responsible for all aspects of asset protection implementation in the regions, partners, and business units we support, which involves managing, coaching, developing relationships, and delivering ongoing training.

a day in the life

As a dedicated Senior Analyst specializing in Risk Intelligence, you will design and drive the Business Resilience risk sensing program to monitor, identify, and advise on emerging geopolitical events and risks that could disrupt lululemon’s business operations and achievement of strategic goals. In this role, you will manage the dissemination of critical intelligence to key stakeholders, including senior leaders and the broader Business Resilience team, to enhance awareness, enable informed decision-making, and support enterprise response activities.


Develop and implement a formal risk intelligence program by leveraging past experience and best practices.
Continuously monitor global events and emerging risks, analyzing their impact on lululemon’s strategy and operations.
Curate weekly risk intelligence digests for senior leaders to keep them informed of critical developments and triggers that may affect their business or long-term strategy.
Conduct in-depth research and analysis on specific events or business disruption risks, providing stakeholders with detailed assessments, impact forecasts, and situation updates.
Support the triaging of urgent critical events, escalating them as necessary to activate the enterprise crisis response framework.
Deliver security and safety risk assessments for travel to high-risk countries to support the Travel Security team’s monitoring and assessment efforts.


Qualifications


Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., political science, international relations, or similar).
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present to senior leaders.
Excellent research and analytical skills.
5+ years of progressive experience in a comparable position within a multinational corporation.


must haves


Acknowledge the presence of choice in every moment and take personal responsibility for your life.
Possess an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovate to achieve great results.
Communicate with honesty and kindness and create the space for others to do the same.
Lead with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure.
Foster connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships.
Integrate fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn’t take yourself too seriously.


Additional Notes

Authorization to work in Canada is required for this role.

Compensation And Benefits Package

lululemon’s compensation offerings are grounded in a pay-for-performance philosophy that recognizes exceptional individual and team performance. The typical hiring range for this position is from  $ 81,500-$107,000 CAD  annually; the base pay offered is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity. As part of our total rewards offering, permanent employees in this position may be eligible for our competitive annual bonus program, subject to program eligibility requirements.  

At Lululemon, Investing In Our People Is a Top Priority. We Believe That When Life Works, Work Works. We Strive To Be The Place Where Inclusive Leaders Come To Develop And Enable All To Be Well. Recognizing Our Teams For Their Performance And Dedication, Other Components Of Our Total Rewards Offerings Include Support Of Career Development, Wellbeing, And Personal Growth


Extended health and dental benefits, and mental health plans
Paid time off
Savings and retirement plan matching
Generous employee discount
Fitness & yoga classes
Parenthood top-up
Extensive catalog of development course offerings
People networks, mentorship programs, and leadership series (to name a few)


Note: The incentive programs, benefits, and perks have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these incentive programs, benefits, and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice.

workplace arrangement

This role is classified as Hybrid under our SSC Workplace Policy: In-person collaboration is important, and much of the role can be performed remotely. Work is performed onsite at least 3 days per week.

  • Extended health and dental benefits, and mental health plans
  • Paid time off
  • Savings and retirement plan matching
  • Generous employee discount

This role is classified as Hybrid under our SSC Workplace Policy: In-person collaboration is important, and much of the role can be performed remotely. Work is performed onsite at least 3 days per week.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Clio is more than just a tech company–we are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice.

Summary:

What your team does:

Our data engineering team is driven to deliver an incredible experience to our customers. As a Data Engineer at Clio, you will build data pipelines and data warehouses from scratch, as well as make data sets accessible to our partner teams by writing great production code. We move quickly, work with new state of the art technologies, and are motivated by solving complex problems.

This role is available across Canada, excluding Quebec.

A day in the life might look like:


Implement data ingestion (real time and batch) using best practices in data modeling, ETL/ELT processes by leveraging AWS technologies and data tools
Design, build, and maintain data transformation pipelines consolidating various data sources (streaming or batch) into specific Data Lakes / Data Warehouses
Collaborate with engineers to help adopt best practices in data system creation, data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation
Develop prototype or "proof of concept" implementations of projects where the technical solution is unknown or unproven


What you may have:


Experience in software development as well as experience in data engineering
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS preferred, bonus for Terraform)
Proficiency in at least one major language (e.g. Python, Scala, Ruby) and SQL, the drive to write elegant and maintainable code, and desire to pick up new technologies
Experience with streaming and batch data tools: Spark, Kafka, Airflow
Data warehousing experience working with Databricks or similar
Experience building data pipelines and the infrastructure required to deploy data models and dashboards that allow data visualization
Exceptional collaboration and communication skills with the ability to derive clarity in ambiguous environments
You are a self-starter and can drive projects with minimum supervision


What you will find here:

Compensation is one of the main components of Clio’s Total Rewards Program. We have developed a series of programs and processes to ensure we are creating fair and competitive pay practices that form the foundation of our human and high-performing culture.

Some highlights of our Total Rewards program include:


Competitive, equitable salary with top-tier health benefits, dental, and vision insurance
Hybrid work environment, with expectation for local Clions (Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto, and Dublin) to be in office minimum 2 days per week on our Anchor Days.
Flexible time off policy, with an encouraged 20 days off per year.
$2000 annual counseling benefit
RRSP matching and RESP contribution
Clioversary recognition program with special acknowledgement at 3, 5, 7, and 10 years


The full salary range* for this role is $116,500 to $137,000 to $157,500 CAD.Please note there are a separate set of salary bands for other regions based on local currency.


We aim to hire all candidates between the minimum and the midpoint of the full salary range. We reserve the midpoint to the maximum of the salary band for internal employees who demonstrate sustained high performance and impact at Clio. The final offer amount for this role will be dependent on individual experience and skillset of the candidate. Please note there are a separate set of salary bands for other regions based on local currency.


Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility

Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion. We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers
Show more

Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility

Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion. We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers

Title: Analyst, Business Systems
Description:
The Opportunity:Posting ID: 27782 Position Type: Regular City: Vancouver, BC, Canada Location: Vancouver H/O - Canfor/CWPM_1000

As Business Systems Analyst you will provide direct support to the sustainment and continuous improvement initiatives of Canfor’s North American Employee Central payroll system. You will collaborate with application managed services, IT, and product vendor support in the sustainment and improvement of business systems, leveraging, technology, analytics, and process design. In your role as Business Analyst you'll your entrepreneurial spirit and highly analytical mind will come to the forefront as you collaborate, evaluate and communicate with teams and stakeholders as you influence change and deliver leading practice initiatives.

As Business Systems Analyst you will:


Support sustainment and improvement efforts of Canfor’s Human Resource Information Systems;
Develop and maintain SAP ABAP programs and employee central payroll.
Design, code, test and implement SAP modules and applications.
Work closely with functional teams to understand their requirements.
Translate functional requirements into technical specifications.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues during development and implementation.
Stay up-to-date with the latest SAP technologies and best practices.
Managing support tickets and enhancement request through the change control and release management processes.
Execute, document, and complete all required unit and system testing.
Support to various business teams in the development and roll-out of related processes, policies and ongoing training to ensure continuous improvement
Develop and execute comprehensive test plans for system upgrades or implementations
Key support role in execution of initiatives and projects across the business to ensure completion per timelines and stated objectives.
Cross-functional collaboration and communication to gather business requirements, conduct root cause analysis, and propose recommendations
Prepare project deliverables including, but not limited to, current state analysis, future state recommendations, process documentation, preparation of workshop materials, business enablement (change) plan & supporting materials, etc.
Liaise with business, vendor, and IT resources to ensure initiatives and project activities are completed per timelines and stated objectives
Coordinate project activities including but not limited to project management support, communication, organize workshops and meetings
Key support role in facilitation, evaluation of business processes and problem-solving to develop cohesive recommendations and insights for various initiatives across the organization
Facilitation services extended to various groups across the organization; including collaboration with managers, defining requirements and needs
Liaison between business, vendor, and IT in multiple areas


Education & Experience


University degree in business, technology, or process related area with a leaning towards deployment of digital transformation, innovative technologies, and continuous improvement
Minimum 5 Years’ Experience with SAP ABAP development
Strong knowledge of SAP modules and applications
Familiarity with SAP enhancement techniques such as user exists and BAdIs
Experience supporting interfaces to and from systems
Experience with SuccessFactors Employee Central Payroll, UKG Dimensions, Or Dell Boomi is an asset
Experience with testing processes and software
Background in management or digital transformation consulting is an asset
Strong business acumen


Skills And Abilities


Exceptional troubleshooting and problem-solving skills. A passion for solving technical and process issues.
Passion for seeking out innovative trends and opportunities; thinking about ways to improve business capabilities
Ability to collaborate effectively working with key IT and business stakeholders across the company
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Effective engagement with external stakeholders and consultants
Ability to engage and work effectively across layers of the organization to support and deliver on prioritized initiatives
Ability to clearly articulate messages to a variety of audiences
Strong time management and organizational skills


The salary range for this position is: $88,500.00-$110,500.00

Please Note: The range provided is for base salary only. In addition to base salary, Canfor proudly offers its employees a comprehensive and competitive total rewards package. It features programs such as performance-based incentive plans, recognition programs, benefits, paid leaves, pension plans with base and matching contributions, savings options and robust health & well-being initiatives. We also continually invest in the development of our talent to help them thrive professionally and personally. Above all, we are proud to offer our employees a value proposition that promotes diversity, equity and inclusion and fosters an environment where talent and performance is recognized and rewarded.

Don't check off every single bullet point? At Canfor, we prioritize the right fit for our organization over a strict checklist of criteria. We encourage applications from individuals whose backgrounds may not perfectly align.

Our people-focused approach prioritizes safety, embraces diversity, valuing everyone’s unique qualities. We believe that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our productivity, creativity, innovation, and competitive edge. Our recruitment process is fair and equitable, based on qualifications and experience.

We appreciate all candidates' interest but will contact only those selected for interviews. Our hiring for various positions is ongoing and includes different screening processes such as behavioral assessments, references, and criminal record checks, depending on the role and location.

Title: Senior Business Data Analyst
Description:
At Lumenalta, we create impactful software solutions that drive innovation and transform businesses. Since 2000, we’ve partnered with visionary leaders to build cutting-edge tech, solve complex challenges, and deliver results faster through our elite teams and tech-driven approach. Join us in shaping the future of technology.




What we're working on:

Enterprise companies turn to us to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. The problems we solve daily are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. To grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally, you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.




Responsibilities

Acts as a bridge between the business team and technical teams, focusing on aligning data insights with business goals.
Understands business processes and requirements.
Collaborates with stakeholders to define problems and business questions.
Translates business needs into technical specifications for data analysis.
Provides actionable recommendations based on data insights.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, opportunities, and actionable insights.
Ensure data quality and accuracy through thorough validation and testing.




Requirements

7+ years experience as a data analyst.
Expertise in Power BI and Tableau (experience with both is ideal; proficiency in at least one is required).
Strong understanding of data visualization best practices.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and managing datasets.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, in English.
Industry experience in Financial Services is a plus.
Personality traits: detail-oriented, proactive, problem solver, collaborative, passionate about data.




Why Lumenalta is an amazing place to work at

At Lumenalta, you can expect that you will:

Be 100% dedicated to one project at a time so that you can innovate and grow.
Be a part of a team of talented and friendly senior-level developers.
Work on projects that allow you to use leading tech.




The result? We produce meaningful outcomes for our clients that break barriers in their industries.




The job is 100% Remote; please ensure you have a comfortable office set at your desired work location.




Lumenalta is committed to hiring exceptional talent from a wide variety of diverse backgrounds. If you share our values and enthusiasm for digital transformation, we encourage you to apply

Title: Evaluation Analyst
Description:
Staff - Non Union

Job Category

M&P - AAPS

Job Profile

AAPS Salaried - Institutional Analysis, Level A

Job Title

Evaluation Analyst

Department

Evaluation Support | Evaluation Studies | Faculty of Medicine

Compensation Range

$5,791.00 - $8,323.42 CAD Monthly

The Compensation Range is the span between the minimum and maximum base salary for a position. The midpoint of the range is approximately halfway between the minimum and the maximum and represents an employee that possesses full job knowledge, qualifications and experience for the position. In the normal course, employees will be hired, transferred or promoted between the minimum and midpoint of the salary range for a job.

Posting End Date

March 6, 2025

Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the Posting End Date.

Job End Date

At UBC, we believe that attracting and sustaining a diverse workforce is key to the successful pursuit of excellence in research, innovation, and learning for all faculty, staff and students. Our commitment to employment equity helps achieve inclusion and fairness, brings rich diversity to UBC as a workplace, and creates the necessary conditions for a rewarding career.

Job Summary

The Evaluation Analyst will work closely with the Evaluation Specialists and Associates and the Data Intelligence and Reporting Analyst to support large scale evaluations of programs and initiatives within the Education Portfolio of the Faculty of Medicine. They will provide the necessary data and reports to support decision-makers. They will conduct ad-hoc evaluation and research as needed. They will develop data collection instruments, conduct data collection and analyses of quantitative and qualitative data. The position will also design and implement automated reporting of data analysis using R coding and prepare succinct, informative reports for decision-makers.

Organizational Status

The Evaluation Studies Unit (ESU) was established in 2004 to provide program evaluation and strategic reporting services to support planning and decision-making within the UBC Faculty of Medicine (FoM). ESU provides comprehensive, rigorous and objective data to assist stakeholders in the on-going development and improvement of programs. The Unit is organizationally placed within the Education Portfolio of the FoM, and is mandated to evaluate the effectiveness, quality, comparability, and impact of educational programs, provide supporting data for accreditation, and meet organizational and government reporting needs.

The Evaluation Analyst will report to the Evaluation Manager. They will collaborate with the Data Intelligence and Reporting Analyst, Evaluation Specialists, and Evaluation Associates on key tasks and deliverables that support their projects. They will also interact with faculty and staff from the FoM and attend and participate in committees, working groups and planning meetings as assigned.

Work Performed


Work with complex datasets to analyze, summarize and report key findings
Conduct qualitative (e.g. thematic) and quantitative (e.g. descriptive, inferential) data analyses, using NVIVO, SPSS, and R.
Develop data visualizations using knowledge of graphic design principles and provide expert advice to staff in the appropriate selection and application of techniques using PowerBI and/or Tableau
Interpret results and create data visualisations for evaluation reports and summaries for use by leadership and decision-makers
Design and generate optimal solutions for automated reporting of data using R.
Research, identify, and analyze appropriate data sources, determining data limitations that apply
Design survey instruments and process, screen, check, code and analyse the resultant data
Develop, deploy and monitor response rates to data collection instruments
Research, develop and make recommendations for new and improved processes and procedures for data collection and analysis
Prepare presentations and key findings briefings for decision-makers
Plan and coordinate tasks to ensure efficient administration, organization and integration of data collection and analyses across the unit
Respond to student, staff and faculty inquiries related to assigned work
Contribute to the development and improvement of unit processes to increase their efficiency and effectiveness
Work with team members to address workload and resourcing issues to manage timelines and expectations
Perform other duties as required to ensure the successful completion of assigned work


Consequence of Error/Judgment

This position should be able to work independently for the most part, having been assigned tasks by the Evaluation Manager that have been agreed with the Evaluation Specialists and Associates and the Data Intelligence and Reporting Analyst. They are accountable for the accuracy and timely delivery of their work. This individual would be expected to obtain the necessary data and create the analyses without supervision. Data and analyses produced by them will be reviewed by the senior team members they are supporting. Mistakes discovered at this stage could result in lost time, and perhaps the wholesale revision of the analysis. Errors can have significant negative impacts on the achievement of the strategic goals and commitments of the Education Portfolio within the Faculty of Medicine.

Supervision Received

The Evaluation Analyst reports to the Evaluation Manager. They collaborate with the evaluation lead for assigned projects to agree deliverables, timelines and provide regular status updates to team members.

Supervision Given

No supervision given.

Minimum Qualifications

Undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline. Minimum of two years of related experience, or the equivalent combination of education and experience.


Willingness to respect diverse perspectives, including perspectives in conflict with one’s own
Demonstrates a commitment to enhancing one’s own awareness, knowledge, and skills related to equity, diversity, and inclusion


Preferred Qualifications


Education in data science, statistical analysis, analytics, evaluation, education, health or social sciences or graduation from a technical college or institute
Demonstrated experience in data gathering and the analysis and interpretation of qualitative and quantitative data is essential
Computer experience and a high degree of competency with Microsoft Office (especially Excel) and data analysis software (e.g. SPSS, NVivo, R) is also required
High degree of competency in R programming and experience of practical application of R in a professional environment preferred
Professional experience in program evaluation is an asset but not a requirement
Ability to be thorough, accurate, and have a high level of attention to detail
Highly skilled in distilling large amounts of information quickly and accurately into a succinct report for stakeholders
Excellent, proven interpersonal and intercultural, oral and written communication skills and organizational planning abilities
Ability to effectively project manage the collection and analysis of multiple and simultaneous data streams
Experience working with multiple stakeholders in a complex environment
Ability to compose correspondence, reports, presentations, and other written materials using clear concise business English
Ability to prioritize and work effectively under pressure to meet deadlines
Ability to exercise sound judgment and make recommendations to resolve issues
Ability to identify and resolve problems and issues
Ability to develop and maintain cooperative and productive working relationships
Ability to work independently and demonstrate initiative
Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment
Demonstrated ability to build, manage and maintain high-quality and productive relationships across cultural differences
Demonstrated ability to actively create and sustain respectful and inclusive environments.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively and interact with empathy, understanding, and humility with people from diverse backgrounds and with diverse identities, perspectives, and behaviors.
Commitment to upholding the Faculty of Medicine’s values of respect, integrity, compassion, collaboration, and equity.
Show more

Title: Project Analyst
Description:
Join us in our mission to commercialize fusion energy ⚡️

We’re all about solving climate change through fusion energy, one stellarator at a time. Our impressive team of globally recognized fusion scientists along with veteran business leaders with experienced in scaling energy technologies, came together with the ambition to fulfill the bold decadal vision of commercial fusion.

If changing the world wasn’t incentive enough, here’s why you should join us:

We designed, built, and operated the world’s leading stellarators.

We aim to commercialize fusion energy in 10 years.

We know what we’re doing - our leadership team has over 150 years of experience combined.

We’ve already been recognised for our work by the Department of Energy through awards and funding.

Our philosophy accepts no intellectual boundaries and celebrates creativity.

Company: Type One Energy Group - Canada, Inc.

Job Title: Project Analyst

NOC: 11201 – Professional occupations in business management consulting

Offered Wage: $43.00 – 45.00/hour (based on a 40-hour workweek) - permanent/full-time

Work Location: 1140 West Pender St., Vancouver, BC V6E 4G1 Canada

Number of Positions: One (1)

Required Language Skills: English (spoken & written)

About Us

Type One Energy Group is mission-driven to provide sustainable, affordable fusion power to the world. Established in 2019 and venture-backed in 2023, the company is led by a team of globally recognized fusion scientists with a strong track record of building state-of-the-art stellarator fusion machines, together with veteran business leaders experienced in scaling companies and commercializing energy technologies. Type One Energy applies proven advanced manufacturing methods, modern computational physics and high-field superconducting magnets to develop its optimized stellarator fusion energy system.

Our FusionDirect development program pursues the lowest-risk, shortest-schedule path to a fusion power plant over the coming decade, using a partner-intensive and capital-efficient strategy. We are committed to diversity, inclusion, and equitable access to clean energy. For more information, visit www.typeoneenergy.com or follow us on LinkedIn.

Job Summary

The Project Analyst will play a pivotal role in supporting Type One Energy's mission to revolutionize energy production by managing complex projects within the fusion energy sector. The successful candidate will oversee project schedules, budgets, and risk management, leveraging data-driven insights to optimize project performance. This role requires advanced skills in automation, statistical analysis, and specialized project management tools, with a focus on driving operational efficiency and continuous improvement across multiple projects.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and maintain project schedules, budgets, and deliverables for complex, high-stakes projects within the fusion energy sector.
Create and manage risk registers, conduct FMEA risk assessments, and implement risk mitigation strategies using tools like LogicGate and RiskyProject.
Utilize advanced statistical methods and programming languages (e.g., Python, MATLAB, SQL) to analyze project data and optimize key performance metrics. Design custom dashboards in PowerBI for real-time project monitoring.
Automate project processes using tools such as Power Automate, PowerApps, and custom scripts (e.g., JavaScript/Apps Script/Power Fx). Develop automated systems for documentation, purchasing, and other operational workflows.
Configure and manage project management tools (e.g., Primavera P6, JIRA, Smartsheet) to meet project requirements and enhance team collaboration. Integrate these tools with platforms like Confluence and SharePoint.
Oversee the timecard system tailored to the organization’s needs. Ensure accurate and timely entry of employee work hours, monitor data quality, trouble soot discrepancies, and resolve issue promptly.
Develop and customize reports to meet specific departmental needs or management requests, such as cost tracking, schedule health check
Lead initiatives to improve project management processes, gather team feedback, and implement enhancements based on data analysis.


Required Skills

The successful candidate must have:


A minimum of 2 years of experience in the fusion energy sector or a related high-technology industry, with expertise in managing complex technical projects and understanding project management practices specific to engineering or energy-related fields.
At least 2 years of experience in advanced Excel, with expertise in data management and analysis, complex formulas and calculations, pivot tables and charts, data automation and Validation.
At least 2 years of experience using advanced project management software, including Primavera P6, JIRA, LogicGate, and Smartsheet, with demonstrated capability in configuring these tools to meet project requirements.
At least 2 years of experience in automating workflows using tools such as Power Automate, PowerApps, or custom scripts (e.g., JavaScript/Apps Script).
At least 2 years of experience in data analysis using programming languages like Python, MATLAB, or SQL, with proficiency in creating data visualization dashboards using PowerBI.
At least 2 years of experience in risk management, including performing FMEA risk assessments, developing risk mitigation strategies, and managing risk registers for high-stakes projects.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to lead process improvement initiatives and train team members on specialized tools and techniques.


Required Education


Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Project Management, Data Science, or a related field.


Benefits


Bonus (if applicable):
Disability Insurance
Dental Insurance
RRSP with up to 4% company match
Extended Medical Insurance (e.g. prescription drugs, paramedical services, medical services and equipment)
Vacation Days – 12 Holidays & 15 Days PTO

Company Shares

Please send your resume to the following email address: careers@typeoneenergy.com. We ask that the candidates put "Project Analyst" in the email subject line when they apply so that it's easily identifiable. We thank you for applying, however, only those selected to continue will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Statement

Type One Energy is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, searching for the best new ideas and remaining open to unique perspectives. Therefore, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment independent of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age, or any other characteristics protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.
