HTML:
Join us in our mission to commercialize fusion energy ⚡️

We’re all about solving climate change through fusion energy, one stellarator at a time. Our impressive team of globally recognized fusion scientists along with veteran business leaders with experienced in scaling energy technologies, came together with the ambition to fulfill the bold decadal vision of commercial fusion.

If changing the world wasn’t incentive enough, here’s why you should join us:

We designed, built, and operated the world’s leading stellarators.

We aim to commercialize fusion energy in 10 years.

We know what we’re doing - our leadership team has over 150 years of experience combined.

We’ve already been recognised for our work by the Department of Energy through awards and funding.

Our philosophy accepts no intellectual boundaries and celebrates creativity.

Company: Type One Energy Group - Canada, Inc.

Job Title: Project Analyst

NOC: 11201 – Professional occupations in business management consulting

Offered Wage: $43.00 – 45.00/hour (based on a 40-hour workweek) - permanent/full-time

Work Location: 1140 West Pender St., Vancouver, BC V6E 4G1 Canada

Number of Positions: One (1)

Required Language Skills: English (spoken & written)

About Us

Type One Energy Group is mission-driven to provide sustainable, affordable fusion power to the world. Established in 2019 and venture-backed in 2023, the company is led by a team of globally recognized fusion scientists with a strong track record of building state-of-the-art stellarator fusion machines, together with veteran business leaders experienced in scaling companies and commercializing energy technologies. Type One Energy applies proven advanced manufacturing methods, modern computational physics and high-field superconducting magnets to develop its optimized stellarator fusion energy system.

Our FusionDirect development program pursues the lowest-risk, shortest-schedule path to a fusion power plant over the coming decade, using a partner-intensive and capital-efficient strategy. We are committed to diversity, inclusion, and equitable access to clean energy. For more information, visit www.typeoneenergy.com or follow us on LinkedIn.

Job Summary

The Project Analyst will play a pivotal role in supporting Type One Energy's mission to revolutionize energy production by managing complex projects within the fusion energy sector. The successful candidate will oversee project schedules, budgets, and risk management, leveraging data-driven insights to optimize project performance. This role requires advanced skills in automation, statistical analysis, and specialized project management tools, with a focus on driving operational efficiency and continuous improvement across multiple projects.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain project schedules, budgets, and deliverables for complex, high-stakes projects within the fusion energy sector.
  • Create and manage risk registers, conduct FMEA risk assessments, and implement risk mitigation strategies using tools like LogicGate and RiskyProject.
  • Utilize advanced statistical methods and programming languages (e.g., Python, MATLAB, SQL) to analyze project data and optimize key performance metrics. Design custom dashboards in PowerBI for real-time project monitoring.
  • Automate project processes using tools such as Power Automate, PowerApps, and custom scripts (e.g., JavaScript/Apps Script/Power Fx). Develop automated systems for documentation, purchasing, and other operational workflows.
  • Configure and manage project management tools (e.g., Primavera P6, JIRA, Smartsheet) to meet project requirements and enhance team collaboration. Integrate these tools with platforms like Confluence and SharePoint.
  • Oversee the timecard system tailored to the organization’s needs. Ensure accurate and timely entry of employee work hours, monitor data quality, trouble soot discrepancies, and resolve issue promptly.
  • Develop and customize reports to meet specific departmental needs or management requests, such as cost tracking, schedule health check
  • Lead initiatives to improve project management processes, gather team feedback, and implement enhancements based on data analysis.

Required Skills

The successful candidate must have:

  • A minimum of 2 years of experience in the fusion energy sector or a related high-technology industry, with expertise in managing complex technical projects and understanding project management practices specific to engineering or energy-related fields.
  • At least 2 years of experience in advanced Excel, with expertise in data management and analysis, complex formulas and calculations, pivot tables and charts, data automation and Validation.
  • At least 2 years of experience using advanced project management software, including Primavera P6, JIRA, LogicGate, and Smartsheet, with demonstrated capability in configuring these tools to meet project requirements.
  • At least 2 years of experience in automating workflows using tools such as Power Automate, PowerApps, or custom scripts (e.g., JavaScript/Apps Script).
  • At least 2 years of experience in data analysis using programming languages like Python, MATLAB, or SQL, with proficiency in creating data visualization dashboards using PowerBI.
  • At least 2 years of experience in risk management, including performing FMEA risk assessments, developing risk mitigation strategies, and managing risk registers for high-stakes projects.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to lead process improvement initiatives and train team members on specialized tools and techniques.

Required Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Project Management, Data Science, or a related field.

Benefits

  • Bonus (if applicable):
  • Disability Insurance
  • Dental Insurance
  • RRSP with up to 4% company match
  • Extended Medical Insurance (e.g. prescription drugs, paramedical services, medical services and equipment)
  • Vacation Days – 12 Holidays & 15 Days PTO
  • Any additional benefits offered:
    • Company Shares
How To Apply

Please send your resume to the following email address: careers@typeoneenergy.com. We ask that the candidates put "Project Analyst" in the email subject line when they apply so that it's easily identifiable. We thank you for applying, however, only those selected to continue will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Statement

Type One Energy is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, searching for the best new ideas and remaining open to unique perspectives. Therefore, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment independent of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age, or any other characteristics protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.

Type One Energy Group is mission-driven to provide sustainable, affordable fusion power to the world. The company was formed in 2019 by a team of globally-recognized fusion scientists with a strong track record of building state-of-art stellarator fusion machines, together with veteran business leaders experienced in scaling companies and commercializing energy technologies.

Type One Energy applies proven advanced manufacturing methods, modern computational physics and high-field superconducting magnets to develop its optimized stellarator fusion energy system. Its FusionDirect development program pursues the lowest-risk, shortest-schedule path to a fusion power plant over the coming decade, using a partner-intensive and capital-efficient strategy.

For more information, visit https://www.typeoneenergy.com/.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Quality Verification
Description:
The Sr. Data Analyst role develops business intelligence products and leads data initiatives to enhance data maturity for our Quality Verification teams. You will use your advanced technical knowledge of SQL programming, ETL pipeline development, and data visualisation tools to analyse data and identify trends, driving decision-making across our organisation.

You will report to the Senior Analytics Manager.

What You Will Do


You will define the data analytics roadmap for some of EA's largest titles.
You will use your technical skills to develop data products that improve decision-making across the Quality Verification organization.
You will define best practices in data analytics and visualization tools.
You will create data governance practices to improve our organisation's data maturity.
You will provide coaching for Data Analyst colleagues.


The Next Great Senior Data Analyst Requires


3+ years of professional analytical experience.
Advanced SQL skills and practical experience in other languages such as R, SAS, or Python.
Able to develop data modelling and warehousing solutions.
Able to plan and prioritise multiple concurrent projects.
Able to foster working relationships with partners.


COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs). BASE SALARY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria)
$89,300 - $123,000 CAD

In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

Title: Data Analyst - Senior
Description:
At Lumenalta, we create impactful software solutions that drive innovation and transform businesses. Since 2000, we’ve partnered with visionary leaders to build cutting-edge tech, solve complex challenges, and deliver results faster through our elite teams and tech-driven approach. Join us in shaping the future of technology.




What we're working on:

Enterprise companies turn to us to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. The problems we solve daily are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. To grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally, you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.




Responsibilities

Design and build visually impactful dashboards and reports using Power BI and Tableau.
Migrate and integrate legacy Tableau systems into Power BI, ensuring consistency and usability.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data solutions.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, opportunities, and actionable insights.
Ensure data quality and accuracy through thorough validation and testing.




Requirements

7+ years experience as a data analyst.
Expertise in Power BI and Tableau (experience with both is ideal; proficiency in at least one is required).
Strong understanding of data visualization best practices.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and managing datasets.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, in English.
Industry experience in Financial Services is a plus.
Personality traits: detail-oriented, proactive, problem solver, collaborative, passionate about data.




Why Lumenalta is an amazing place to work at

At Lumenalta, you can expect that you will:

Be 100% dedicated to one project at a time so that you can innovate and grow.
Be a part of a team of talented and friendly senior-level developers.
Work on projects that allow you to use leading tech.




The result? We produce meaningful outcomes for our clients that break barriers in their industries.




The job is 100% Remote; please ensure you have a comfortable office set at your desired work location.




Lumenalta is committed to hiring exceptional talent from a wide variety of diverse backgrounds. If you share our values and enthusiasm for digital transformation, we encourage you to apply

Title: Business System Analyst
Description:
We are looking for an IT Business Systems Analyst to drive technical change, enhance operational efficiency, and bridge the gap between technology, supply chain, and retail operations. In this role, you will collaborate across departments to develop, integrate, and support enterprise-wide applications, ensuring seamless functionality for both customers and internal teams.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead the identification, planning, development, and implementation of technical solutions.
Act as a liaison between retail operations, supply chain, and IT teams, ensuring technology aligns with business needs.
Improve operational efficiency by implementing and integrating enterprise-wide applications.
Analyze data, identify process improvement opportunities, and implement solutions to enhance retail operations.
Conduct business process analysis to identify areas for improvement and recommend technological investments.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track KPIs and performance metrics.
Perform systems analysis and design, delivering technical solutions that drive business success.
Evaluate and recommend IT systems, tools, and software aligned with company goals.
Plan and manage project timelines, ensuring timely delivery of IT solutions.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field.
Background in both computer science and business studies is preferred.
5+ years of professional development experience in an enterprise environment.
Strong communication skills to facilitate collaboration between IT and business teams.
Proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Excel) and visualization software (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik).
Experience with application development in languages like C# and Java is a plus.
Prior experience in large-scale retail IT environments.

Show more

Title: Analyst, Industry Program - Summer 2025 Co-op/Intern - Multiple Locations
Description:
Job Type: Co-op/InternWork Model: Hybrid

Reference code: 128359Primary Location: Toronto, ONAll Available Locations: Toronto, ON; Calgary, AB; Vancouver, BC

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.





What will your typical day look like?

This is an exciting time to be part of the Industry Program team. You’ll collaborate with peers and leaders on a series of high-impact internal projects related to Deloitte’s industry strategy. From go-to-market campaigns and strategy development (e.g., how can we bring deeper industry expertise to our clients?), to reporting and analytics (e.g., where should we focus to improve financial performance?), to communities of practice and governance (e.g., how do share best practices across teams?)—no day will be the same. You’ll be constantly learning, making an impact, and connecting with a great team.

About The Team

Our mandate is to enable growth by delivering marketplace strategies to address the biggest challenges our clients face. While the Industry Program team does not work directly with clients, we drive the programs that underpin Deloitte’s ability to serve clients with excellence and distinction. Our industry focus spans a broad scope, from financial services and energy to public sector and technology, and more. As a member of the team, you will be exposed to industry and business leadership and decisions that shape Deloitte’s strategic direction.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

In this role, the expected qualifications are:


Strong analytical skills: You can break down an ambiguous problem into component parts and plan out a strategic approach to tackle them
Effective communication: You can translate complex concepts into digestible written, verbal, or visual messages (emails, presentations, reports)
Organizational prowess: You thrive in an environment of competing deadlines and concurrent projects—while maintaining a keen attention to detail
Appetite for initiative: You are excited to put up your hand, get involved, and get things done—sometimes with limited supervision and guidance
Team player: You love to collaborate with others to solve problems, share knowledge, and succeed together
Technical skills: You get excited about a well-designed Excel or PowerPoint, and you’re comfortable using them to run an analysis or present a compelling narrative
To be eligible for this role, you must be graduating in December 2025 or later


Total Rewards

The salary range for this position is $48,500.00 - $55,000.00, and individuals may be eligible to participate in our bonus program. Deloitte is fair and competitive when it comes to the salaries of our people. We regularly benchmark across a variety of positions, industries, sectors, targets, and levels. Our approach is grounded on recognizing people's unique strengths and contributions and rewarding the value that they deliver.

Our Total Rewards Package extends well beyond traditional compensation and benefit programs and is designed to recognize employee contributions, encourage personal wellness, and support firm growth. Along with a competitive base salary and variable pay opportunities, we offer a wide array of initiatives that differentiate us as a people-first organization. Some representative examples include: $4,000 per year for mental health support benefits, a $1,300 flexible benefit spending account, 38+ days off (including 10 firm-wide closures known as "Deloitte Days"), flexible work arrangements and a hybrid work structure.

Our promise to our people: Deloitte is where potential comes to life

Be yourself, and more.

We are a group of talented people who want to learn, gain experience, and develop skills. Wherever you are in your career, we want you to advance.

You Shape How We Make Impact.

Diverse perspectives and life experiences make us better. Whoever you are and wherever you’re from, we want you to feel like you belong here. We provide flexible working options to support you and how you can contribute.

Be the leader you want to be.

Some guide teams, some change culture, some build essential expertise. We offer opportunities and experiences that support your continuing growth as a leader.

Have as many careers as you want.

We are uniquely able to offer you new challenges and roles – and prepare you for them. We bring together people with unique experiences and talents, and we are the place to develop a lasting network of friends, peers, and mentors.

The next step is yours

Apply by March 2, 2025 at 11:59 P.M.

To be considered, you must submit your cover letter, resume and unofficial transcript in ONE PDF document

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan , Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative .

We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations) or indigenouscareers@deloitte.ca for any questions relating to careers for Indigenous peoples at Deloitte (First Nations, Inuit, Métis).

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally. Deloitte Canada has 20 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge that Deloitte offices stand on traditional, treaty, and unceded

territories in what is now known as Canada. We recognize that Indigenous Peoples have been the caretakers of this land since time immemorial, nurturing its resources and preserving its natural beauty. We acknowledge this land is still home to many First Nations, Inuit, and Métis Peoples, who continue to maintain their deep connection to the land and its sacred teachings. We humbly acknowledge that we are all Treaty people, and we commit to fostering a relationship of respect, collaboration, and stewardship with Indigenous communities in our shared goal of reconciliation and environmental sustainability.

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
On behalf of our public sector client, we are looking for two Data Quality Analysts for a 10-month contract, with a possible extension. This is a hybrid position, requiring three days per week in the office in British Columbia.





We are looking for two highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Quality Analysts to join our Enterprise Data Strategy & Governance team. These roles will be critical in ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and reliability of our data assets across the organization




.
As a Data Quality Analyst, you will work closely with cross-functional teams—including data architects, data engineers, data scientists and business stakeholders—to audit, develop, implement, and enforce data quality standards, policies, and procedures. Your work will directly contribute to enhancing data integrity, compliance, and trust, enabling more effective data-driven decision-makin




g.

Title: Data Model Designer Co-op (May 2025 - Dec 2025)
Description:
Visier is the leader in people analytics and we believe in a 'people-first' approach to business strategy. Our innovative technology transforms the way that organisations make decisions, allowing them to elevate their employees and drive better business outcomes. Embarking on an exciting new chapter in our growth story, we are looking for talented individuals who can help both Visier and our customers grow, evolve and win!

Our co-op experience is unique and designed to prepare you for professional success as you work on real, impactful work from the beginning...not features that may be mothballed after 8 months of hard work! Our ultimate goal is to give you the mentorship, training, and work experience you need to start your career. A number of our students return to us after they graduate and start developing their professional career at Visier!

What You'll Be Doing...


Design and implement the Visier data models and analytic objects (metric, dimensions, etc.) that support the business questions presented in the Visier People Applications
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and ensure that the data models meet the business requirements
Translate business requirements into actionable data requirement to build abstract data models in our Scala-based Applications
Develop and maintain reporting analyses to deliver key insights that drive data-driven business decisions
Define and develop key metrics in our proprietary Scala-based Visier Formula Language (VFL)
Generate and load sample data into those data models with our proprietary ETL technology
Design and perform various quality tests to validate the data models
Troubleshooting any issues or inefficiencies that occur within the data models, metrics, or analyses


What you'll bring to the table...


Experience with data mapping, transformation, and query languages (SQL, etc.), implementing data warehouse models and/or reporting solutions
Good knowledge of database management systems and data modelling techniques
Good knowledge of ETL platforms and techniques and data integration techniques
Experience with business intelligence and reporting tools (i.e. Tableau, Power BI, etc.).
Experience working with git-based source code repositories (i.e. Bitbucket, GitHub, etc.)
Knowledge of web technologies (i.e. REST, XML, JSON)
Knowledge of Linux/Unix shell scripting (i.e. Bash, Python)
Good abstraction skills
Efficient time management skills, able to work under pressure with competing priorities and remain organized
Effective communication skills, ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, and able to resolve differences to reach an understanding
Be results-oriented with the ability to manage multiple stakeholders and deliverables
Strong problem solving and analytical skills with exceptional attention to detail


The base pay range for this position in Canada is $3,600 - $4,500 per month.

See the #VisierLife in action

Instagram - @visierlife

Linkedin - https://www.linkedin.com/company/visier-analytics/

Visier Candidate Privacy Notice and Recruiter Policy
Show more

Title: Playtest Analyst - Battlefield QV
Description:
Team Overview

We are a global team of creators, storytellers, technologists and so much more. At Electronic Arts, the only limit is your imagination.

We are looking for a Playtest Analyst [Quality Designer] who is passionate about data and data visualisation. Our mission is building a better game through objective analysis, and you will be challenged with telling compelling stories to our development partners using quantitative and qualitative data from internal playtests. You will report to the Playtest Director in the Experiential Quality group of Battlefield Quality Verification.

Responsibilities


You will partner with other data specialists to form the data strategy for the playtesting team.
You will collaborate with designers & development partners to identify data points to track.
You will analyse data using statistical modelling, predictive modelling, and other data analysis techniques.
You will produce reports and dashboards that support assessments of quality.
You will communicate results to designers, product managers, and others.


Required Qualifications


Bachelor's degree or equivalent professional experience.
At least 3 years of relevant experience.
Experience with SQL, Python, and ML/AI.
Experience with a variety of data visualisation tools.
A player of first person shooter games


COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs). BASE SALARY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria)
$73,200 - $101,700 CAD

In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

Title: Research Analyst
Description:
Make your next move an expert one.

At Colliers it’s not our success that sets us apart, it’s how we achieve it. Our people are passionate, take ownership and always do what’s right for our clients, people and communities.

Why Colliers?

Our enterprising environment needs your expertise to facilitate Colliers’ continued growth as an industry leader. Our nimble, decentralized culture can provide you with a wealth of opportunities to learn about our business and quickly gain experience to accelerate your career.


This position is a hybrid role (4 days in office) based out of our Vancouver, BC location.**


About You

The Research Analyst is responsible for providing a range of research and analytical support services to the Vancouver team in their market. The incumbent will provide assistance with the collection and analysis of the local commercial real estate market data to provide insights on the market and further enhance our research capability.

In this role, you will…


Prepare periodic research publications, market commentary, and other various materials including presentations, market reports, white papers on the commercial real estate market in Vancouver
Monitor industry statistics and follow trends by reading reports and staying updated on current events to lead efforts in generating research content and thought leadership pieces
Summarize and communicate analytic findings, insights and recommendations via executive-level summary documents, meetings and presentations.
Utilize database knowledge and data manipulation/query tools to manage existing Colliers’ platforms.
Assist with the review of quality control standards for the Research team and support the research and data collection function.
Actively participate and engage in meetings with the research and sales teams, building relationships within the industry.


What You’ll Bring


Undergraduate degree required. Real Estate or Business post-secondary is an asset.
2+ years’ experience in a research role. Experience in commercial real estate preferred.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including networking and relationship building ability
Intermediate proficiency of the Microsoft 365 suite including Excel, Word, PowerPoint. 
Experience in BI, data visualization and GIS tools would be an asset.
Attention to detail and an ability to meet tight deadlines without compromising quality.


Pursuant to the laws regarding job postings where the position is located in, Colliers is disclosing the following information

Area/Location Specific Vancouver, BC (Hybrid)

Approximate Salary Range for this Role $54,563.00 to $80,000.00

Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on this job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

Make your next move an expert one and join us as we lead the industry into the future.

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in Canada on a full-time basis. The employer will not sponsor applicants for work visas.

Direct applicants only please, no agencies.

Colliers is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. Colliers encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team by email at careers@colliers.com.

Title: Technical Data Analyst, Blockchain
Description:
About Us

Chainlink Labs is the primary contributing developer of Chainlink, the decentralized computing platform powering the verifiable web. Chainlink is the industry-standard platform for providing access to real-world data, offchain computation, and secure cross-chain interoperability across any blockchain. Chainlink Labs helps power verifiable applications for banking, DeFi, global trade, and gaming by collaborating with some of the world’s largest financial institutions, notably Swift, DTCC, and ANZ. Chainlink Labs also works with top Web3 teams, including Aave, Compound, GMX, Maker, and Synthetix. Chainlink Labs was ranked in Newsweek’s 100 Most Loved Workplaces 2023 in both the United States and United Kingdom.

We are looking for a skilled and motivated Data Engineer to drive the development of Chainlink’s public-facing dashboard. This dashboard will serve as a key resource for the Web3 community, showcasing metrics that highlight the performance, adoption, and impact of the Chainlink Network. The ideal candidate will have strong technical expertise in data engineering combined with a deep understanding of the blockchain and Web3 space.

In this role, you will take ownership of defining the metrics to be displayed, building the logic to calculate these metrics, and creating robust data pipelines to ensure their delivery. You’ll be responsible for the accuracy, quality, and timeliness of these metrics, while also contributing insights into how these metrics should reflect the unique aspects of the blockchain ecosystem.

Your Impact


Collaborate with stakeholders to define and prioritize metrics for the dashboard.
Build logic to calculate metrics such as transaction volume, total value secured, and staking activity.
Design and maintain ETL pipelines to process blockchain data and ensure seamless delivery to the dashboard.
Ensure high data quality and timeliness through monitoring, validation, and debugging processes.
Provide insights into blockchain-specific metrics, differentiating between concepts such as transaction volume vs. locked value and understanding diverse protocol types (e.g., perpetuals vs. lending protocols).
Act as a subject matter expert in blockchain data, helping teams interpret the difference between decentralized applications (Dapps) and smart contracts. Partnering with GTM and Marketing which makes understanding metrics and blockchain is important.


Requirements


Proven experience in data engineering, with expertise in ETL processes, cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, AWS), and tools like Apache Airflow, SQL, and Python.
Strong knowledge of blockchain fundamentals, including smart contracts, decentralized applications, and protocol types.
Familiarity with Web3 metrics, such as transaction volume, TVL (Total Value Locked), staking, and protocol usage data.
Excellent ability to collaborate across cross-functional teams, including data science, product, and engineering.
Passion for Web3, blockchain, and decentralized ecosystems.


Join our team to craft the data backbone of Chainlink’s public narrative, providing the Web3 community with the insights they need to understand and trust the value of decentralized systems!

All roles with Chainlink Labs are global and remote-based. Unless otherwise stated, we ask that you try to overlap some working hours with Eastern Standard Time (EST).

Commitment to Equal Opportunity

Chainlink Labs is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment in compliance with applicable laws, regulations, or ordinances. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us via this form.

Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants

Information collected and processed as part of your Chainlink Labs Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to our Privacy Policy. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.
Show more

Title: Analyste de données - Battlefield (poste temporaire de 9 mois) / Senior Data Analyst - Battlefield (9 month temporary)
Description:
We are excited to be looking for a senior analyst to join our Battlefield Analytics team. You will use your expertise in analytics to power in-game decisions and lead insights to improve metrics related to player acquisition, engagement, retention and gameplay experience. You will report directly to the Director of Battlefield Analytics and be a part of a future focused analytics organization.

Responsibilities


You will collaborate with our developers and operations team to establish key metrics and targets to measure performance against expectations.
You will receive questions from our partners, determine how our data can help answer them, and provide insights through reports, presentations, or dashboards.
You will lead presentations to diverse audiences including senior management.
You will help to shape and implement analytics best practices and our team vision.


Qualifications


A degree in a quantitative discipline (Analytics, Data Science, Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics)
3+ years of experience in an analytics role performing quantitative analysis with big data to help guide decisions.
1+ years of experience independently managing projects and building analysis plans with clear goals & timelines.
Expertise in big data analysis and visualization (SQL, Python, R, Looker).


Nous sommes très enthousiastes de recruter un.e analyste sénior.e pour intégrer l’équipe d’analyse de la division Battlefield dans le cadre d’un poste temporaire de 9 mois. Vous tirez parti de votre expertise en analyse pour informer les décisions intrajeu des responsables dans le but d’améliorer les indicateurs relatifs à l’acquisition, la participation, la rétention et la monétisation des joueurs ainsi qu’à l’expérience de jeu. Vous relevez du.de la directeur.trice de l’analyse de la franchise Battlefield et faites partie d’une organisation analytique tournée vers l’avenir.

Vos Responsabilités


Vous collaborez avec nos développeurs et les membres de l’équipe responsable des opérations pour définir les cibles et les indicateurs de rendement clés afin de mesurer la performance par rapport aux attentes.
Vous traitez les questions de nos partenaires, déterminez comment nos données peuvent servir à générer des réponses et vous fournissez vos observations à l’aide de rapports, présentations et tableaux de bord.
Vous animez des présentations destinées à divers auditoires, dont la haute direction.
Vous contribuez à définir et à mettre en œuvre des pratiques d'excellence en matière d’analyse de même que la vision de notre équipe.


Vos Compétences


Vous êtes titulaire d’un baccalauréat dans une discipline quantitative (analyse, science des données, commerce, statistique, mathématiques, économie).
Vous avez au moins 3 ans d’expérience dans une fonction d’analyse, réalisant des analyses quantitatives à l’aide de mégadonnées afin d’orienter les décisions.
Vous avez au moins 1 an d’expérience en gestion indépendante de projets et en établissement de plans d’analyse assortis de cibles et d’échéanciers clairs.
Vous êtes une personne experte dans l’analyse et la visualisation de mégadonnées (SQL, Python, R, Looker).


COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs). PAY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria)
$89,300 - $123,000 CAD

In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, and after 3 months of service - extended health/dental/vision coverage and basic life insurance.
Show more
HTML:
We are excited to be looking for a senior analyst to join our Battlefield Analytics team. You will use your expertise in analytics to power in-game decisions and lead insights to improve metrics related to player acquisition, engagement, retention and gameplay experience. You will report directly to the Director of Battlefield Analytics and be a part of a future focused analytics organization.

Responsibilities

  • You will collaborate with our developers and operations team to establish key metrics and targets to measure performance against expectations.
  • You will receive questions from our partners, determine how our data can help answer them, and provide insights through reports, presentations, or dashboards.
  • You will lead presentations to diverse audiences including senior management.
  • You will help to shape and implement analytics best practices and our team vision.

Qualifications

  • A degree in a quantitative discipline (Analytics, Data Science, Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics)
  • 3+ years of experience in an analytics role performing quantitative analysis with big data to help guide decisions.
  • 1+ years of experience independently managing projects and building analysis plans with clear goals & timelines.
  • Expertise in big data analysis and visualization (SQL, Python, R, Looker).

Nous sommes très enthousiastes de recruter un.e analyste sénior.e pour intégrer l’équipe d’analyse de la division Battlefield dans le cadre d’un poste temporaire de 9 mois. Vous tirez parti de votre expertise en analyse pour informer les décisions intrajeu des responsables dans le but d’améliorer les indicateurs relatifs à l’acquisition, la participation, la rétention et la monétisation des joueurs ainsi qu’à l’expérience de jeu. Vous relevez du.de la directeur.trice de l’analyse de la franchise Battlefield et faites partie d’une organisation analytique tournée vers l’avenir.

Vos Responsabilités

  • Vous collaborez avec nos développeurs et les membres de l’équipe responsable des opérations pour définir les cibles et les indicateurs de rendement clés afin de mesurer la performance par rapport aux attentes.
  • Vous traitez les questions de nos partenaires, déterminez comment nos données peuvent servir à générer des réponses et vous fournissez vos observations à l’aide de rapports, présentations et tableaux de bord.
  • Vous animez des présentations destinées à divers auditoires, dont la haute direction.
  • Vous contribuez à définir et à mettre en œuvre des pratiques d'excellence en matière d’analyse de même que la vision de notre équipe.

Vos Compétences

  • Vous êtes titulaire d’un baccalauréat dans une discipline quantitative (analyse, science des données, commerce, statistique, mathématiques, économie).
  • Vous avez au moins 3 ans d’expérience dans une fonction d’analyse, réalisant des analyses quantitatives à l’aide de mégadonnées afin d’orienter les décisions.
  • Vous avez au moins 1 an d’expérience en gestion indépendante de projets et en établissement de plans d’analyse assortis de cibles et d’échéanciers clairs.
  • Vous êtes une personne experte dans l’analyse et la visualisation de mégadonnées (SQL, Python, R, Looker).

COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs). PAY RANGES

  • British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria)
    • $89,300 - $123,000 CAD
In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, and after 3 months of service - extended health/dental/vision coverage and basic life insurance.

Title: Business Systems Analyst - Marketing Technology (Remote - Canada)
Description:
Summary

Have a passion for automation? Love working on Marketing platforms and processes? Enjoy using your creative ideas and technical knowledge to help catalyze business success? As a remote Marketing Technology Business System Analyst at Yelp, you'll have the opportunity to think creatively about how to make internal tools better, to research and evaluate new innovative solutions, to scale to support Yelp’s fast growth, and to contribute to the success of our marketing teams.

Business Systems Analysts are the drivers for all innovative and transformational projects that impact our marketers’ ability to deliver the right message, to the right customer, at the right time. On an average day, BSAs might be immersed in creating project planning artifacts, contributing to technical solution designs, collaborating with marketing leadership on their strategic goals, documenting user stories, and spec-ing out new ideas, while always improving the Yelper experience.

Our team leads and manages projects from conception through execution, forming the bridge between our business teams, product teams, and technical teams. We get excited about focusing on the business side of technical problems and finding creative solutions. Join a supportive team where you will continue to develop your skills while ensuring that Yelp has an effective and scalable platform for our business-critical departments!

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular area in Canada. We welcome applicants from throughout Canada. We’d love to have you apply, even if you don’t feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

What You'll Do


Manage, design, and improve marketing tools and processes: Oversee the development and enhancement of marketing tools and processes to drive efficiency and effectiveness.
Lead projects from conception to execution: Guide projects through all phases, including planning and scoping, research and analysis, functional design, testing, and rollout.
Planning and scoping: Collaborate with business partners to identify and refine project proposals. Develop project scope, timelines, estimates, and detailed work plans.
Analysis and design: Utilize strong analytical, problem-solving, and technical skills to understand business needs, redefine processes, and recommend best practices. Partner with technical teams to design quality, scalable solutions.
Testing and rollout: Ensure successful implementation of new processes and features. Lead change management initiatives and facilitate effective training efforts.
Vendor evaluation: Conduct research on tools, organize vendor demonstrations, and create comprehensive evaluation reports.


What It Takes To Succeed


Ideally 3+ years of business systems analyst experience.
Ideally 3+ years of hands-on, operational experience with Marketing Automation platforms like Braze, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Pardot, HubSpot or Iterable.
Clear understanding of the platform's technical capabilities and limitations.
Experience in creating presentations, workflows, roadmaps for effective project planning and requirements communications.
Skilled in driving adoption, facilitating change, and improving business results.
Strong skills in building consensus and effectively coordinating and managing projects across multiple business units and technical teams.
Exposure to and understanding of the salesforce.com platform


What You'll Get


Compensation range is $85,000-166,000 annually. Depending on your role and level, you may also be offered a bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits.
This opportunity has the option to be fully remote in all locations across Canada.
You can find more information about Yelp's five star benefits here!


Closing

At Yelp, we believe that diversity is an expression of all the unique characteristics that make us human: race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, and education — and those are just a few. We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. The foundation of our diversity efforts are closely tied to our core values, which include “Playing Well With Others” and “Authenticity.”

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other protected status.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-recruiting@yelp.com or 1-415-969-8488.

Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Recruiting and Applicant Privacy Notice

Title: Senior Risk Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Requirements

Description & Requirements

who we are

lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well. We owe our success to our innovative product, emphasis on stores, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. In particular, that includes creating an equitable, inclusive and growth-focused environment for our people.

About This Team

We believe in a culture-based and team approach to security and safety. Asset protection accomplishes this through collaboration and partnership to establish a culture of safety, honesty, and integrity. We align ourselves and our partners with the practice of gratitude and appreciation. We're responsible for all aspects of asset protection implementation in the regions, partners, and business units we support, which involves managing, coaching, developing relationships, and delivering ongoing training.

a day in the life

As a dedicated Senior Analyst specializing in Risk Intelligence, you will design and drive the Business Resilience risk sensing program to monitor, identify, and advise on emerging geopolitical events and risks that could disrupt lululemon’s business operations and achievement of strategic goals. In this role, you will manage the dissemination of critical intelligence to key stakeholders, including senior leaders and the broader Business Resilience team, to enhance awareness, enable informed decision-making, and support enterprise response activities.


Develop and implement a formal risk intelligence program by leveraging past experience and best practices.
Continuously monitor global events and emerging risks, analyzing their impact on lululemon’s strategy and operations.
Curate weekly risk intelligence digests for senior leaders to keep them informed of critical developments and triggers that may affect their business or long-term strategy.
Conduct in-depth research and analysis on specific events or business disruption risks, providing stakeholders with detailed assessments, impact forecasts, and situation updates.
Support the triaging of urgent critical events, escalating them as necessary to activate the enterprise crisis response framework.
Deliver security and safety risk assessments for travel to high-risk countries to support the Travel Security team’s monitoring and assessment efforts.


Qualifications


Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., political science, international relations, or similar).
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present to senior leaders.
Excellent research and analytical skills.
5+ years of progressive experience in a comparable position within a multinational corporation.


must haves


Acknowledge the presence of choice in every moment and take personal responsibility for your life.
Possess an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovate to achieve great results.
Communicate with honesty and kindness and create the space for others to do the same.
Lead with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure.
Foster connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships.
Integrate fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn’t take yourself too seriously.


Additional Notes

Authorization to work in Canada is required for this role.

Compensation And Benefits Package

lululemon’s compensation offerings are grounded in a pay-for-performance philosophy that recognizes exceptional individual and team performance. The typical hiring range for this position is from  $ 81,500-$107,000 CAD  annually; the base pay offered is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity. As part of our total rewards offering, permanent employees in this position may be eligible for our competitive annual bonus program, subject to program eligibility requirements.  

At Lululemon, Investing In Our People Is a Top Priority. We Believe That When Life Works, Work Works. We Strive To Be The Place Where Inclusive Leaders Come To Develop And Enable All To Be Well. Recognizing Our Teams For Their Performance And Dedication, Other Components Of Our Total Rewards Offerings Include Support Of Career Development, Wellbeing, And Personal Growth


Extended health and dental benefits, and mental health plans
Paid time off
Savings and retirement plan matching
Generous employee discount
Fitness & yoga classes
Parenthood top-up
Extensive catalog of development course offerings
People networks, mentorship programs, and leadership series (to name a few)


Note: The incentive programs, benefits, and perks have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these incentive programs, benefits, and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice.

workplace arrangement

This role is classified as Hybrid under our SSC Workplace Policy: In-person collaboration is important, and much of the role can be performed remotely. Work is performed onsite at least 3 days per week.

Title: Data Engineer (Senior Consultant)
Description:
Overview

At KPMG, you’ll join a team of diverse and dedicated problem solvers, connected by a common cause turning insight into opportunity for clients and communities around the world.

Our Vancouver team are looking for a highly motivated Data Engineer at a Senior Consultant level to join our team! As a member of KPMG Canada’s Lighthouse team, you will be dedicated to enabling and optimizing our clients' functionality across our data, analytics, and software solutions. This role will be a rewarding experience for you if you


Thrive in a growth focused environment, providing you exposure to rewarding projects that deliver impact to clients across different verticals.
Work well in a project team environment and have excellent collaboration and interpersonal skills
Have a “figure it out” mindset.


Innovate. Collaborate. Shine. Lighthouse - KPMG Canada’s Center of Excellence for data advanced analytics and AI — applies data engineering, data science, AI/ML, and software development expertise to solve real-word business problems, operationalize AI and optimize emerging technologies for its mission. Join a diverse team which is always curious and learning, thinking independently, working collaboratively, has a passion to solve difficult problems, and has fun doing it

What You Will Do

As a Senior Consultant, you’ll lead and work as part of a team of problem solvers with extensive consulting and industry experience, helping our clients solve complex business issues from strategy to implementation. Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to the following


Work with various engagement teams to understand business and gather technical data strategy and solutions for client engagements.
Participate in architecting and developing overall end-to-end design of data and analytics solutions across Data Lakes, Data Warehouses, Data Lakehouses, pipelines on modern data platforms such as Microsoft Fabric, Databricks and Snowflake (with a focus on the first two) on Azure, AWS and GCP (with a focus on the first) and lead the deployment and delivery of the solution.
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Perform data management tasks, including data architecture design and data modeling, master data/metadata/data security/privacy/data quality management, data operations, data integration and interoperability.
Develop standards for data processes and automate routine tasks.
Run queries for descriptive analytics and provide formatted result sets.
Proactively contribute to the creation of presentation materials relating to data activities for stakeholder discussions.
Create data assets for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in developing and optimizing our product into a creative industry leader.
Take ownership of projects and pushing technological boundaries.
Assist in presales, estimating and proposal writing, responding to RFPs
Establish and maintain effective working relationships with colleagues, existing clients, and prospective client organizations.
Engage in and contribute to the innovation, growth, and enhancement of KPMG Lighthouse services.


What You Bring To The Role

We will look to you to bring a blend of knowledge, training and experience, including


3+ years of experience in data engineering (supporting data/data platform architecture, design, implementation, and/or support of complex data and application architectures that are scalable and repeatable) ideally within a services/consulting organization.
Experience with relational and non-relational databases, including query language (SQL).
Experience developing and optimizing data pipelines, architectures and data models for all data types, speed, and sizes.
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data; processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Experience supporting in development of standards, processes supporting data, data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency, and workload management.
Experience manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large discrete datasets.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, parallel processing, and data lakes.
Experience deploying and maintaining high performance computing VMs in on-premises and cloud environment;
Experience using a combination of industry relevant software/tools including some of the following
Modern Data Analytics Platforms Microsoft Fabric, Synapse, Databricks, Snowflake
Big data tools Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including MS SQL Server, PostgreSQL, and Cosmos DB.
Data pipeline and workflow management tools Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc.
Azure, AWS and GCP cloud data services.
Stream-processing systems Spark-Streaming, Azure Event Hubs, etc.
Object-oriented/object function scripting languages Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.


Desired Experience, Certifications, And Abilities


Relevant post-secondary education in a related field.
Azure Certifications Azure Data Engineer Associate, Azure Solutions Architect Expert.
Databricks Certifications Databricks Certified Data Engineer Associate, Databricks Certified Professional Data Engineer
Experience in analytics, statistics, data mining, machine learning, natural language processing and/or mathematics is an asset.
Experience in visualization, visualization related technology (Tableau, PowerBI, D3, plotyldash, plotly.js) and data modeling within these tools is an asset.


KPMG BC Region Pay Range Information

The expected base salary range for this position is $71,500 to $119,000 and may be eligible for bonus awards. The determination of an applicant’s base salary within this range is based on the individual’s location, skills, & competencies, and unique qualifications. In addition, KPMG offers a comprehensive and competitive Total Rewards program.

Providing you with the support you need to be at your best

Our Values, The KPMG Way

Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters

KPMG in Canada is a proud equal opportunities employer and we are committed to creating a respectful, inclusive and barrier-free workplace that allows all of our people to reach their full potential. A diverse workforce is key to our success and we believe in bringing your whole self to work. We welcome all qualified candidates to apply and hope you will choose KPMG in Canada as your employer of choice.

Adjustments and accommodations throughout the recruitment process

At KPMG, we are committed to fostering an inclusive recruitment process where all candidates can be themselves and excel. We aim to provide a positive experience and are prepared to offer adjustments or accommodations to help you perform at your best. Adjustments (informal requests), such as extra preparation time or the option for micro breaks during interviews, and accommodations (formal requests), such as accessible communication supports or technology aids, are tailored to individual needs and role requirements. You will have the opportunity to request an adjustment or accommodation at any point throughout the recruitment process. You will have an opportunity to request an adjustment or accommodation at any point throughout the recruitment process. If you require support, please contact KPMG’s Employee Relations Service team by calling 1-888-466-4778.

  • Experience manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large discrete datasets.
  • Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, parallel processing, and data lakes.
  • Experience deploying and maintaining high performance computing VMs in on-premises and cloud environment;
  • Experience using a combination of industry relevant software/tools including some of the following
  • Modern Data Analytics Platforms Microsoft Fabric, Synapse, Databricks, Snowflake
  • Big data tools Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
  • Relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including MS SQL Server, PostgreSQL, and Cosmos DB.
  • Data pipeline and workflow management tools Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc.
  • Azure, AWS and GCP cloud data services.
  • Stream-processing systems Spark-Streaming, Azure Event Hubs, etc.
  • Object-oriented/object function scripting languages Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.

Desired Experience, Certifications, And Abilities

  • Relevant post-secondary education in a related field.
  • Azure Certifications Azure Data Engineer Associate, Azure Solutions Architect Expert.
  • Databricks Certifications Databricks Certified Data Engineer Associate, Databricks Certified Professional Data Engineer
  • Experience in analytics, statistics, data mining, machine learning, natural language processing and/or mathematics is an asset.
  • Experience in visualization, visualization related technology (Tableau, PowerBI, D3, plotyldash, plotly.js) and data modeling within these tools is an asset.

KPMG BC Region Pay Range Information

The expected base salary range for this position is $71,500 to $119,000 and may be eligible for bonus awards. The determination of an applicant’s base salary within this range is based on the individual’s location, skills, & competencies, and unique qualifications. In addition, KPMG offers a comprehensive and competitive Total Rewards program.

Providing you with the support you need to be at your best

Our Values, The KPMG Way

Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters

KPMG in Canada is a proud equal opportunities employer and we are committed to creating a respectful, inclusive and barrier-free workplace that allows all of our people to reach their full potential. A diverse workforce is key to our success and we believe in bringing your whole self to work. We welcome all qualified candidates to apply and hope you will choose KPMG in Canada as your employer of choice.

Adjustments and accommodations throughout the recruitment process

At KPMG, we are committed to fostering an inclusive recruitment process where all candidates can be themselves and excel. We aim to provide a positive experience and are prepared to offer adjustments or accommodations to help you perform at your best. Adjustments (informal requests), such as extra preparation time or the option for micro breaks during interviews, and accommodations (formal requests), such as accessible communication supports or technology aids, are tailored to individual needs and role requirements. You will have the opportunity to request an adjustment or accommodation at any point throughout the recruitment process. You will have an opportunity to request an adjustment or accommodation at any point throughout the recruitment process. If you require support, please contact KPMG’s Employee Relations Service team by calling 1-888-466-4778.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Clio is more than just a tech company–we are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice.

Summary:

What your team does:

Our data engineering team is driven to deliver an incredible experience to our customers. As a Data Engineer at Clio, you will build data pipelines and data warehouses from scratch, as well as make data sets accessible to our partner teams by writing great production code. We move quickly, work with new state of the art technologies, and are motivated by solving complex problems.

This role is available across Canada, excluding Quebec.

A day in the life might look like:


Implement data ingestion (real time and batch) using best practices in data modeling, ETL/ELT processes by leveraging AWS technologies and data tools
Design, build, and maintain data transformation pipelines consolidating various data sources (streaming or batch) into specific Data Lakes / Data Warehouses
Collaborate with engineers to help adopt best practices in data system creation, data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation
Develop prototype or "proof of concept" implementations of projects where the technical solution is unknown or unproven


What you may have:


Experience in software development as well as experience in data engineering
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS preferred, bonus for Terraform)
Proficiency in at least one major language (e.g. Python, Scala, Ruby) and SQL, the drive to write elegant and maintainable code, and desire to pick up new technologies
Experience with streaming and batch data tools: Spark, Kafka, Airflow
Data warehousing experience working with Databricks or similar
Experience building data pipelines and the infrastructure required to deploy data models and dashboards that allow data visualization
Exceptional collaboration and communication skills with the ability to derive clarity in ambiguous environments
You are a self-starter and can drive projects with minimum supervision


What you will find here:

Compensation is one of the main components of Clio’s Total Rewards Program. We have developed a series of programs and processes to ensure we are creating fair and competitive pay practices that form the foundation of our human and high-performing culture.

Some highlights of our Total Rewards program include:


Competitive, equitable salary with top-tier health benefits, dental, and vision insurance
Hybrid work environment, with expectation for local Clions (Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto, and Dublin) to be in office minimum 2 days per week on our Anchor Days.
Flexible time off policy, with an encouraged 20 days off per year.
$2000 annual counseling benefit
RRSP matching and RESP contribution
Clioversary recognition program with special acknowledgement at 3, 5, 7, and 10 years


The full salary range* for this role is $116,500 to $137,000 to $157,500 CAD.Please note there are a separate set of salary bands for other regions based on local currency.


We aim to hire all candidates between the minimum and the midpoint of the full salary range. We reserve the midpoint to the maximum of the salary band for internal employees who demonstrate sustained high performance and impact at Clio. The final offer amount for this role will be dependent on individual experience and skillset of the candidate. Please note there are a separate set of salary bands for other regions based on local currency.


Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility

Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion. We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers

Title: Analyst, Business Systems
Description:
The Opportunity:Posting ID: 27782 Position Type: Regular City: Vancouver, BC, Canada Location: Vancouver H/O - Canfor/CWPM_1000

As Business Systems Analyst you will provide direct support to the sustainment and continuous improvement initiatives of Canfor’s North American Employee Central payroll system. You will collaborate with application managed services, IT, and product vendor support in the sustainment and improvement of business systems, leveraging, technology, analytics, and process design. In your role as Business Analyst you'll your entrepreneurial spirit and highly analytical mind will come to the forefront as you collaborate, evaluate and communicate with teams and stakeholders as you influence change and deliver leading practice initiatives.

As Business Systems Analyst you will:


Support sustainment and improvement efforts of Canfor’s Human Resource Information Systems;
Develop and maintain SAP ABAP programs and employee central payroll.
Design, code, test and implement SAP modules and applications.
Work closely with functional teams to understand their requirements.
Translate functional requirements into technical specifications.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues during development and implementation.
Stay up-to-date with the latest SAP technologies and best practices.
Managing support tickets and enhancement request through the change control and release management processes.
Execute, document, and complete all required unit and system testing.
Support to various business teams in the development and roll-out of related processes, policies and ongoing training to ensure continuous improvement
Develop and execute comprehensive test plans for system upgrades or implementations
Key support role in execution of initiatives and projects across the business to ensure completion per timelines and stated objectives.
Cross-functional collaboration and communication to gather business requirements, conduct root cause analysis, and propose recommendations
Prepare project deliverables including, but not limited to, current state analysis, future state recommendations, process documentation, preparation of workshop materials, business enablement (change) plan & supporting materials, etc.
Liaise with business, vendor, and IT resources to ensure initiatives and project activities are completed per timelines and stated objectives
Coordinate project activities including but not limited to project management support, communication, organize workshops and meetings
Key support role in facilitation, evaluation of business processes and problem-solving to develop cohesive recommendations and insights for various initiatives across the organization
Facilitation services extended to various groups across the organization; including collaboration with managers, defining requirements and needs
Liaison between business, vendor, and IT in multiple areas


Education & Experience


University degree in business, technology, or process related area with a leaning towards deployment of digital transformation, innovative technologies, and continuous improvement
Minimum 5 Years’ Experience with SAP ABAP development
Strong knowledge of SAP modules and applications
Familiarity with SAP enhancement techniques such as user exists and BAdIs
Experience supporting interfaces to and from systems
Experience with SuccessFactors Employee Central Payroll, UKG Dimensions, Or Dell Boomi is an asset
Experience with testing processes and software
Background in management or digital transformation consulting is an asset
Strong business acumen


Skills And Abilities


Exceptional troubleshooting and problem-solving skills. A passion for solving technical and process issues.
Passion for seeking out innovative trends and opportunities; thinking about ways to improve business capabilities
Ability to collaborate effectively working with key IT and business stakeholders across the company
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Effective engagement with external stakeholders and consultants
Ability to engage and work effectively across layers of the organization to support and deliver on prioritized initiatives
Ability to clearly articulate messages to a variety of audiences
Strong time management and organizational skills


The salary range for this position is: $88,500.00-$110,500.00

Please Note: The range provided is for base salary only. In addition to base salary, Canfor proudly offers its employees a comprehensive and competitive total rewards package. It features programs such as performance-based incentive plans, recognition programs, benefits, paid leaves, pension plans with base and matching contributions, savings options and robust health & well-being initiatives. We also continually invest in the development of our talent to help them thrive professionally and personally. Above all, we are proud to offer our employees a value proposition that promotes diversity, equity and inclusion and fosters an environment where talent and performance is recognized and rewarded.

Don't check off every single bullet point? At Canfor, we prioritize the right fit for our organization over a strict checklist of criteria. We encourage applications from individuals whose backgrounds may not perfectly align.

Our people-focused approach prioritizes safety, embraces diversity, valuing everyone’s unique qualities. We believe that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our productivity, creativity, innovation, and competitive edge. Our recruitment process is fair and equitable, based on qualifications and experience.

We appreciate all candidates' interest but will contact only those selected for interviews. Our hiring for various positions is ongoing and includes different screening processes such as behavioral assessments, references, and criminal record checks, depending on the role and location.
